text: Bottle from Redmonds. Delightful stuff. Burnt cocoa is prominent, some malt and caramel as well. Depth is great, smooth mouthfeel as well. As your glass goes down and it takes on a bit more heat, extra layers (sweetness especially) come out...but the bitterness of this guy means it was delightful straight out the fridge, whereas I often find this style of beer really wants to be a bit warmer than its often served.
15/20 A bit like a Belgian dark beer. Lots of flavour with chocolate notes.
Aroma of coffee and malt. Taste of coffee, caramel and oak. Medium heavy body. Enjoyable.

Robe is very dark, thin white head.
Nose on caramel but with a white-y creamy note, not too sweet.
Attack is light, bubbles turn into a creamy texture immediately, body is medium. Palate on cream and caramel. Cream coats the palate. Very gourmand, and still not really sweet.
Finish is light and gourmand, bitterness is almost imperceptible.
Very nice.

Bottle. Mitchells Wines, Sheffield. Clear, dark ruby red. Tight, lasting, leggy, beige head. Nose has mix up Sunday vine fruits. Some plum stone. Some prune. Some yeasty, granary bread malts. Vinous and malty. Taste is sweet and vinous. Some light bitterness. Mouthfeel is perfect. Smooth and silky. Foamy carbonation. Dry toward the finish, with soft, fruity sweetness. Very nice.

From a Christmas case. Pours dark brown. Like malty sticky toffee pudding. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Drunk cold, it was rather one-dimensionally boozy over-roasted malt, though it improves dramatically at around 55-60 degrees. Definitely good but perhaps not on the level it appears to be (11.2 oz bottle, Tallinn)

330ml bottle from Naples supermarket pours cola brown with thin tan head. Earthy aromas of malt, dried fruit and soil. Milk chocolate, brown sugar, roasted malt, toast, cream and herbal characters. High carbonation and depth of flavour hides the 6.7% alc vol reasonably well. Long sweet finish with only a hint of bitterness. Delicious.

Aroma is alcohol, malt. Dark brown beer with beiger head. Taste is sweet malt, caramel, slight roastiness. No hops. Medium to very sweet, almost no bitterness. Excellent beer. Slightly sour aftertaste, but only slight.

Is this the best German beer? Hmm...well it's certainly pretty decent. Dark reddish brown with no head and mild carbonation. Aroma is malty, maybe a bit of banana yeasty nose. Taste is caramel malts, no bitterness, a little sweet perhaps? Flavours are definitely there in the palate 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours dark brown. Aroma of malt, fruitcake and raisen. Medium sweet with low bitterness. Rich and satisfying. Great beer.
Not a fan of Doppelbock, but this is actually a nice one. Cant really say much about it, more than its a bit sweet and quite malty.
5 oz pour on draft at CraftHouse Reston. Clear dark brown with beige head. Aromas of malt, dark fruit. Tastes of malt, brown sugar, dark fruit. Medium body with a dry finish. Nice doppelbock.

Tiefbraun, schön cremige schsumkrone, die leider nicht ewig hält. Aroma ist frisch, gräser, komplex... im hintergrund anflüge von kaffee, dunkle Schokolade, ein hauch frucht (rote beeren). Crisp! Cremiger, samtiger körper. Im abgang sehr sehr komplex, gleichzeitig ausgewogen - vor allem nicht zu süss, malz und hopfen halten sich eine tolle waage. Nachgeschmack Sauerkirschen. Wasn Ding!

Small sweet factor. Very crisp. Very approachable Think its going to be strong but then eases off.

Reviewed - A Brew With You, Ep. 40

Bottle pour into tulip glass from Manchester Wine and Liquors. Appearance is clear dark ruby red with decent sparkle, finger-width quickly dissipating foamy light brown head and no lacing. Aroma is combination of toasted malts, earth, dark fruit, hints of chocolate and coffee, mild alcohol. Taste is toasted malts with dark fruits, light chocolate, balanced with earthy bitterness. Palate is light bodied with thin texture, soft carbonation and balance of sweet and bitter, fairly dry finish. Overall, strong aroma and taste. Both complexity and balance.

Tiefdunkel, schwarzrötlich im Glas mit klebriger cremiger Schaumkrone. Sehr röstig karamelliger Antrunk, Kaffee mit Schuss, der Abgang nussig holzig. Alle Komponenten harmonieren sehr gut miteinander.

Botella en 99 Cervezas.

De intensidad media en nariz, da de inmediato notas de plátano y malta tostada, algo de ciruela seca y un puntito licoroso de fondo, así como notas a castañas. Algunas notas florales y herbales, ambas muy de fondo. Complejidad media-alta y muy agradable en nariz.

Vierte en color castaño oscuro con un punto rojizo. Bastante transparente. La espuma es de abundancia media, con burbuja pequeña y persistencia moderada, presentando también buena adherencia.

Sorprendente en boca, con un sabor muy redondo en el que tienen protagonismo principal el dulce, el amargo y un punto de acidez, aunque los tres de manera muy equilibrada y suave. Lo maravilloso de esta cerveza es que resulta muy expresiva a pesar de esa suavidad. El retro-gusto da sobre todo notas malteadas, así como de plátano, aunque sean las primeras las que dominan. Las castañas también están presentes, ayudando muy bien a redondear el conjunto.

De cuerpo medio y textura sorprendentemente frizante, resulta muy fácil de beber. No es nada cargante (como pasa con alguna otra Doppelbock de mayor fama y menos categoría). Pide enseguida dar un nuevo sorbo y cuando estos se acumulan en boca, esta se sigue sintiendo ligera. Y eso manteniendo una presencia en boca suave pero sabrosa. Persistencia media y final muy equilibrado entre dulce y seco.

Una cerveza sorprendente, muy redonda tanto en nariz como en boca y capaz de ofrecer a la vez suavidad y expresividad. Fabulosa.

F: huge, tan, long lasting.
C: dark coppery to dark, clear.
A: very malty, honey, dark malt, light buttery, toast, toffee.
T: malty, chocolate, light fruity, cherries, medium to full body, medium carbonation, very good, enjoyed. Sampled from tap @ Salon Piva in Bratislava

From tap at Salon Piva, Bratislava. Clear dark brown color with a beige head. The aroma is malty, sweet with caramel, brown sugar, ripe apples and pears. Medium to full body with a medium to medium-heavy sweetness and a light bitterness. Flavor of lightly roasted malt with notes of caramel, cacao, honey, ripe fruits, brown sugar and some noticeable alcohol.
Shared bottle at Olut Sabadell. Darkish brown bright red. Almost no carbonated. Grilled veggies aroma. Oily and creamy.

Shared bottle @OlutSabadell. Reddish brown color. Smoky sweet aroma. Subtle dark caramel and liquorice notes. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
pours like pepsi with an off white head. caramel, chewy toffee, walnuts, brown bread and cloves on the nose. Smooth with light carbonation, lots of malt and caramel. not much bitterness. lovely!
Coca cola with white head. Chocolate, hazelnuts, umami and toffee. Sweet, rich and light spicy finish. Great!

Pours dark brown to black with a tan head. Aroma and taste is roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, caramel notes, some fruits. Full body. Soft carbonation. Dry light bitter roasted finish. Nice.

Caña en Cimmeria 22..04..2017. (r3701). Color rojizo caoba oscuro, reflejos rubíes oscuros con espuma beige que se queda en corona fina al poco. Sabores tostados maltosos y cereales con toques ligeros ahumados caramelos tostados y ligeros regalices. Cuerpo ligero a medio de 6.7 vol con ligera sensación alcohólica seca y muy suave amargo final entre tostado y ahumado. Bastante buena refrescante y fácil de beber. Para repetir.

I have had a few doppelbocks in my time and never really glommed onto them cause they were always too gloopy and cloying, but this one is far from that! It pours a rich black and the nose is a malty deep dive. The flavor is impressively smooth, somewhat dry, slightly sweet, and very well balanced with just the right amount of smokiness. Plus the bottle is covered in goats and you get a cute little plastic goat knickknack to cherish till the end of days (coming very soon! lol). Good for jamming to some sweet Jerry jams from 77 before endeavoring upon an evening of cuddles and audio-visual entertainments!

Brown body with Ruby hue, 1 finger white head disappearing quickly.
Aroma is some chocolate, light roastiness, some sweet tones, fruitiness.
Sweet opening, balanced afterwards. Very good finish.
Mouthfeel is medium with medium carbonation. Creamy mouthfeel.

Had the beer as part of the Saveur Bière easter set. The beer looks delicious. The color of the beer is a very dark brown. On the naked eye it almost looks black. A strong light reveals a nice nice dark amber glow. Nice. On top of the beer a nice rough layer of greyish-brown foam. The majority of the foam collapses rather quickly, leaving a thin drape. Nice. 
The smell of the beer is also nice. It is a proper bockbier. I smell nice rather sweet malt aromas, a bit bready even. There is also a nice aroma of syrup, plums, caramel and toffee and some alcohol. The smell is very warming. The smell is quite sweet, because of the strong lovely malt aromas, but there also is a nice slight bitterness of the hops. I also smell a nice yeasty touch, giving a certain doughiness. The smell of the beer gets stronger after the beer warms up. Where it was quite mild at the start, it is very warming and rich at the end.
The taste of the beer also is nice. It contains a lovely warm maltiness. I taste plums, dark fruit, toffee, syrup, brown sugar and caramel. It tastes very full. I like the nice bitter hoppy touch. Not clear hops, but a nice bitter touch to break the mainly sweet flavours. The beer also contains a nice alcohol flavour. Very nice flavour. It is rich and sweet and full. Even though the beer is mainly sweet, it is not to sweet. The hop bitterness is able to balance out the sweetness perfectly. Very well done. I understand this beer is number one in its style. 
The palate of the beer is nice. Full body, smooth texture and a nice medium high bitterness. The finish is nice, and contains a lovely alcohol warmth and a nice hoppy bitterness, to balance out the sweets an extra time. Very well done.

From old tasting notes. Translucent deep reddish brown color. Moderate tan head. Delicious sweet roasted malt aroma. Cloyingly sweet roasted malt flavor is rich and smooth, with subtle dark caramel notes. Some spruce hops in finish. Dry aftertaste. Rich, full bodied and complex.
Robe brune mousse écrue. Nez malt, raisin, café. Bouche malt, café, fruits noirs. Superbe.

Découverte dans la Saveur Box. Bière très foncée avec une mousse beige foncée. Arômes de café et de malte. Très douce et la mousse crémeuse en bouche. Bière délicate très savoureuse. Superbe découverte.

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2017 Poured from beautiful bottle hung with cute goat to tulip glass.  Complex malty aroma with dark bread and slight chocolate. Clear brown-red appearance with nice head. Flavor is smooth grainy bread and hint of chocolate . Very nice hop bitterness despite the overarching malt complexity. So special yet so drinkable.

Bottle. Dark brown, nearly black. Small head. Aroma of dark fruits, figs and coffee. Taste of roasted malts, liquorice, dark chocolate and stone fruits. Hoppy bitterness in the aftertaste. Medium to strong carbonation. Creamy. Very balanced and almost easy drinking. Marvellous.
33cl bottle purchased @ La caisse de bières. La robe sombre laisse place à de beaux arômes fruités.

Served from 330 mL bottle into glass at home. Pours deep brown with a reddish hue, practically opaque with small tan head. Some legs are noticeable on the glass after movement. Strong malty aroma with dark fruit and hints of chocolate and coffee. No detectable hop aroma. More malt and dark fruit flavor and even stronger chocolate, creating a kind of chocolate covered raisin flavor. The dark fruit is definitely not overpowering, in fact the flavor is almost ephemeral: disappearing from the pallet quickly after finishing. No hop flavor is detectable. The finish itself is somewhat sweet but not cloying, with very low bitterness and a small amount of alcohol flavor. Medium full body with low carbonation. Overall this beer is full of rich dark flavor with the smooth crisp clean lager quality expected from a century old German brewer. This beer is very enjoyable, easily drinkable despite the strong flavor and a perfect example of the style.

Bottle 330ml. Deep brown with a dense offwhite head. Fruity ripe bananas and caramel. Taste is very complex with malts, raisins, vanilla, and some light alcohol notes. Finishes with some discrete hops.
UPDATED: MAY 13, 2017 Wow! beautiful color. Nice aroma. Palate, yeh whatever. Taste, FANTASTIC. What else does anyone need to know? Great Beer!!!!!!!
Helder kastanjebruin met bescheiden kraag. Zoet en licht bitter. Karamel, mout, suiker, zeer licht rokerig. Zacht, fijne film. Lekker bier!
vol mouten met een gloed bitter en een rand zuur met de zacht vrij komende co2 en volle esters proef je gekaremeliseerde suikers vol van smaak en toch niet te heftig topper
Mörk. Skum som lägger sig. Luktar lite brännt. Mild och len. Inte mycket alkoholsmak. Lite kaffe, brännt. Bra.

Drinking from tab. 
 In the aroma alcohol, roast malt and nuts. 
The clear brown beer has a medium off white head. 
In the taste chocolate and roast malt. 
Medium carbonated.

Aroma: caramel, bread, cane sugar, toast, dried fruits
Taste: medium sweet, caramel, dried fruits, bread, toast, some red fruits notes
Mahogany color, small white head. Sweet aromas of caramel, brown sugar, dried fruits, syrup and malt. Sweet taste of dates, raisins, sugar, bread and alcohol with a slight bitter finish.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2017 Two bottles - Ayinger Celebrator and Winterbock - thanks to SinH4. 

Winterbock: 8/4/9/5/16 // Total of 4.2 - Pours a dark, reddish brown with a medium, creamy, beige head. Promising aroma of red berries and dark malt, without being too roasty. Deep, fruity coffee notes, and hints of toffee, woody, hazelnut. A bit of alcohol in the back, but not boozy. Taste is lightly sweet, lightly bitter. Straight and very well balanced. Silky, slender medium body with soft carbonation. An excellent brew. Feels almost light. Very smooth and just expertly balanced. Great.

Celebrator: 7/4/8/3/13 // Total of 3.5 - Identical in terms of appearance, different in aroma, taste and palate. Aroma is more "preserved", not as fresh as the Winterbock. Raisins and nuts, strong coffee, more roast, less woody. Stronger notes of alcohol. Medium sweetness with light bitterness in the finish. Carbonation is harder, body is less smooth. Feels just as light, but also thinner than the Winterbock. I prefer the latter.

330 ml bottle in abbey glass. Dark brown/dark red/black colour, beige head. Coffee, caramel, heavy roasted malt, dark bread, dark chocolate. Taste very balanced, not too sweet and not too bitter. Alcohol well hidden. Carbonation soft. Full body. Oily texture. Great!

the aroma is caramel and fruity with hints of vanilla, toffee, brown sugar, nuts and candy... the taste is caramel and fruity with notes of toffee, burnt sugar, dried plum, vanilla and dark fruits... sweet and dry aftertaste...

Data ważności:  09.2017 
 Kolor:  Brązowy. W 100% klarowny trunek. 
 Piana:  Żółto-kremowa, drobnoziarenkowa, przekształca się w duże i średnie ziarenka.
Opada dość szybko. Na szczęście gruby kołnierzyk pozostaje nad piwem. Po przechyleniu kufelka pozostają na jego ściankach liczne zacieki. Ostania warstewka cały czas wisi nad piwem. 
 Zapach:  Aromat jest bardzo przyjemny. Na początku intensywna czekolada, ciasteczka kruche, odrobina melasy.
Troszeczkę niżej w hierarchii - nutki melanoidowe (tosty, przypieczona skórka od chleba, ciemne pieczywo).
Z dalej po nosie biją także niuanse przypominające ciastko typu brownie i odrobinę orzechów laskowych.
Jest słodko i zachęcająco. 
 Smak:  W smaku melanoidy budują zdecydowaną słodową bazę. Dominuje ciemne pieczywo, tosty, toffi i odrobina karmelu. 
Nie brakuje nut kruchych ciasteczek i odrobiny mlecznej czekolady.
Piwo ma sporo ciała i dość wysokie wysycenie.
Goryczka jest średniej maści, półwytrawny finisz.
Na końcu języka pojawia się posmak orzechów włoskich.
Niby nie ma szału, nic nadzwyczajnego, ale mój kufelek jest już pusty.
Na tym polega siła Celebratora! 
 Wysycenie:  Wysokie.
 Podsumowanie:  

Celebrator to najlepszy Doppelbock na świecie.
Uwarzony przez browar Ayinger z miejscowości o tej samej nazwie - Aying.

Siła tego piwa polega na tym, że niby niczym szczególnym nie zaskakuje, ot taki nudny styl Doppelbock, a pijalność ma ogromną.
Okazuje się jednak, że ten na pozór nudny styl może być ciekawy.
Celebrator wydaje się nie wprowadzać w stan uniesienia, ale znika ze szkła nieprawdopodobnie szybko.
Piwo napompowane jest stylowymi elementami takimi jak: czekolada, melanoidy, tosty, ciemne pieczywo, przypieczona skorka chlebowa, toffi, karmel, orzechy.
Bogaty smakowo, doskonale zbalansowany, prawidłowo skrojony Koźlak Dubeltowy .
Helt svart med kompakt hvitt skum. Intenst duftbilde med mye kaffe og noe fruktighet. Mye det samme i smaken. Fløyelsmyke!

Thanks YantarCoast. Murky deep chestnut brown. Moderate ivory head. Big caramel, brown bread, dark fruit, vinous notes on nose. Medium to full body. Rich malty taste. Complex. Caramel, very vinous still not that boozy. Dried fruit. Light bitterness. Very good-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle from systembolaget. A nice aroma of red wine, spiced red cabbage and Christmas. Foam quickly dissipates. I must say, it is obviously a quality beer but Im not such a fan. I find that it would be better with a little less Abv, it is a bit rough in the palate for what is supposedly a light beer style (personal preference ofc). A good experience in any case.

Tap @Barley Mow, Bristol.
Dark brown/red colour, nice off-white head, good lacing
Aroma of toffee, roasted malts, bit of nuts.
Lightly sweet with a bit of bitterness.
Full body
Average carbonation
Drinkable, balanced, excellent for a cold winter evening.

33 cl bottle. Creamy off-white medium head. Deep brown/red color.Malts, toffee and licorice. Roast, nuts, dried fruits, coffee ,rye bread, bitter cocoa and booze. Full body. Complex and full of flavor.

Very dark brown, good and quite dense mocha head shows decent persistence and very nice lacing. Malty aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, and maybe slight ashes. Not too vivid. Taste strikes a good balance of sweetness and bitterness (notes are of caramel, roasted malts, hazelnut, chocolate, coffee). Slightly warming but the alcohol is perfectly hidden. Finish is slightly on the bitter side and sure much more so than the average dunkler bock/doppelbock. Medium bodied with light carbonation, slighty creamy; kind of feels like it could use a bit more body. Very much ok and enjoyable, maybe not reaching perfect roundness.
Темный хлеб, карамел& дрожжи
Niemiecki Top. Zapach kawy, kawy z mlekiem. Skutkami z ciemnego pieczywa. Zapach niezbyt intensywny. Piwo treściwe i gęste. Wyraźna paloność i kawa. Średnia goryczka. Porządny kozioł.
Mörkbrun öl med ett lätt smutsvitt skum. Doft och smak av malt, karamell, mörk kola, mörkt socker, mörkt bröd och lätt kryddighet.
Цвет тёмно-ме В аромате карамел& и чёрный хлеб. Вкус солодов& поджаре&
12 oz bottle Light brown off white head. Medium body. Very smooth with a fine carbonation tastes of sweet tea, raisins, malts, strong, toffee, caramel & slightly chocolatey very boozy.
Bier geprobeerd bij uniek in Beek en Donk met LiekevdV. Het heeft een lekkere haast dropachtige afdronk

Espuma prominente marrón-beige que permanece bastante bien durante la cata, color marrón oscuro casi negro con destellos rojizos a contraluz, aroma tostado y dulce en nariz, sabor rico, donde se aprecian en un inicio las notas tostadas finalizando un un regusto sabroso y ligeramente amargo.
Botella 33cl Vivalabirra (Regalo Sara y Luís) Aunque no es un estilo que me atraiga mucho la verdad que es una buena cerveza, fuerte en sabor pero facil de beber, muy buena cerveza en general

Light brown creamy head soon left a collar & skim on a dark oak coloured, finely effervescent body.
Dundee cake, dark fruit, malt & demerara sugar aroma.
Medium body. Very smooth with a fine carbonation prickling the tongue. Slightly cloying.
Very rich tastes of sweet tea, raisins, christmas pudding, malts, strong, toffee, caramel & slightly chocolatey - big alcohol presence.

Butelka 0,33l. Ładna piana, mahoniowa barwa. W aromacie skórka od chleba, karmel. Bez wad, ale aromat jest bardzo delikatny. W smaku dość płasko, karmel, chleb. Krótki, słodowy posmak. Ładny, plastikowy koziołek.
nutty, bready, roasty, nice decent mouth feel. not too thick. Strong but very well balanced. Was expecting a little bit more from this considering its #1 in the world

Ar: Soczyscie, swiezy ciemny chleb, karmel, slodowo, klasa-stylowo, ale mnie nie rusza, slodko.
Wyg: Czarny, nieprzejezysty, piana bezowa, fajna drobnoziarnista, super etykieta, fajny plastikowy koziolek.w formie zawieszki na butelce.
Sm: Przypalony karmel, dosc mocna goryczka, palona, soczysty, bogaty w aromaty, ale troche wodniscie i plasko. Wysycenie niskie, slod, karmel. Wrazenie, ze pili sie wiele takich piw. Stylowo, ale bez szalu.
Pos: Slodowosc, chleb (skorka), palony karmel, zalegajaca przypalona goryczka. 
 Z czym do ludu ?!? To ma byc Top 1 w Reichu, wtf?!? Wielkie rozczarowanie. Pada ofiara oczekiwan, zdaje sie przecietne. Koronny dowod, ze po prostu nie lubie doppelbockow.

Roasted malt aroma and taste, mildly sweet, may be some chocolate . . . I would give Ayinger a slight edge over Troegs Troegenator in that it has only a very slightly thicker body and it poured with a better head.
Bottle from Bradleys Cork Outstanding. World Class. Pour dark low hop great malt finish. Great beer .
Bottle. Full body, velvet sweet in a classic sample of german style. great experience.

Merci à Guillaume pour le partage! Robe bien sombre teintée de reflets rouges pourpres. Sur ce liquide, flotte une fine pellicule dun blanc cassé qui ne me quitte pas. Arômes de fruits noirs et de tabac. De la datte confite, du sucre, des malts chocolatés et à peine grillés. Profondeur très plaisante reposant sur un important sucre mal dissimulé. en bouche le tabac se manifeste de plus belle. Pointe damertume au bout de la langue alors que le liquide sucré me coule chaleureusement au fond de la gorge. Belle longueur fruitée, sucrée et pleine de tabac. Très belle représentante du style!
Pours a watery light brown, aroma is roasted malt, chocolate and dark fruit. Flavour similar, with a fair amount of sweetness in there, dry fruity aftertaste.

Bottle @ home. Aroma of heavy malt, caramel, light roasted. Clear dark brown with off-white head, mostly diminishing. Taste is moderate sweet and light bitter. Full body, thick oily feel and sweet caramel finish.
Bastante buena, pero le echo en falta matices. La encuentro muy plana, aunque con bastante cuerpo.
UPDATED: DEC 13, 2016 Não sou entusiasta de cervejas do estilo, mas essa é deliciosa. Espuma cremosa e sabor diferenciado.

Mahagany coloured beer with a big, fine, cappuccino coloured, good lasting head. Aromas of faint gammon, chocolate, spicy schnaps-like fruitiness (maybe small yellow plums), malt, brown cake, toffee, alcohol, bit earthiness, faint herbal hops. Taste medium sweet and light bitter, chocolate, espresso and smoke, dry in finish. Mealy texture, soft carbonation, medium full body. Very good but not groundbreaking to be honest. Easy to drink like advertised.
Pours dark brown with large beige head. Aroma is malty with caramel. Taste has strong malts, dried fruit, yeast and some roastiness.

Bottle. Clear dark brown color, beige head. Earthy chocolate and coffee aromas. Has a nice sweet, but not ethanolic taste, fades nicely into a balanced bitterness. Low, fine carbonation, thick and oily texture. Mighty malty, toffee, coffee chocolate aftertaste.

Poured from a 500 ML bottle into a pint glass at the World of Beer in Columbia, SC. The appearance is a black color with hints of red and has a medium sized tan head. The aroma is all malt, and that is wonderful. The taste matches the smell. An outstanding beer.

Bottle was behind the sixth door of by beer advent calendar.
Appearance: Clear, dark brown liquid with a nice beige head, that is a bit coarse.
Aroma: Malty and roasty aromas with hints of dark chocolate and coffee. Also a bit fruity and a little bit earthy.
Taste: A good sweetness at first, which gets more and more pronounced, until it is supplemented by a subtle bitterness.
Palate: Full body with an oily texture, average carbonation and a medium finish.
Overall: A very good dark beer with good aromas and an excellent balance between sweetness and bitterness.

Pours a dark brown colour with red hints when held to the light. Big off white head with good retention and lace. ARoma of dark fruits, plums, molasses, roasted malts, coffee. Medium body, creamy palate, carb onation is good. Taste is a bit smoky, coffee, plums, caramel. Alcohol is noticeable. Good one.

At Café with the parents of my girlfriend taster dark brown colored body with a off white head and a roasted malt spicy fruity hop aroma a roasted malt hops herby caramel chocolate sweet alcholic bitter taste with a alcholic bitter finish

Отлично& темное пиво, хороший солодов& аромат и сбаланс& мягкий плотный вкус, горчинк& почти нет! Пьется легко и приятно. Приколь& статуэт& козлика на бутылке висит). Дата розлива 05.05.2016 (Bottle 0,33/ 6,7%)

Zusammen mit der fast weinig anmutenden kastanienbraunen Optik, sind die röstig angepflaumten Aromen schon sehr gentlemanlike. Der Trunk verbindet ebenfalls geschickt verschiedene Flavours und Eindrücke miteinander. Zuerst noch säuerlich schlank, mit angedeuteten Holznoten, dann ein Hauch Sirupsüße und zum Finale interessant angeraucht bitter. Cooler Drink. 0,33l Flasche von CITTI Kiel 😕...ich schäme mich. Ca. 1,50.
Dark amber with off white head - Malt aroma with caramel and hints of roasted malt - Roasted body with caramel and some coffee hints - Roasted malt finish - This was nice

Pours dark brown with a brown head. The head retention is good and there are ruby highlights in the color as well. There are significant malt aromas the reflect Maillard and toast. There is also alcohol that is noticeable and a wee bit of chocolate. There are flavors that are reflective of Maillard and toast. Hints of chocolate are present as well. There is a very slight herbal quality as well. Although the beer has some strength and alcohol warming, it is extremely smooth. Overall, this is a malt driven lager with some strength and a prime example of what a doppelbock should be.
Siirappinen, mutta ei liian makea. Jopa hieman kotikaljamainen maku. Hyvin paahtoa, suolaa, savua ja mämmiä. Jälkimakua sopivasti kitkerä ja öljyinen.

Whiffs of yeasty bread, dark fruit, and toasted malts. Chewy, warming, notes of fig and plums, with a little bit of spice on the finish. Incredibly smooth beverage. Just enough hops and carbonation to keep this from getting cloying. Fantastic winter warmer.

Bottle from The Liquor Store Inc. Pours a rich, deep brown with a small head that lingers. Big sorghum nose, with some faint smoke. Ham and dark toffee, cacao nibs. Roasty but still feels light. Full flavored, but so drinkable. Dry, cacao finish.
Bottle. Brown colour with beige head. Malt, nuts, caramel and roasted aroma. Sweet, roasted, caramel, malt, nuts, raisin taste. Medium body.

Dun beau marron foncé, une mousse couleur mocha tient en place. Un nez de caramel et de fruits secs; dattes, raisins et figues et des épices variées et nombreuses. Les saveurs sont exquises et subtiles. Cest fruité, herbacé, sucré par du miel de sarrasin et une légère amertume qui sapparente aux figues fraîches. Une belle uniformité. (L6007 01.17) (161116)
Inkább stout ez nekem mint doppelbock. Számomra tökéletesen indifferens, abszólút NEM izgalmas sör.

33cl bottle at home. Appearance: Dark brown with a ruby red glow and medium beige head. Aroma: rye bread, toffee, coffee, bread, plums, raisins. Taste: high sweetness and fairly high bitterness. Notes of dark roasted malts, espresso, brown sugar, hops, licorice and some dried red fruits. Finish is bitter and roasty.
Palate: medium bodied, sticky texture and lively carbonation.

Bottle 
Dark brown, off white 
Aroma of oak, smoke light 
Taste dark syrup, quite nice texture and feel. Some sweetness and bitterness

Mörkt rubinröd med beiget skum. Rejält maltig doft med mörkt bröd och torkad frukt (dadlar och fikon) och lite choklad. Smaken är maffigt söt med mycket mörkt bröd och torkad frukt (här finns även russin), apelsinskal, kryddnejlika, lite rostade toner och det hela avslutas med en fint balanserande beska.
De Klomp 29/10 -16

Cuivre tres sombre, belle carbo, gros collet persistant
Aromes delicats de caramel, fruits confits, sucre candy
Toute en délicatesse, une fois encore, mince et pourtant enveloppante de ses saveurs caramel en finale plutôt longue. Notes liquoreuses legeres.
Tres bel equilibre general

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2017 0.33l bottle with a goat from marktkauf/edeka. pours a clear dark chestnut with a steady beige head. aroma of caramel, toasted malts, tobacco, leather. flavour of caramel, leather, tobacco, leaves, plums. full body, long bittersweet finish. nice and complex.

Beautiful nose. Smells almost like the finest Vino Santo from Chianti. Deep aromas of dried fruit, tabacco, coffee. Disappointing visual aspects. Was expecting some fluffy tan head. There was none. Nice flavor that echoes more the leather/tabacco aromas than the fruit.

Keg. Pours Black with a spooky thin white foam subsiding average to a residual. Scent is light brown sugar. Taste is medium dense doppelbock yeast with a familiar leather like body. Smoke and fruits are hinted here. Some strange aftertastes of berries, sour candy, dark roasted malt. I could go on. Finish is a bit dry and actually papery. Excellent.
Aromas of plums, raisin skin, and balsamic vinegar. Taste is raisin skin, dates, plums, toffee, bready malts,a touch of chocolate syrup and star anise, and nice earthy leaf hops on the finish.

0,33l bottle. Pours red tinted dark brown with lasting tan head. Aroma is rich, sweet bread, roast malt, dried fruit, prunes, caramel, some nuts, subtle earthiness. Its medium sweet with light bitterness. Alcohol is present, but far from unpleasant, its well balanced with caramel, roasty malt, toffee flavor. Despite its rich flavor body is surprisingly light, creamy texture, carbonation is soft. Finish is quite dry. Brilliant!

330ml bottle BB Jun 17 from Getränke Oase, Munich. Deep cola brown with nice persistent fluffy tan head that lasts throughout drinking and leaves nice lacing. Aromas of caramel, roast beef and licorice. The taste has a decadent caramel and crusty bread maltiness, light earthy and spicy hoppiness, a little meatiness, some anise and hint of smoke. Full bodied, moderate carbonation. Absolutely lives up to the hype, simply outstanding.

330 ml bottle. Pours dark reddish, brown with a creamy coloured smooth head which retains and laces as good as any beer I have had. The aroma is fruit, chocolate and some yeast. The taste is medium sweet, some unami and barely bitter at all. Velvety smooth and softly carbonated on the palate. Really good.

Flasche 0,33l: Kastanienbraun, Schwarz, glasklar, kräftiger stabiler feinporiger beiger Schaum; tiefe dunkle Süße in der Nase, komplex, Malzzucker, dunkle Früchte, Backpflaumen, Röstaromen, Karamell, dunkle Schokolade, Kaffee; im Körper kräftige dunkle Süße, Malzzucker, kräftige Röstaromen, dunkle Schokolade, Kaffee, sehr cremig, deutliche Kohlensäure, dunkle Fruchtigkeit, eingelegte Früchte, Karamell; langer leicht süßlicher Nachgang mit kräftigen Röstaromen

I guess Im not a fan of the bocks...caramel, syrup, bread, dried fruits and too much black liquorice for my liking. Not my fav type of beer but others seem to disagree with this being #1 Worth trying

33cl bottle from SB.
Dark brown with some red. Clear. Tanned head. Lace.
Sweet rich roasty malty aroma with rye bread, coffee and chocolate and mild smoke. Earthy, sweet and rich with mild notes of plum and dried fruits.
Taste is sweet with lots of roasty caramel and dark bread with plum and coffee. Earthy rich malty finish with some hops.
Big body with soft carbonation and oily texture.
Lovely rich malty beer!

Friday evening out celebrating birthdays with the family at Riders BBQ.  Owner told beer supplier he didnt care what they brought as long as they had a case of double bock.  An excellent choice.  A recommendation.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Color Coca-Cola con reflejos rojos y capa de espuma marrón de un dedo de grosor (buena retención). Carbonatación mínima. Aroma a malta tostada y chocolate, también algo ahumado. Sabor a malta tostada, mucho chocolate, algo frutal... Amargor final interesante. Cuerpo medio. Buena.

330mL bottle from Whole Foods (Charlottesville, VA). Aromas of raisin, dried cherry, earthy spice. Hazy mahogany with a somewhat lasting off-white head. Sweet, earthy, dried fruit flavors. Full bodied, a little sticky.

Appearance Pours a clear dark brown, with a small beige head that dissipates quickly. 
Aroma Coffee, liquorice, sweet malts, molasses, dried fruits, leather, toffee 
Taste Medium-high sweetness, with a dry finish and a perfectly rounded bitterness 
Palate Medium body, low carbonation

This one had awesome chocolate, coffee, molasses notes with a touch of mushroomy earthiness. This is accompanied with full dried fruit flavours. Prune, Raisin, date and even fig come through. It's a dark rich brown colour. Medium short finish with a medium full body. The malt really carries itself here while the hops are very low. It would be great paired with a medium sweet dessert such as ginger snap cookies, or a washed rind blue cheese. Game meats!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ein wirklich leckeres Bier mit sehr großer Bandbreite. Der Schaum allerdings hat enttäuscht. Die Farbe nett. Das alles allerdings macht der Geschmack bei weitem wieder gut. Sehr gehaltvoll.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Pours a medium brown color with a thin tan ring of foam. Somewhat thin body. Very light, smooth malty taste with some hints of earth and wood. Not bad but not really what I expected. OK but not great.

[backlog] 24-12-15 / bottle at home. Darb borwn with creamy white head. Strong malt base. Dried fruits.I started rating my beers with Untappd and a few basic notes. Now I want to rate them on ratebeer. So my rating sometimes lack some information. Just ignore it, it is for my personal statistics. Untappd-Rating 4/5

Cant believe ive never rated this one as it is one my favs. Pours murky brown colour. Nice yeasty and estery with burnt caramel aroma that goes chocolate and raisin like once it opens up. Good complexity and very balanced, not too sweet and not dry. Good length and molasses flavours with a touch that dry up the palate. Great beer.

- schwarz-braune Farbe mit guter Schaumbildung
- schöne Aromen nach Malz, Karamell, Rosinen und etwas Kaffee
- absolut perfekte Carbonisierung
- der Antrunk überrascht, da im Gegensatz zu anderen Bockbieren die
 Süße nicht dominant ist
- der 2. Geschmack ist eine angenehme, gut wahrnehmbare Würzigkeit
- danach kommt etwas Schokolade und Haselnuss hinzu
- im Abgang malzig bitter = perfekt
Fazit: Dunkler Doppelbock in Perfektion.

33 cl bottle from SB. Pours black with beige big head. Lots of roasted coffe, caramel, chocolate armoa. Malt, raisin, dried fruit. A bit fruitiness comes in the taste, light sweet. Light body, a bit creamy with dry bitter finish. Tasty.

UPDATED: AUG 23, 2016 Bottle From hopfen und Malz in Berlin. Pours dark Red. smells of Sweet spice with hints of caramell. Great full typical dark beer taste. In the aftertaste it has the reminescence of soggy cornflakes. A great doppelbock

Pours an average size tan head. Has a dark brown appearance, almost black. Has good lacing and average retention. Dark roasted malt aromas dominate, sort of yeast with some cocoa. Flavours are thick and rich in dark malts, with mochaa and coffee notes. Seems like alcohol is faintly noticeable. A hint of chocolate rounds out the whole. Mouthfeel is average. has some bitterness and has a bit of spicy notes in aftertaste. Pretty good stuff.

Dunkelbraun, fast schwarz, leicht rötlich schimmernd. Der Geruch erinnert fast an ein Porter, für einen Doppelbock recht leicht. Schöne leicht süßliche Röstmalzaromen, allen voran dunkle Schokolade und Brot. Sehr cremiger weicher Körper. Zunächst sehr malzig aromatisch (Schokolade, Brot, getrocknete Früchte), dann alkoholisch wärmend und schließlich mit einer Röstbittere abklingend.
Tolles Bier!

Dark, bordering on black. Aroma of burnt caramel, coffee and roasted, bready malt. Taste of dried fruit, cocoa and coffee bean. Accompanied by a soft caramel sweetness and some lingering bitterness towards the end. Very balanced. Palate is oily with less than medium carbonation which for this style is quite fitting. One of the few doppelbocks you can drink more than two in one sitting. Or three.

Bottle
Aroma-dark fruits
Appearance-ruby, clear, white foam, 
Taste-medium sourness, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, lively, long finish, 
Overall-very interesting

Hyvin tumma olut. Ruskeaa vaahtoa kohtalaisesti, jättää hieman pitsiä. Tuoksussa jonkinlaista vihannesmaisuutta, joka ei oikein toimi. Tähän nokkaan joka tapauksessa aika mieto tuoksu. Maku paahtuneen maltainen ja makea. Runkoa löytyy, ja tämä on aika hyvin balanssissa.

Bottle shared with Simonsen at Hvaler
Pours dark brown with a thick tanned head. Perfect look! Smell of dark malts, toffee, hints of toast and dried fruits, quite inviting. Medium sweet, hints of nuts, alot of dark delicious malt flavors, chocolate and toffee. Just a very good bock beer!

Ayingers Celebrator is supposedly the best they come in this style. Its dark in colour and looks like cola, but you can see that its actually a beautiful ruby red where the light shines through. In the aroma, I picked up on primarily prunes, raisins, dried fruit in general, as well as molasses/brown sugar. Beneath this is a mixture of bread, malts, honey, and caramel. It produced a two finger beige coloured head. The taste definitely reminded me of prunes, dried fruit, blackcurrant, nuts too and cocoa in the background. It has a mature, thick sweetness especially on entrance and goes into a roasty bitterness. Quite tingley at the end which leaves a smokey savoury-ness after swallowing. Though its not my personal favourite flavour palate, I have to say that its really very good. Can definitely see how this is a nice choice to serve on an occasion.
Deep dark brown with big brown head. Aroma is chocolate, roasted malt and coffee. Taste is cocoa, coffee and caramel
Pours clear dark brown. Aroma is malty, caramel, bread. Taste is malty, sweet, lots of caramel, cmplex and balanced.

Pours a very deep copper body with a tan, short-lived head that doesnt stick to the glass. There is far more chocolate in the strong aroma than Im used to in doppelbocks, its almost porter-like. Also dark caramel, roasted malt and dark dried fruits. Strong flavour of chocolate, dark caramel, dark dried fruits, and dry and dark roasted malt. Moderate sweet taste with a fairly long-lasting light to moderate bitter finish. Full body, creamy and smooth texture, quite soft carbonation. A nice brew that is drier than your average doppelbock, and maybe a bit less sweet. 
[33 cl bottle, enjoyed 4 months before BB date, from Systembolaget Kungshamn, Sweden]
Bottle - no label taken - pours dark brown - nose/taste of lightly smoked caramel, brown sugar, dark bread toast and touch of dark fruit - medium body
Dark brown color with foam ring. Caramel sweetness and licorice in the nose. Licorice bread with a creamy caramel sweet taste. Calm dark caramel sweet aftertaste.

DWF; Bottle 0,33 1., take away from Systembolaget, Karlstad. My No. 1400. Pours large, dark brown with a lasting, lacing tan head. Aroma is moderate to heavy, toasted malt, dark bread, caramel, light prunes and spice. Taste is moderate to heavy sweet and light bitter with a spiced dark dried fruit, light warming, lasting finish. Body is medium, texture is oily to thick, carbonation is soft.

Pours a nice rich brown with a thick khaki head that quickly dissipates leaving a fine white ring around the edge of the beer. Aroma of oak and vanilla and plums and cherries and brown sugar all in the mouth too. A bit of alcohol burn too. Good beer.
Bottle from Alko. Pours reddish dark brown with small tan head. Aroma has sweet maltiness, dark fruits and brown sugar. Taste is quite the same with notes of licorice and dark bread. Good one!
Cerveja boa. Vale a pena tomar maltada e no estilo. Boa para dias frios e com carne ou embutidos.

0,33 l Flasche aus def Bierothek in Fürth. Esspressobraun, lichtabsorbierend, mit bräunlicher, cremiger Krone, leicht ölig. Riecht nach Toffee, Malz, Brot, Getreide. Im Geschmack starke Röstaromen, Kaffee, dunkle Schokolade.
33 cl från systembolaget som jag fick av Anders. En mycket trevlig tysk bekantskap.

Aromat intensywny, słód, karmel, toffi, przypalona skórka od chleba, czekolada. Kolor ciemnobrązowy, klarowne. Piana średnio obfita, drobno i średniopęcherzykowa, trwała, zdobi szkło. W smaku słodkie, średnia pełnia, słód, karmel, kawa, chleb, suszone owoce, czekolada. Goryczka niska, wysycenie średnie.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with red tones. Aroma is malt, caramel and sweet malts. The taste also includes licorice and a very light smoked notes hidden there also. A very good doppelbock. A super beer!!

Poured from an 11.2 oz bottle. The color is dark brown with a reddish hue looking somewhat like cola. A tan head leaves nice lacing on the glass. Aroma is fruity with mild roasted malt. Sweet with a lightly bitter and dry finish. Hint of alcohol present. Soft carbonation, thick and creamy on the palate.

Pours a very deep reddish brown and clear with a nice tan head. Nose is a lot of candy with brown sugar and licorice leading the way ahead of some bread. Flavor is similar but not quite as sweet with deeper flavors from barley and wheat accenting a nice semi dark malt. Finishes a little roasty and sticky. Excellent beer

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2016 Flaska från SB. Mörkbrun färg med brun skumkrona. Söt malt doft av knäck, pumpa, karamell och pumpernickel. Torr kropp med mkt rostade toner. Smak av bränd knäck, kaffe och kakao.

Dark mahogany appearance with a big frothy tan head leaving plenty of lacings as it goes down

Aromas of molasses, caramel and bread with toasted malts.

Huge chewy malty taste of light molasses and toasted bread. Some dried fruit and lingering dark sugars at the end. 

Mouthfeel is velvety smooth, thick and creamy with modest carbonation.

This is a phenomenal beer. Best doppelbock and beer Ive tasted to date.

Aroma: caramel, toasted and roasted malts, a hint of chocolate and coffee and maybe rye bread too. Some weird aroma i couldnt identify as the beer gets warmer. No hints of hops, yeast or alcohol.
Appearance: deep brown color, it seems clear but its hard to say because its almost opaque, thick creamy tan head with average retention. Almost no Brussels lace.
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, no sourness.
Palate: watery-to-oily texture, low-to-medium body, flat-to-soft carbonation, sweet with a medium bitter finish.
Overall: a good beer without any doubts. Nice appearance and good aroma and flavor profile. Quite well balanced, more on the sweet side, but nice touch of bitterness at finish. Good roasted and toasted flavors and aromas. Tones of chocolate, liquorice. Not very thirst quenching because of its sweetness.

Dark brow almost black, clear, light brown foam. Aroma; sweet malts, toffee, light touch of dark fruit. Mouth; Medium body with nice carbonation, somewhat creamy. Very nice balanced beer with tastes that combines light touches of chocolate, roastiness, some liquorice, sweet fruits. Alcohol very well hidden. A Masterpiece of beer!
Flaska från SB. Mörkt brunröd med mycket ljusbrunt skum. Doft av malt och karamell. Smak av choklad och karamell med trevlig beska.
Pours nearly black with a thin tan head. Aroma is bread and coffee. Finish is slightly bitter

Aroma has bread and coffee in it, also reminds me of Finnish "mämmi". Really dark color, almost no head. Quite sweet taste which I am not fond of. Palate is fizzy and lively, finish is long and lightly bitter. Overall, quite good experience.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Deep dark Brown/red with a bit beige head. Aroma of mixed malts, toffee, chocolate, hints of mocca. Taste is a bit rosted, coffee, dark dried fruits, chocolate. A nice sweet bitterness, especially in the aftertaste. Fantastic!

A lot of roasted malt and caramel, but no traces of fruitiness. The finish is way more bitter than expected. Some smokyness too.

It reminded more of an english beer (Id say a stout) that a german one, but Im pretty sure that mine was an unlucky bottle as the beer had neither the aroma nor the taste as strong or complex as I read almost everywhere.

Wiil try again.
How: bottle Appearance: dark brown with a small tanned head. Aroma: brown sugar, coffee, milk chocholate, prunes and bread. Palate: full body, medium to low carbonation.
Rich, Full of flavor... a benchmark of the style. Looks great, smells great, Nice rich flavor.. Ayinger has a winner on their hands here.

Bottle poured a clear brown hue w/ large creamy tan head. Moderate malty bread aromas. Initial flavor is light sweet w/ a light bitter finish. Tastes are molasses, brown sugar, dark breads, roasted marshmallows, and chocolate malt balls. Creamy mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at Beergeek. Very rich malty beer, balanced. Dried fruits, woody, caramel, dark fruits. On the malty side but does not seem cloying. Quite good, excellent.

Pours deep dark brown with thick brown head that quickly disappears. Nose is milk and chocolate. Aromas are roasted malts, coffe, cocoa, caramel. Average carbonation, medium body. Medium sweet and roasty finish. Very easy drinkable!
Classic doppelbock. Poured on b tap, dark brown with thin tan head. Malty and delicious as always.

This is one of my favorite brews. I doubt I ever rate any brew as perfect and that is my only reason to not do so with this rating. The strong sweet malt flavor is excellent. Pours a short tan head that refrains from dissipating completely leaving a foam ring around the glass that coats the glass and laces nicely. Simply a very attractive glass of beer that is pleasant to drink from the first swallow to the last.

A dark brown colour with a nice head. The aroma is malty and bready, maybe a little nutty, some caramel. The malts and bread continue with the taste which also has some sweetness and dried fruits. The finish is a bit bitter and the rounded palate finishes the beer nicely. Overall a lovely doppelbock with some complexity in it, great for any occasion.

330ml bottle from Brewdog online store. Reddish tinged deep brown colour, beige foam head and aroma of molasses, malt, caramel, bready. Taste is bready, malty, sweetish, some brown sugar, raisins, caramel, spice, nutty bitter. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry tangy nutty finish. Nicely drinkable.

Bottle at home from brewdog online. A deep ruby red, caramel brown coloured pour with a lasting mid tan head. Attractive beer. Aroma is sweet malty bready malts, rounded malts, cola cubes, tangy dried fruits, rye bready, brown bready, tangy apple. Flavour is composed of rich layered malts, rye bread, cakey, malt loaf, dried fruits, apple and cranberry. Little toasted rye bread lingers in the finish. Palate is medium full, rounded, frothy, slightly velvety. A wonderful celebration of malt. Lovely.

Unclear, dark brown colored, medium tan creamy head, moderately lasting. Aroma is malty, caramel, light brown sugar, dried fruits, some chocolate. Taste is medium+ sweet malt, caramel, some toffee, chocolate, dried fruits, light banana, toast, nutty, light+ herbal bitterness, light alcohol. Medium to full bodied, soft carbonation, creamy. 
(bottle, HolAB! Hannover)

UPDATED: OCT 26, 2016 The bottle says Ayinger Winter Bock which, according to RateBeer, is an alias for the famed Celebrator. Pours dark chestnut brown from the bottle. The sand colored head quickly collapses, leaving creamy and whispy lacing that lingers for the duration. Aroma is burnt caramel, and malty sweet. Taste is lots and lots of rich, sweet caramel malt, toffee, and brown sugar accompanied with strong roasted notes and a dark fruit undertone. A light bitterness arises at the finish. Full bodied and robust - the beer is not afraid to make a statement. Good stuff.
Update 10/2016. 4.0 to 4.2

Appearance: brown to black color. Deep black liquid. Frothy brown head.
Aroma: smoked meat, date, chocolate, raisins.
Taste: some bitterness (the burned kind) balanced with candy sweetness.
Palate: medium body. thin texture. flat carbonation. smoky finish.
Overall: complex doppelbock would go well with barbeque.
Aromer av torkad aprikos, russin, dadlar, choklad, samt lite rökighet. Smak av knäck med en liten sötma på slutet.

caramel, nuts, coffee, chocolate, resin, spruce, earthy, soy sauce, black, clear, tan foam, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, full body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish, delicious!
Huge dark brown foam, but frothy and fast disappearing. Dark amber transparent color. Bread and malty aromas with strong sweet malty taste on palate. Nice Doppelbock.
Black with little brown head. Aroma is raisins, dark honey and toffee. Mouthfeel is really really smooth. Taste is sweet and bitter. Nice. Overall great!
Bottle at home. Black liquid, quickly diminishing tanned head. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel and honey. Medium sweetness, light bitterness. Perfectly balanced.

Bottle from giant eagle. Nose is dark and malty. Warm full body with malt and dark sugars. Great balance and smooth mouthfeel. Have had before and will do again. This and elevators are the best of the style.

Bottle at home. Dark brown colour with a small brown microfoam. Nose is roasted malts, some overdone caramel, very slight booze. Taste is medium bitterness. Notes of nut and cocoa. Wow. Lovely doppelbock.

Wow! My first double bock. Creamy, nice head that lingers. Thick body, but not too strong. Definitely will have again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. This was a nice one but would love to try this one again. Lots of nice roasted hints, sweet, even some light smoke.
Una delle migliori doppelbock che abbia mai assaggiato. Fama meritatissima.
Dark body. Aromas and flavours of bready malts, grains, cereals. The swallow has a real bready taste, like brown and rye bread crossed. Very nice Double Bock.
Malty and powerful but not liquory, and a little hint of flowers and hops. Drinkable.
Celebrator has a creamy head of tight bubbles contrasting beautifully with its profound dark robe. It is full-bodied and velvety from half a years aging.

Bottle bbe 06/2016. Roasty, malty, caramelly, nutty (hazelnut, walnut) aromas and taste with a hint of honey. Wow! This one is really surprising. I recently had a Rogue Hazelnut Brown Nectar and the Celebrator seems to be like a role model beyond reach. Totally naturally feeling aroma and taste, not too sweet, nicely carbonated and a nice slick but slightly creamy mouthfeel. Compared to other Doppelbocks I had the Celebrator is subtle in sweetness making it more balanced with the roasty aroma/taste. Just great!

Red brown, off-white head.
Bready, malty, caramel.
Sweet, but not sticky, full bodied. Malty aftertaste.

12oz bottle from the Malt Shoppe in Tosa. Dark brown pour with little head. Caramel. Tangy fruit. Some smoke. Chocolate malts. Somewhat spicy and bready with a touch of light lemon. Hard to beat for style! 14.7

330 ml bottle. Darker clear brown pour with some red highlights. Small foamy tan head. Rich malt aroma, caramel, dark fruit, roast nuts, breadcrust. Taste is just as complex, a touch of warming alcohol. smooth medium weight body.

Donker amber/bruine Doppelbock. Volle cremekleurige schuimkraag. Deze zakt snel weg en plakt wat suikerig langs de rand. Aromas: Rozijnen, rijp fruit, gebrand, zoetige en wat alcoholisch. De smaak is zoet, karamel achtig. Chocolade, bruine suiker en geroosterde mouten. Veel smaak voor een bier met 4 ingrediënten. Vol en romig, medium koolzuur. Zoet gaar over in een nabittertje. De alcohol blijft mooi op de achtergrond. Een heerlijk bier!  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Sweet aroma, slight chocolate, honey and nuts. Pours dark brown with finger thick layer of creamy foam. Sweet taste, light body, silky texture, mild carbonation. Another doppelbock favourite and almost perfect beer.

330ml bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours a dark brown with hints of red, and a thick beige head. Aromas of dried fruit, bread. Rich and sweet flavors of malt and dried fruit, with a dry finish, hints of smoke coming through. Excellent beer.

caramel, chocolate, earthy, coffee, raisin, brown, clear, minimal head, tan foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, average carbonation, bitter, long finish
Dark brown pour with short lived tan head. Big malty aromas of sweet caramel, and a little dark fruit. Subtle earthiness as well. Taste is more sweet than bitter - toffee like. Mouthfeel is a bit creamy an dry. Alcohol very well balanced with flavours. I really liked this beer.
Aroma is slight roasted malts with some raisins and slight chocolate. Taste is sweet toffee, nice and toned caramel with a tasty finish. Maybe a tad too sweet.
Bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours dark reddish black. Sweet malty nose, molasses, demerara sugar. Full bodied and complex.
Flaske. Mørk karamell farget. Moderat karbonert. Hvit skumtopp. Smaker karamell,sjokolade, toffee og lønnesirup. Bra saker

Bottle from BrewDog Manchester. 
Dark brown pour. brilliant clear, tightish cream-tam head bubbles up but reduces quite quickly to a ring and skin. Nose of dark caramel toffee, toasty bread, nuts, raisins, fruitcake, a little alcohol. Rich. Tastes medium sweet, moderate bitter, drying finish. More toffee, fruitcake, muscovado sugar, light noble hop, toasty, nutty, dried fruit, Maillard products. Very clean, no fermentation character. Despite the rich malt character this sits light on the palate, medium body, creamy, but with a highish carbonation, completely dry finish with lingering bitterness and some lingering dried fruit and toastiness. Who needs say more about how accomplished a beer this is?

Originally rated on 8/ 6/08. After seeing this one several times i finally bought a 4 pack, at $14 its a bit steep but sometimes you get what you pay for, and I did. Celebrator pours a dark black body, even with a fair amount of carbonation the head is rather thin. Aroma of chocolate and roasted malts. Flavor of ample roasted malts, some chocolate, and coffee. It starts out slightly sweet with a mildly bitter bite and earthy finish. Havent had to many dopplebocks but this one was the best by far, so far. Their box lists all their accolades which are well deserved
Marrone carico, schiuma noce. Al naso fortemente maltata. In bocca malto, caramello, caffè tostato, una punta di liquirizia, prugna, alcool emerge troppo. Nel complesso una Bock di alto livello

Had this from the bottle after dinner. Shared with Marc. Good head. Good rich mouthfeel but not too heavy despite the deep dark color. 

F Avey---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Another Ainger product, and another favorite.

Smells very faintly of malt. Almost a licorice smell.

Pours a dark brown whit light barely visible through it. Head disappears quickly.

Taste is not overpowering of malt. No booze taste. 

Very faint and small carbonation. Little aftertaste.

Overall I was so happy with this purchase. Debating packing my fridge with them as I know the LCBO wont have them forever. Love the goat ornament too.

Mb
The Beer Bearon

Rossa molto scura con riflessi caramello, schiuma beige di media persistenza.
Aroma delicato di pane nero, prugna, leggeri cereali, lieve cioccolato.
Al palato sempre prugna e pane nero, leggero caramello, finale tostato misto a cioccolato.
Corpo medio, poco carbonata.

Bottle 0.33l from Sterk Amsterdam Netherlands.17.02.2016.Pour it clear dark amber color with small white head.Aroma caramel,reminds me on cognac little bit.Taste of roasted malt,sweet so sweet,yeasty feel,pinch of smoked feel on the back,full body,soft carbonation,honestly I expected so much more from this.

Botella.Apariencia marron oscuro translucida con espuma blanca poco persistente y baja carbonatacion. Sabor dulce con mucho cereal y algo de cafe y regaliz. Se trata de una cerveza muy sedosa y bebible.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Copenhagen (as Ayinger Winter Bock) - dark brown with a reddish hue with beige head. Big toasty roasted malty aroma and taste, some caramel malty sweetness, toffee, light cocoa, lots of brown sugar sweetness, light fruity spice, medium roasty bitter finish. Solid.
This beer was very solid. Had a nice bread pudding taste. To me, this was a bit thin but Im otherwise unfamiliar with the style.

Bottle. Pours dark brown, like cola, with a fluffy beige head. Not much aroma. Subtle chocolate and fruit. Flavors of roasty malts, chocolate, cola, coffee and raisin. Very smooth and malty. Mild hop finish. Very nice.
Very good aroma, appearance is black and taste is very good on palate. Has a very strong after taste but not too bad. Overall a very good beer.
My favorite overall beer. From the nose to the finish, everything is smooth and fantastic. Dopplebocks start and end here.
Aroma of dried fruits, bread, taste is dried fruits, bread, malty, medium finish.

330ml bottle. Dark reddish brown with a foamy beige head. Flavors are bread crust, honey, dried fruits, coffee, chocolate, licorice and molasses with nutty notes. Medium to full body, good carbonation, smooth texture.
En meget sødlig maltet smag, men ikke så meget spritet smag. En rigtig fin øl.

close to black, with glitter candles halfway between reddish tones and dark tea color. Dense and thick layer of creamy foam, more than two fingers thick permanent long time. Velvety texture. Moderately aerated with fine bubbles. Predominance in the nose of roasted malt notes, caramel, toffee and some chocolate. sweetish and smoky nuances that complement the aromatic spectrum emerge. Little presence of hops in the olor.Sabor and delicious texture. Easy entry, has a silky texture. De malty character, highlighting the flavors of toast, coffee and caramel, with a slightly smoky notes. Tasty, yet, as it is neither sweet nor as alcoholic and other doppelbock. Enough hops to balance load in perspective. It ends with a lightly bitter aftertaste.
Schwarz und dick wie Öl, dabei aber von überraschender Frische. Röstmalz, Schokolade, Kaffee, Toffee, Dörrobst. Leicht trocken-malziger Abgang.

In bottiglia, a casa. Colore rosso scurissimo impenetrabile, praticamente nero, con minime venature cola. Testa color crema di caffè, grassa, fitta, da soapy a cremosa, in diminuzione abbastanza celere, a scomparire. Olfatto etilico di frutta scura, tostature e lievito. Carbonazione da media a vivace. Superbo aroma maltato dolce, con note tostate di malto, frutta scura amara, prugna, liquirizia, lievito e pane nero. Finale di beva mediamente lungo, amaro e leggermente piccante, poco secco. Corpo da medio a pieno, un po liquoroso, nonostante ciò una buona scorrevolezza e una trama molto accessibile. La regina delle doppelbock, piacevolmente più tostata delle sue rivali, da questo blasonato birrificio bavarese, collocato sempre al top delle categorie di cui si occupa.

Bottle from brewdog, manc. Dark clear ruby brown, light brown head. Aroma is bready with treacle, rich and a bit fruity too. Taste is savoury and bitter and a touch tart, with a smoky finish. A nice oily medium body and nice tingly carbonation. Really good, get yourself a bottle.

Bottle. Heavy malty aroma of dark fruits, overriped, roasty grain and caramel. Light yeasty aroma. The flavours is sweet at first but finish light bitter. Lingering roasty taste. The body is full and the texture is oily. Average to fizzy carbonation. Nice one...

Pours a dark ruby, almost black color with medium, creamy beige head. Beautiful smell of caramel, bread and fruits. Notes of chocolate and coffee.

Medium to full body with medium yet slightly aggressive carbonation. Slightly bitter taste. Very rich and complex aroma - bread, sweet malts, caramel, roasted coffee grains, fruits, dark berries... Very smooth and very tasty, this is a beer to enjoy slowly. Higher ABV is masked well due to the complexity of the aroma.

Overall, perfect beer. Well done.

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2016 Bottle at home. Black with light tan head. Sweet and heavy roasted malts, overripe bananas, burnt toast, chestnuts, autumn leaves, Dutch apple syrup, molasses, hint of ash. Light to medium sweet with ditto bitterness. Body is well rounded and beautifully balanced with light carbonation and a bitter dark chocolate-like finish. Considerably lightweight yet very rich. Lovely drink! Smooth like a cone of mocca icecream.

A great beer. Havent had this in decades, decades of American craft brews, horrible Asian ricers, American adjunct slop, total abstinence for 20 years, and so on along the way. But here it is again, the celebrated Celebrator. World class? Certainly, I have a love of traditional European brews and a mistrust of current American fads and excesses while I do continue to enjoy and explore the contemporary craft beer scene with high expectations and an adventurers gusto. I like my food with beer, but dont like food in my beer... chocolate, coffee, fruit and vegetables, hot peppers, spices and so on. But the Celebrator... a classic! Velvety, creamy and malty with a smidgen of hops. Its all in there without additives but in the malt and hops: coffee, toffee, caramel, dried fruit, molasses, brown sugar in an exceedingly well balanced, easy drinking beer. Prost!
Brown with very nice top. Malts, fruits and sweetness in aroma. Quite sweet, creamy taste, some caramel as well. Not too sweet and hops sneak into after. Very good beer!

Dark brown, reddish pour with a two finger tan head that left nice lacing. Sweet malt aroma with hints of dark fruits. Some carmel flavor with sweet malts. Slight alcohol flavor. Beautiful double bock.

Shared 11.2 oz. bottle. Pours dark amber with a large light-tan head. Strong aroma of roasted malt. Flavors of roasted malt, caramel, hazelnut, and bread. A bit earthy, and has a long malty finish with low to medium bitterness. Quite good.

Aroma: malty and fruity; Appearance: dark red in color with tall tan head that dissipates slowly; nice lacing; Taste: sweet and malty; perhaps a bit too sweet; Palate: very soft carbonation with no bite; medium body with long, sweet, slightly dry finish; Overall: good balance, smooth; delicious, but not as good as score would indicate. Would buy again.

0.33 Flasche aus dem Hol Ab Getränkemarkt. Sehr schöne dichte, feinporige und große Schaumkrone, sehr schönes malziges Aroma. Im Antrunk sehr komplexe Struktur und im Abgang tolle Rösraromen ohne bitter zu werden. Für mich ein wirklich sehr gutes Bier.

330ml bottle from the Brewdog Online Shop. Pours clear dark red-brown with a persistent creamy beige head. Aromas of treacle pudding, faint smoke, faint leather, bubbling sugar about to burn. Taste is rich, creamy, sweet, more treacle, faint herbal tang at the back. Lovely mouthfeel. Clean finish. Very nice.

Huge persistent tan head, tight bubbles, beautiful lacing. Clear dark reddish brown, ruby highlights. Sweet malt aroma, raisins, prunes, cherry aromas. Rich malty flavour, cherry, prune, dark fruits, slight roast. Med carbonation, med mouthfeel.

Treated myself to a case for winter and its everything they say it is. Dark, smooth, multiple flavors. One of the few times I heard about a great beer and it was as good as its hype. I enjoy doppelbocks and its the best Ive sampled.

dark black, reddish color
aroma of roasted malt and caramel
little bit fruity
taste malty, caramel and slightly sweet

Thanks, Agate. bottled version 
So high was my expectations on this beer, I even matured it for more 4 month. It came quite decent and not super complex to me. Yes it was interesting aromas- nutty, a bit bready and caramel sweet (no smoke or wood), but flavor was very usual, except it wasnt boozy and sharp cause of high ABV. More mild and rounded. Medium to full bodied. 
Must rerate at different circumstances, maybe on tap version.

Dark brown, clear pour with bread on the nose. Sweet, bready flavor and super smooth body with a very light hint of alcohol presence and a mild, mineral like water profile. Very robust, earthy, and almost a little roasted, without the bitter edge attached to it. Super sweet, malty, and smooth beer. Very enjoyable, good stuff!

Arrive home after a night of drinking to find that Mrs Tiki has randomly picked this up for me to enjoy. Wait through a full day of hangover & work to try on a Friday night. What an amazing beer. Dark mahogany with a thick cap in the glass. Roasted hazelnuts, dark licorice, fresh toasted bread threaded together with a light smokey essence & completed with a satisfying dry finish. Superb balance considering all the moving parts. A great lesson in brewing, proving that doppelbocks dont need to be drizzled with sweetness. My favourite of the style to date & worthy of its classic reputation & high score on this site.

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2016 0,33l bottle. Dark brown colour with quickly shrinking brown head. Aroma: blackcurrant, blueberry, caramel, coffee, alcohol is hiding. I smell metallic tones but not always so I dont what it is. Taste: Sweet bread than bitter coffee taste. Medium/full body. Medium carbonation long bitter finish.

Dark brown colour. Small layer of froth. Some caramel, honey, hints of berries in the aroma. Some caramel, hints of berries, bitterness of coffee. Very many layers of taste. Very well balanced, medium bodied, medium carbonated, tasty drinking beer. Another one, please.

Nose: complex mix of smokey fruity esters. Berries, pears, grapes, plums, cherry. Taste a wonderfully creamy and balanced fruity malt medley, with molasses and caramel. Approachable yet complex and satisfying. Every sip better than the last.

Really dark brown color with light brown head. Aroma has dark, roasted malt and a bit of milk chocolate. Taste is really roasty with hints of coffee and chocolate. Body is light and well carbonated. Quite nice overall, easy to drink and more roasty than a regular bock.

With almost 3500 ratings I doubt I can add much to the comments which have come before... Truly a wonderful example of the style if not, perhaps, the definition of the style itself. Perfect for a winters eve such as now, to be savored and drunk slowly. Nice foam which lingers nicely well after the initial pour. Excellent feel on the tongue which invites leisurely imbibing. I am lucky enough to be enjoying it on tap...

Celebrator!

I finally tracked down a bottle at OPC in Busan for 8800 KRW. A rich ruby brown with a light tan head. The aroma is fragrant bready fruits, toffee caramel goodness. Full bodied and richly malty. The taste is toffee, a bit of smoke, bready like a thick loaf of dark European bread. This is very smooth drinking stuff.

Bottle. Almost opaque black liquid with reddish hue and medium light tan head. Aroma of raw sugar, dried fruit, light caramel, light ash, bread and floral hops. Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter with notes of raw sugar, raisins, toffee, chocolate and light ash. Medium to full bodied with medium carbonation. Great Doppelbock.
Bottle. Pours dark. Aroma is sugar, raisons, malt. Taste is raisons burnt toffee with a sweet date/fig finish.

Super-smooth with a great malts-hops balance, the latter showing its presence only in the finish. Aroma is caramel, nuts and slightly sour dark cherries. Surprisingly lightweight body. My favorite dopplebock with a plastic ram hanging from its bottles neck!

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2017 Very dark brown. Caramel and dried fruit aroma, and a rich, malty and fruity flavour, with a bit of roasted barley/wheat. Full, sweetish taste, with a dry and lightly bitter finish. Full body, and a soft and rounded mouthfeel. Overall, a wonderful doppelbock. Still the best I have had. This beer is very tasty and harmonic.

Bottle in LA. Deep brown pour with bubbly tan head that fades fast. Aroma has rich malt, malty dark fruit, and a little alcohol. Flavour has rich malt and big malt dark fruitiness, very clean. Mildly sweet up front but fairly dry finish with mild bitterness. Less sweet than other doppelbocks. Creamy with fine carbonation and medium body. Excellent.

Bottled, 330ml from The University Club, Oxford. Virtually black with cream head. This is rich and malty, fruity, dark prunes with some sweetness, quite restrained. Toasty notes compliment the fruitiness, just a hint of smoke to add to the depth. Superb beer,

Tap at Lexcalibur Strasbourg. Very dark reddish brown with big creamy light brown head. Caramel, toast, quite some dark bread with even some rye, light spices, walnuts, grassy, cocoa powder, light earthy and a touch of cellar dust. Under medium sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation and a bit dry bready feel.

Bottle brought at Rudat in Dortmund poured into nosing glass. Nose is malty and slightly alcoholic. Taste is malty foreground and raisins, butterscotch and roasted nuts. Finish is baked plums and walnuts. Great beer! Maybe not the Best german beer but damn good...
Aroma ligero, dulce, tostado. Color café,espuma abundante. Sabor dulce, caramelo, ligero lúpulo. Paladar suave, fácil de beber, refrescante. Recomendable.

This is a rich and tasty beer. A warm brown head and slightly red/black appearance. First taste is creamy and fruity leaving some roasted taste and almost oiliness on the palate. Caramel, other malts and discrete hops as final. Great!

330 ml bottle. Pours a clear ruby reddish brown with a resilient brown head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, roast, red berries. Flavor is chocolate, coffee, roast, burnt caramel. Finish is cherry, red apple, milk chocolate. Lingering ash. Medium to full body, velvety mouthfeel, weak to average carbonation. Very solid.
Delicious. Dark and malty, beautiful in the glass. The bitterness is almost not there. The color is dark and the foam is thick. Its currently in my top 10.
Flasche - Schwarz und dick wie Öl, dabei aber von überraschender Frische. Röstmalz, Schokolade, Kaffee, Toffee, Dörrobst. Leicht trocken-malziger Abgang. Sehr rund, sehr vielschichtig.

Dark brown pour with a velvety dark tan head. Smells of figs, dried prunes, cocoa, milk chocolate, coffee and caramel. The taste follows the same notes as the smell, with coffee and chocolate being more noticeable. At some point, I even detected coconut in there. Smooth mouthfeel due to the soft texture and low carbonation. A sticky-sweet aftertaste.

Pours an almost black color, with a decent sized, light brown head, which slowly collapses to a dense, bubbly lacing.

Smells of warmed toffee, together with dried plums, a smoky whiff and walnut shell. On top of this foundation settles earth coated liquorice, molasses and balancing whole grain bread. 

Has a velvet mouthfeel to it, with a medium carbonation and a silk, malt defined smoothness throughout. 

Tastes of burned toffee, molasses and caramel, outstandingly well balanced by bitter, dry earth. Its bitterness reveals coffee dregs among an herbal, leafy dryness. Adds a soft dried fruit quality to the flavors, with rock sugar creating a short, sweet peak after the swallow. Nontheless, its world class mouthfeel maintains, due to an aqueous quality soothing the sweetness, creating a transition for the well nuanced bitterness, slowly developing from its earthy foundation. This enables a clean finish, with a brief, toffee coated finish. 

Quite complex and pleasantly challenging, as the beer denies the palate to drown solely in sugary malts. Instead, it features a great grassiness of matured hops and bready earth, all mellowed by a world class mouthfeel, ensuring an utmost clean finish.

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2015 8-12-2015 Delft de Waag

Jaaaa! Lekker! Mooie donkerbruine kleur met redelijk wat schuim. Iets meer dan 6% alcohol wat je niet zou zeggen. Stevige smaak naar geroosterd mout. Licht caramel en heeft een heerlijke wat rokerige nasmaak die lang blijft hangen.

Pours a clear very dark amber bidy with a thick, frothy brown head that lasts forever. Nose has intense dark malt nites, caramel, sherry, chokolate and rye. Taste is sweet with an exceptionally smooth bitter finish that lingers on the palate. Medium carbonation with creamy small bubbles and a rich syrupy palate that nixely complements the beer without being overly sweet.very nice and well made beer.

Dark brown pour, almost porter like. Aroma of roasted malts, dark fruits, caramel. Taste also roasted malts, molasses, dark fruits and caramel. Balanced all over the board, enjoyed this one a lot. Top example of the style.
Nutty and fruits. A little burnt leaf note to it. Thick palette. Brown with off white head. Bottle pour at JP Burke. Interesting.

Aroma: caramel, molasses, smoke, earthy, 
Appearance: dark amber, tan head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: medium body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish, 

Excellent

On tap. Dark brown with garnet, white foam. Aroma: roasted and dark malts, dried fruits, liqueur. Taste: full-bodied, very malty, sweet, liquor, a little chocolate, raisins and other dried fruits, wine.

Aroma of roasty malt, notes of caramel and hops. Beautiful brown appearance, clear and with a white lasting head. Medium sweet, light-medium bitterness. Full body, creamy texture, medium carbonation, quite long lasting taste. Fantastic bock!
Geserveerd in een bierpul. Zeer donker bier met flinke schuimkraag. Het bier is was zoetig en redelijk doordrinkbaar.
Im Antrunk recht süßlich mit viel Malz, dann einige Kaffee- und Schokoaromen. kaum Bitterkeit.
Drinking whetabix, molasses aroma, not balanced but lots of legs. Very sweet not my thing
På falska från systemet. Mörk brun i färgen. Doft av nötter och rostat kaffe. Smakar söta nötter med en besk ton av kaffe.

33 cl bottle from Systembolaget. Brown almost black with a large white head. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, rasins and a little coffee. Taste reflects the aroma. Medium bodied. Medium bitterness. And medium carbonation.

Pours a deep dark brown with big khaki head. Fragrant, dark aromas of forest floor, 55% chocolate, roasted cereals and gingerbread dough. Medium bodied palate. Complex and tasty with almost zero alcohol heat. Decent finish. Very nice.
Botella, de @vivalabirra, Oviedo. BBD 11/15 Color negro, espuma beige, sabor maltoso, regaliz, dulce. Buena cerveza.

Aroma: strong roasted, honey, roasted walnuts.
Taste: sweet with light bitternes.
Flavour: malts, some rotten autumn leaves, many Mailard products, some grassy and flowery hops, licorice, some spicy (cinnamon) notes.

Very good, but under expectations.

I like the malty sweetness in this. It really masks the alcohol well. It is a darker, heavier beer, but really good. I would definitely get this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at csakajo. Pours with a soft lightbrown head that disappears quickly. Nose of rye, taste is middle bitterness, dominated by rye, aftertase is rye with a bit of raisin.

Average, creamy, light brown, mostly diminishing head, good lacing. Normal, dark brown body. Heavy malty aroma, with notes of bread, toasted, nutty and milk chocolate. Light hoppy aroma, with notes of resin. Light yeasty aroma, with notes of leather and earth. Notes of date, butterscotch and nutmeg. Moderate sweet, light bitter and moderate acidic initial flavor. Average, moderate sweet, light bitter and light acidic finish. Medium body. Oily texture. Soft carbonation. Light alcoholic, light astringent finish.

I didn't take any extra notes when I tried this beer for the first time but I'm gonna try it again and update my comments.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: red fruits, malty, roasted dark malts, resin.
Appearance: clear dark color and beige head.
Taste: medium herbal bitterness, roasted dark malts, red fruits, coffee substitute, really deep rich taste, semi-dry.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, roasted finish.
Overall: Amazing beer, full of taste, deep rich roasted notes, red fruits. highly recommended.
Pours black with a light brownish white head. Malt, fruit, some roast aroma. Fruity, surprisingly light palate with lots of sweetness. Treacherously non-alcoholic for the ABV. Overall very nice.

Bottle. Almost opaque black liquid with reddish hue and medium light tan head. Aroma of raw sugar, dried fruit, light caramel, light ash, pumpernickel, bread and floral hops. Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter with notes of raw sugar, raisins, toffee, chocolate and light ash. Medium to full bodied with medium carbonation. Great doppelbock. Cant believe I havent rated this before.

La schiuma fine e persistente svela un colore mogano limpido con riflessi ramati. Al naso non è intensissima, anche se i malti tostati ed il caramello si impongono sui sottili luppoli. Al palato è abbastanza fluida con sentori di brownies ed il finale è secco con un leggero richiamo al cacao e alla liquirizia.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ pub. Almost opaque black with a little reddish color. Aroma has chocolate, caramel, bread, coffee. Taste is malty with a long quite sweet and only little bitter finish. Flavors of malt, caramel, chocolate, plums.

0,33 l bottle. Black in the glass, small fast fading beige head. Wood, alcohol, malt in a nice composition on the nose. A lot of toasted malt with a pleasant sweetness at the start. Little bit alcoholic, hints of licorice. Long lasting malty mouthfeel. Upper class Bock!
Jag fattar inte varför den fått så högt betyg! Jag har kanske inga referenser avseende denna typ av öl.
Very nice dark beer. Simply said It is one of the best I tried. Very nice taste.

Výčap Beergeek Bar. Čierna farba, hustá krémová pena. Vôňa prezretých sliviek, jemne karamelu a praených sladov.
