Chuť krásne sladká, troku čokolády, prezretého ovocia, veľmi zľahka karamel a praené slady. Telo plné chutí, od začiatku do konca. Dlhá jemne sladká dochuť. Osvieujúce. Veľmi podarené. Vedel by som piť celý večer.
11.2 oz. bottle. Pours dark brown with foamy tan head. Aroma was malty and roasted. Taste was thick, roasty and slightly bitter.

caramel, bread, chocolate, coffee, roasty, zero hops. banana, clove, bubblegum, some vanilla. 

brownish black, some amber in light.hazy, brown foam, frothy, minimal head.
 lightly bitter taste. palate medium body to full body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, slightastringent.

BOTTLE 33 CL Clear chestnut, beige head. Big malty nose, with hints of caramel. The taste begins with a malty sweetness, come caramel, which is followed by moderate grassy hop bitterness.The body is smooth and rich, yet easy to drink. Simple, but well crafted.

Bottle. One gobsmacking good beer. Pours brown with a medium off white head. The aroma showcases malts and dark fruits. The taste is malt forward with complex dark roasted grains, brown sugar, anise and molasses. A nearly perfect beer. Pairs well with some dark chocolates.

Bottle, 0.33l. Clear, almost black colour with big, creamy, beige head. Medium carbonation. Aroma of dark malts, fruit, caramel and chocolate. Complex taste follows the aroma. Some smoke in the aftertaste. Overall very delicious beer.

330ml bottle. Almost black with a slight ruby touch to it with a one finger tan head. Aroma is rich dark malts, red fruits, chocolate, caramel and sweet black bread. Taste has a wonderful malty complexity with sweet black bread, chocolate, caramel, some dark fruit notes, a slight roasted touch, a slight hint of smoke/peat, some nuttiness, brown sugar and a slight hop bitterness in the finish tying it all together. The mouthfeel is velvety smooth yet filling, the carbonation is medium and the aftertaste rather short leaving me wanting more.

Denne dobble bock har et meget mørkt udseende med et smalt, men tykt hvidt skum. Øllen har en lidt brændt karamel og chokolade aroma, hvilket også kommer til udtryk ved smagen. Desuden har den også noter af lakrids og friskhed, samt sødme fra citrus. Øllen har en god cremet konsistens. Medium karbonering.

Dark brown with ruby reflexes, medium beige head, good lacing. Dried fruits, spices in aroma. Same i taste with notes of tobacco. Full bodied, medium carbonation, spice, fruity and slightly bitter aftertaste. Thousand of raters did not go wrong. It is a great beer.

500ml bottle from Beers of Europe - Deep brown body, thick (okay massive) off white top. Aroma and taste of roasted malt with some dark fruit notes. Some mild hoppiness that adds a nice complexity and balance to the malt. Lovely velvet creamy mouthfeel. Winner.
Flaska systembolaget. Mörkbrun vätska med krämigt beiget skum. Gräddig och rostad doft. Sirapslimpa. I smak: mörk choklad, rostad malt och sirap. Len och ganska lätt munkänsla med mycket smak
Well balanced, creamy and very nice appearance. Caramel. Softer than I expected. Very good surprise.

Bottle from Systembolaget
caramel, toast, roasty, cereal, smoke, brown, hazy, tan foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

Dark brown with a medium beige head. Aroma is chocolate, wood, caramel, toffee, herbal notes. Taste is chocolate, caramel, some coffee and sugar, raisins, prunes, bananas, cereal. Bittersweet aftertaste. Great beer!

Brilliant and unique aroma. Oak, both sweet and roasted malts and a hint of black cherry, slightly sour. Great looking dark brown nearly black color with a thin light tan head. Taste has oak as well and a strong malt presence but is not sweet. Slightly boozy and brings in a bit of the sour in the aftertaste. Excellent palate for the style. Carbonation is just right, velvety smooth mouthfeel. Doppelbock is not usually one of my preferred genres, but this is by far the best one I have ever had.

Doppelbock mais leve do que o padrão, mas não menos saborosa. Predominância do malte, mas não é doce, este por sinal é percebido apenas no início do gole. Possui um amargor interessante proveniente do lúpulo e da torrefação do malte. Equilibrada até de mais.

One of my old favorites.
Dark cola brown in color. Warm hues show in the mostly clear opacity of this fine beer. Rich, caramel tones, roast nutty, Chocolate-malted tongue. Sweet malty nose, with good body, and tall creamy head. Smooth mouth feel bock that has a nice kick to it that puts a monks smile on my face.

schenkt bruin met schuimige licht bruine kraag. aroma van hout, caramout, geroosterde mout, chocolade, koffie. Smaken zijn redelijk zoet van bruine suiker, matig bitter, zeer sterk, redelijk donker fruitig van rozijn, veel caramel, zoethout, geroosterde mouten, licht gerookte mout, redelijk tot volle body, romig van textuur, klassiek goed bockbier

Oct-19-2015-bottle- 0,33l, dark brown with beige head - its "a malty dog",
malt, caramel, chocolate, well balanced , the art of decoction, the favorite beer of my father, who passed away last year - glad , I introduced it to him years before :-)
@ Agards väg 18/10-15. Bottle from Systembolaget. Fruity with notes of roasted malt and some chocolate and dried fruits, also sweetness. Body is medium, the finish is dry with notes of roasted malt.
Bottle, 33 cl. Quite mild in spite of its ABV. Aroma not that complex as expected. Pleasant finish.

Bottle 33cl. Deep brown, with an off white, nearly brown head. Aroma of chocolate and malts. Taste is mildly bitter at first, stronger in the aftertaste. I can also sense roast and fruits in the taste. Not bad at all!

Mörkbrun och ett fint krämigt skum. Mild och väldigt lättdrucken. Trevligt och snyggt

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

It is one of my favourite and it is a shame that we could not find this beer in Switzerland, fortunately that Bavaria is not so far away. For a doppelbock, I find the taste perfect. It is the best one, better than the maximator or Andecks doppel bock. It is not too heavy, the balance is perfect between the malt, the hop and the taste of "raisin" and smocked. The carbonation is weak but normal for this kind of beer and the colour is like ginger bread. It is a really experience.

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2017 Dark brown color with nice beige head. Aroma of roasted malts,sweets and caramel. Sweet and rich taste with caramel,toffee, roast with smoky finish. Average carbonation.  Nice doppelbock
SB, Nova Lund, flaska. Bockarna kvar på flaskorna. Rostad fyllig arom. Välhumlad fruktig spritzig för sin karaktär. Lång smak. En utsökt doppelbock. Riktigt bra !

UPDATED: AUG 12, 2016

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, bread, dark fruit, liquorice, chocolate, roasted malts and smoke.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque ruby/black beer with a slight/medium beige/brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, dark fruit, liquorice and chocolate; ends slightly dry with bread, roasted malts and smoke.

Overall:

This beer is intense and balanced, but lacks complexity. Sweet and bready, but nothing more. Really rustic and definitely an amazing Doppelbock.

Near- opaque black beer with a beige head and light malty smell. Taste is very light, but a blend of creamy chocolate, earthy malt and a touch of bitter, fruity hop. Not the strongest flavour but its really very nice.
UPDATED: OCT 10, 2015 Has a metallic aroma pours a dark brown with very little head, lots of malty and caramel flavors not one I would get again.

08-10-2015. 33cl bottle at home. Appearance is dark, bright with a frothy lasting head. Aroma is malt, liquorice. Taste is complex, well balanced. Full bodied, a nice balance between sweet and bitter in the long finish. Overall a very good beer, very much taste (especially given the low ABV).

I don't get it. The beer has a nice texture but the taste is sweet smokey caramel. Aroma is faint. Not my type of beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at home. Pours deep brown, nose is malty toffee, caramel, meaty, taste is sweet, smoked sausage, caramel, little harsh on the finish.
UPDATED: NOV 9, 2015 0,33l Flasche mit weissem Bock-Anhänger. Sehr dubkle Farbe mut cremigem dunklem Schaum. Süße und Röstaromen. Sehr runder Doppelbock.
330 ml bottle from systembolaget. Hazy brown with off white head. Malty with caramel, smoke, wood, fruit and leather. Dry with medium bitterness and medium carbonation.

Bottle from Systembolaget Orminge Centrum. Pours dark brown/amber and a khaki brown head. Roasted aroma with slight smoke, caramel, chocolate and light hints wood. Medium sweet taste with caramel, some roast and smoke, raisins and a hint of oaky vanilla.

330 bottle. Love the goat thats included! Give this beer a few extra points for it. Not very strong smell, and its basically very plain, not what expected at all. Good looking fermentation dark beer with creamy white head. Taste is toasted and very good! The ending feels great has well, but you must drink a little to notice all the different flavours in it. A good beer, but for all its fame and awards, I must say i was a little dissapointed.

Ayinger. How Ive missed you. And how Ive looked forward to meeting Celebrator. Whats with the excessively formal language? I guess this is what German beer does to me. Pouring dark brown with an off-white head, Celebrator looks like a perfectly photogenic Doppelbock. It smells like caramel, malt sugar, and toasted malt. Flavor is complex, malt-forward, and dessert-like. Brown sugar, dark fruit, and subtle cocoa. Thanks to the velvet-smooth feel, the latter flavor element made me think of cake. Seems damn fitting if you ask me. Cake and beer are celebration staples. And this brew is good enough to somehow embody both.

Draught at Les Berthom V, Lyon. Dark and almost impenetrable brown. Large tan head which quickly dissipates to normal levels. Molasses, crime brûlée in the heady and sensual aroma. Taste is intensely sweet without being sickly. A slight hop bitterness keeps it from going over the edge. Gooey palate, maybe slightly too carbonated. A great beer.
Extra allt helt i linje med vad som förväntas i klassen. Funkar till julmaten kanske?

Flaska från SB. Mörkt mörkbrun i färgen och ett fyllig biegt skum som försvinner. Luktar sött av torkad frukt (främst russin), mörk sirap, söt råglimpa och kola men också en aning frisk fruktighet och syrlighet. Smakar av mörkrostad malt, rejält med maltsötma, bränt socker, torkad frukt och sirap. Även här finns en viss fräsch syrlighet som balanserar sötman bra. Avslutar i en del kaffe och mörkrostade toner när sötman lagt sig. En något tunn kropp, hade gärna fått vara aningen fylligare. Annars en väldigt trevlig dubbelbock!

Colore molto scuro con riflessi rossastri, schiuma marroncina non abbondante.
Odore maltato, malto caramello, tostato, fruttato, frutti di bosco.
Sapore tostato e maltato, caramellato, caffè. Una doppelbock che ricorda una porter/stout grazie alle note tostate.

330ml bottle from Systembolaget. Very dark brown, creamy beige big head. A wonderfully sweet aroma, rustic bread, dried fruit, nuts and caramel. Full-bodied, oily mouthfeel. The taste is complex, dark syrup, dark bread, raisins, figs, plum, dried apple, chocolate, toffee and overall very pleasent caramelized malt taste but still not too sweet. Very drinkable!

Bottle. Pours black with a hint of red poking through. Large off-white head, spotty lacing. Aroma is caramel, malt, spice, ripe cheese. Flavor is dark fruits: nearly rotten cherries, mostly, and something that simply tastes earthly elemental. Amazingly balanced, but not bland in any way. Covers wide swaths of flavors, feelings, emotions. Maybe thats just my love-struck heart. Well, Im in love with this beer, too, though. Excellent.

Bottle @ home. Dark brown colour with a medium sized beige head. Smells sweet, dark malts, chocolate. Tastes sweet, roasty, dark malts, slightly coffee, slight hint of raisins. If this is a good style example I might actually like bockbeers. Rastes almost like a stout. Medium body, nice carbo.

The Second to last beer of the night enjoyed by the Cannery Row Beer Club. Cheers! $2.50 from New Seasons. Cheers.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Klares dunkelbraun, beinahe schwarz mit reichlich beigem Schaum. Röstmalze, etwas Kaffee, würzig, nicht allzu süß, sehr lecker.

Superbe...
Nez très équilibré, rond et gourmand. Belles notes café, caramel en dominante et arrière de pomme !
La bouche est de même : beau corps mais pas aggressif ! Le caramel est très fort, la pomme sefface un peu. On sent un fond fumé. Le café revient avec loxydation et forme une belle longueur. On trouvera même des notes de sauce soja comme sa cousine Doppelbock de Andechs.

Draft at Ol Heidelberg. Pours dark brown with a medium light tan head, and decent lacing. Smells like strong toffee malt, plums, and earthy hops. Tastes like strong malt with plum, prune, dates, and light, spicy hops. Medium body and low/medium carbonation.

Chocolaty, nutty, dried stone fruit and a just a little bitter. Thick, sticky and lasts a while on the palate. Its been a while since Ive had one-it still rocks. A sipper that stays true as it gets warmer, which is surprising for a lager.
Intriguing taste. A bit of chocolate at the end along with strange fruits. Intense aroma and good looking appearance. Nice choice to start your evening.

Bottle. Clear red amber beer with a large beige head. Aroma is malty with notes of caramel, herbs, bread, pumpernickel and nuts. Flavor is malty with notes of bread, caramel, herbs, nuts, coffee and pumpernickel. Well balanced.

An artfully composed, perfectly balanced, landscapelike beer, opening with aromas of dark caramel malts, molasses, hints of spices and bread, all of them very subtle due to that certain dryness they are taken back into, even nosewise, to be then, on a chewy, never cloying palate, taken up again, with dark, very ripe cherries morphing into old, pipe-tobacco impregnated wood, before ending with a roasted, dry malt bitterness of just the right strength and length. Beautiful!

The beer pours dark brown, almoust black, with a one finger high, creamy, beige head. Lots of lacing on the glass. 

Nose: Caramel malt, molasses, toffe, coffe, dark chocolate, plum, dark fruit, nuts, raisin, butter, pepper and brown sugar. 
Taste: Dark bread, dark syrup, nuts, dark fruit (raisin, plum), a hint of roasted malt, molasses, tobacco, brown sugar, liquorice, ginger, carnation, vanilla, oak and orange. 
Body: Full, rich body. Complex, oily texture. Nice carbonation. Bitter end (that balance the sweetness). 

Beatiful beer!

Ottima birra. Il primo impatto è devastante per la bontà, profumo di tostato, caramello e cioccolato, in bocca oltre a confermare gli aromi riesci a sentire anche sensazioni di cuoio e frutta secca. Unica pecca, non invoglia a berne tanta.

Bottle. Pours black with no head. Light carbonation. Rich roasted malt flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Na minha opinião pode ser considerada referência no estilo. Muito saborosa e equilibrada.

UPDATED: APR 23, 2017 From Orpheus Rock (3.5euro) In Duvel glass. Watching Cinderella (2015)Very drinkable and with a great flavor and taste. Demonstrates that lagers are not always worse than ales as many people think. Avg 5.12 Jun 17. Labelled as Ayinger Winter Bock. From Labirratorium. In Bavaria glass. Playing Blackwell Epiphany. More roasted and dark than usual in the style, with coffee and smoke notes as well as some caramel. Very addictive Avg 4.5

23 Apr 2017. From 32Gp. In Teku glas. Watching Un Monstruo viene a verme.  Toasted caramel with maybe some smoke notes. Pleasant feel but missing something special that makes me to want to have another.

Brown liquid with minimal head. Aroma: caramel, plums, sourkraut. Taste: burnt caramel, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour. Palate: medium body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish,

Cervesa amb molt aroma i gust a caramel i a toffee, mold dolça i agradable.
Cerveza con mucho aroma y sabor a caramelo y a toffee, muy dulce y agradable.

Oh wow, this has an amazing aroma. I get toffee, caramel, slight chocolate, roastyness and a slight leatheryness. Flavor is amazing. Chocolate, toffee, butterscotch caramels, leather, dark fruits, raisin, nuts, spicyness. Amazingly compex and well balanced. Finish is fairly dry, but not overly so. Delicious.
Bottle. Pour is black with a frothy caramel head, aroma is sweet, toffee, malty. Taste is malty, toffee, sweet, nutty. Nicely drinkable
Bom equilíbrio entre dulçor/caramelo e amargor/torrado do malte. Sensação de álcool perceptível. Bom custo/benefício.

Bottle. Deep, very dark brown pour with a dense mocha head. Aroma is molasses, raisins, toffee, a hint of smoke. Flavour is rich but not strong - dense and complex, but not overly sweet. Perfect light carbonation and a light dry finish. Beautifully made doppelbock.

Large light brown lasting foam sets at an almost black beer, but even if the foam is compact and only slowly dwindling, so spreads a wonderful aroma of dark chocolate malt mixed hard roasted malt and cold mocha. The taste is potent of dark malt sweetness from chocolate, dark dried fruits and a hint of smoked malt. Light bitter notes of strong coffee carries it further to a bit nutty character until a slightly bitter hops in the end. Similar delicious doppelbocks is hard to find, and if I only had to pick one favorite beer among all the beers in the world, then comes celebrator definitely in my thinking.

Ist das süß.
Ein Bockbier-Freund werde ich wohl nie, auch wenn dieses eines der besseren Sorte ist. 
Schönes dunkelbraun im Glas mit feinem Schaum. Im Aroma schwere Malze, sehr süß und etwas Brotkrume.
Im Geschmack noch viel süßer. Karamell, Brot, Lakritze.

Signora birra. Equilibrio e pulizia di base, ma ha una marcia in più per aroma e gusto in particolare. Si presenta molto scura, un bel tonaca di frate, pulita, con lievi riflessi ramati. Il cappello di schiuma è morbidissimo, cremoso, abbondante e con una buona persistenza. Al naso è un bel mix di caramello e tostato: carruba, nocciola, fave di cacao amare, caffè ma soprattutto liquirizia, con lievissime sfumature di tabacco di sottofondo. Entra con non molte bollicine, molto fini ed eleganti, e il corpo ha una buona struttura ma non è pesante la bevuta. Al gusto i malti tostati si traducono in buone note di caramello iniziali, e man mano vanno verso il tostato, passando prima e di nuovo per il cacao per finire con la liquirizia, nota che caratterizza questa birra in prevalenza. Leggerissimo erbaceo, quasi inavvertibile, accompagna la bevuta con un sorso bello rotondo e con una persistenza finale di buona durata. Non risulta stucchevole nonostante ciò, questo il pregio di questa birra celebrativa non proprio semplice.

On tap at Ayinger Braustuberl, august 2014. Deeo burgundy color, clear, big beige head. Toasted malts on the nose. Aroma of chocolate (milk chocolate), toasted malts, mild coffee, caramel, cane sugar, chestnut honey, tobacco. Fruity overtones. Only 6.7 ABV but this one reveals a massive body and power. Tast has a wonderful curve, full body, low carbonation. Ultra heavy, long finish, evenly dry and smoth. Best dunklerbock on earth? Guess so. 

33 cl bottle, almost 1 year old, bought at the brewery for the scandalous price of 85 cents with its funny goat widget. Dark burgunfycolor with a big thick creamy beige head. Toasted malts upfront. As above: tasty burnt malts, dark bread, carrot, spices and whiskey. Finish tends toward the bitter side. Alcoholic finish, quite burning. A bit better fresh on tap, but still rocks.

Easily a Top 5 Doppelbock in the world
Pours a dark brown-burgundy. Has a sweet malt and caramel aroma. Taste is very balanced with malt, fruits, caramel, light wood, and spices. A very balanced aftertaste of spices and fruity malts.

Poured into a taster showing coffee brown semi translucent rims and a dark center. 

The nose shows sweet sugar cane and very strong notes of steel tank here and there. 

The palate is full bodied and well carbonated. Showing the same aromas expressed as flavors with a coffee-like bitterness at the finish. 

Really was not impressed at the start and cant say the palate is any better. Much too sweet and an aroma that is not very inviting. But this is the quintessential doppelbock.

Pours dark brown/amber and a khaki brown head. Head retention is ok. AROMA: Roasted malt, chocolate, smoke, slight coffee, boozy, caramel, citrus, herbs, earthy, smoke, vanilla, woody ands spice. TASTE:, caramel, chocolate, coffee, roasty, citrus, herbs, earthy, alcohol, smoke, vanilla, woody, spice and slight peppercorns. AFTER TASTE:, smoke, caramel, coffee, chocolate bitterness and boozy with a thick buttery but dry finish.

Very dsrk brown in colour with a vibrant yellow/tan head. Smells of burnt caramel, roasted continental bread and sweet tobacco with some spice. Flavour is warming toasty spice like cinnamon but astonishingly refreshing cold. It leaves a texture behind which is softly gritty, drawing attentiion to the tobacco like qualities which might seem unpleasant if it were not for the sweetness but gives it an amazingly well rounded character which is interesting, multilayered, and exciting. By far, my favourite German beer
Dark brown beer with a dark beige head. Caramel and dark syrup on the nose. Sweet bread, salty liquorice, slight roastiness and a hint of bitterness. Overall a good beer.

Líquido viscoso marrom escuro,espuma bege cremosa,volumosa e duradoura;aroma com boa complexidade,aparecendo malte tostado,caramelo,passas,nozes,chocolate meio amargo;sabor com dulçor equilibrado e delicioso,seguindo as notas do aroma,final com suave amargor,corpo médio/alto,álcool muito bem inserido,ótima drinkability para o estilo.
Very dark brown colour with a brownish head. Smells of roast malt, chocolate, coffee and toasted bread. Soft on the palate with a full body. Roast malt sweetness and some bitterness, pretty tastey.

Bastante escura, espuma bege abundante, de fácil formação, persistência média. Aroma açucarado leve, um pouco de baunilha e banana. Paladar de dulçor médio associado ao malte, amargor que cresce com o tempo. Corpo e carbonação médios. Aftertaste de leve intensidade, amargor crescente parecido com xarope (daqueles que servem com panquecas nos EUA), frutas vermelhas desidratadas.

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2015 A fantastic beer! Dark brown but not hazy, thin head. Aroma of dark fruits and molasses, sweet and smooth. Taste of malts, caramel that fades into a slightly bitter finish. Wonderful.
As a lover of Belgian beers, this fantastic beer has become one of the essential beer world. A marvel in all the elements, until all are also in aesthetics.

I hate that I'm forced to rate these brews with a commenti feel it is cumbersome and adds nothing

Marrón muy oscura rojiza,aunque no turbia. Dos dedos de bonita espuma ocre. Marcado aroma a chocolate y uva tinta. Buen cuerpo. Compleja, con sabores que prolongan el aroma, junto con otros como café, especias, cerezas... Final seco y muy amargo, que dura y acaba pidiendo otro trago. Notable.

Bottle. Deep brown colour with a small browinsh head. Aroma of raisin, nuts, sugar and wheat. Really powerfull and complex. The flavour is has good. Catamel malt, raisin, dark dried fruits. Very sweet but still balanced. Medium-full body. Medium carbo. Medium sweey finish. Smashin dopplebock.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours dark brown with reddish highlights and thin brown head that lasts reasonably well without much lacing.
Aroma is malt, nuts, molasses. On the palate, someone mentioned kvass and thats an apt comparison. Theres toffee, bread, a whiff of licorice, a spot of buzzy heat and mild bitterness to usher it out.
For all that, its light and easy drinking, a deceptively simple balancing act. Good brew for a cold night without being overpowering.

0,33 l bottle from craftbeerstore, bottled in december 2014. Clear, dark brownish red with a thin, creamy, slowly diminishing, tan head. Pleasant, sweetish-malty aroma of raisins, cane sugar and molasses. Sweetish-malty taste of raisins, nuts, molasses and cane sugar, followed by dark chocolate and a bit of coffee. Medium long, slightly bitter and minimally warming finish. Medium to full body, oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Tasty, intense and harmonic doppelbock. Nice chocolaty touch and not overwhelmingly sweet. But the best German beer? Not for me.

IM GO TO STEVE HOUSE STILL EVEN THOU HE SCARE ME BAD LAST TIME TAK ABOUT SHOOTING ME AND CALLE ME GAY AND BAD THINGS HE USULLY SHARE BELGIUMS AND THESE THE TO ONLY TIME I CAN DRINK IT. THIS TIME I WAS SMART TOO NIT LEAVE MY RIFEL IN MY (FREEDOM 1ST AMMANDMANT RITES) TRUCK STEVE IS MAD AGAIN OFF COURSE BUT HE HAS CLASSIC BELGIUM CELEBRATER AND LET ME TELL YOU ITS TASTES PRETTY WELL THE FLAVERS OF A LITTEL FRUIT AND SPICE. 0.33L bottle. Pleasant kvass an toffee with caramel hop aroma. Dark brown color with tiny beige head. Really it tastes like old school kvass. Strong black bread with caramel note, light dried banana, prune, caramel, light spices flavours. Very enjoyable. Caramel mouthfeel. Very good.
Bottle. Lots of dark chocolate in the aroma and in taste. A bit of black bread. Slightly sweet

12 oz bottle from Hy-Vee Wine & Spirits - Muscatine. Deep brown appearance with ruby hues and a light, lacy tan head. Aroma of caramel, toffee, dark fruits, toasty malts, light floral and earthy hops. Similar flavor, complex, rich, malty, kind of vinous and lightly fruity with a touch of smoke. Moderately sweet and lightly bitter with a light dry finish. Medium body with a soft, creamy and smooth feel on the palate. A classic that Ive been drinking on and off for years. Hard to believe Ive never rated it.

Bottle from Kris Wines. Awesome bottle, label and goat. Deep brown colour, thick white head. Superb beer, thick chewy malts, toffee, bread, licorice, slight tar maybe treacle. Balanced well, enough hop to offset any sweetness. Alcohol present but not intruding. Lovely, and even better drunk after a 4-0 playoff victory at Wembley. Come on you whites!

Very dark brown with ruby highlights. Dark tan head, very creamy. Smells of toffee and licorice, very bready. Mouthfeel is thick and silky. Tastes of dark caramel, hints of raisins. Really, really nice beer.

Finally got around to rating this one. From bottle at La Vache Folle. Dark brown coloured, with a light brown head. Nose is caramel, slight smoke, liquorice, bread, maybe a hint of chocolate. Flavour is caramel and toasted malts, dried fruits, bit of spices. Medium carbonation. Fairly sweet. Finish is bready, fairly sweet, toasted malts. Nice.
There is nothing as magnificent as this German Doppelbock! One of the most difficult beers to brew! Get a taste of this soon!

Pours dark brown with tan head.
Aroma is intense: coffee, chocolate, iodine, smoke.
Creamy, full body. Bitter ending, long and round. Very good.
Coco and malt aroma strong on the coco. Nice appearance dark brown with tawn head. Taste is very balanced for a dark. Coco, malts, cherry some hops. Great beer

330ml bottle from Saveur-Biere.com. Pours a deep hazy brown with receding tan head. Lovely smooth doppelbock flavours, rich and comforting and a decent malt sweetness. Couldve easily sunk a pint of this.

Bottle. Dark amber, red in colour, white head. In aroma malty, melanoidin notes, also bread, dried fruits and some chocolate?! In taste caramel, toasted malt, fruitsŁ raisins and plums. Medium bodied, oily in texture, medium carbonated with medium bitterness at the end. Really well done beer.
Really tasty beer. Brings the heat off the edge. This is a medium looking beer and really nice taste and palate.

330 ml. bottle from Malt Attacks. Shared @ Delirium Hoppy Loft. A very, very long time want. I have been wanting to try this one since forever. BBF 09/2015. Dark ruby amber, little tanned head. Nose is rather umami, fish guts, DE lager profile with lots of sugar, malty, umami, note takes a bit away from it for me, light nuts & oxidation. Taste is big umami, fish guts, DE yeast, strong DE lager with a reasonable amount of sugar sweetness, spices & herbs figure big time, quite herbal, umami, Typical body for the style. Seeming faint oxidation. I am not the biggest fan of this king of profile. Looking at my rating, I am not a particularly big fan of doppelbocks in general. Decent but I would have loved to have enjoyed this more. Bummer.

On bottle from Ølbutikken. Dark amber color, ok foam. Medium aroma intensity; malty, dried fruits, some caramel. Medium/full body & complexity . On the sweet side. Very Enjoyable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The nose never lies and this beers pear dropish deep prune bouquet is everything this beer sould be. Dark rich brown in colour with perfect carbonation and a smooth body with good sap makes this such a stupidly easy beer to love. An undisputed world classic which should be way ahead of all those Frankenstein beers on the ratebeer Top 250.
330ml bottle from Piligrim. Pours dark brown with a small beige head. Aroma of malts, caramel, bread, smoke. Taste is sweet, treacle, dark fruits, and a bit of smoke.
Amazing beer. Powerful, tasty, bitter Strong. It is one of The Best I've tried so far

Does not get much better than this beer when fresh. On tap at Ayinger Munich. Aromas of dried fruits such as plums and cherries, toasted malt, caramel, with hints of chocolate, licorice, Clear dark amber to brown with beige head that lingers and laces.Flavors of caramel, toast, bread, raisin, plum, with hints of umami. Mouthfeel is medium but light for a DB making it the most drinkable DB out there.Carbonation is medium high. Balanced medium finish. Wow!!

Brown/red with bubbly tan head. Nose is German malts, creamy, raisin, maybe a hint of smoke. Taste matches, dark malty, some dark fruits, brown sugar, almost a toffee on the finish, a hint of smoke. Tastes very German, both yeast hop and malt profile are classic doppelbock. Creamy yet thinish mouthfeel. Very good

Bottle thnx to biersmurfke. Pours dark, very dark clear caramel brown. Smell is earhty leaves, bit caramel. Taste is rather bitter. Sharp, yet elegantly complex.... High carbo. Very rich, but all aspects are subtile. An agreeable beer, to say the least. I am obligated to admit that i am impresse, given the fact these styles of beer are not my favorite.

NOTA DE CATA: 
- Aspecto: Ayinger Celebrator tiene un color caoba con ribete castaño. Desarrolla una espuma color café con leche densa y persistente. 
- Aroma: Aromas muy particulares. Delante aromas empireumáticos (malta muy tostada) detrás lácteos (queso), aceituna negra. 
- Cuerpo / Sabor: Entrada ligeramente dulce. Rápidamente aparecen los tostados (pan muy tostado o incluso quemado, café) y caramelo. Es plena y densa, poco atenuada, de media-baja saturación de carbónico. Los anillos que deja la espuma en el vaso delatan el número de tragos (síntoma de su calidad). Alcohol muy bien integrado. Largo final de boca dominado por los tostados muy intensos, y elegante y seco amargo.

Deliciosa, cheirosa, cremosa! Colarinho belíssimo, marrom. A cerveja bem tostada, fortes notas de café. Amargor é balanceado com um pouco de doçura que disfarça o álcool. Ótima carbonatação e textura. Merece muito repetir!

Bottle, Malt Attacks. Dark brown, large beige head, rather quickly disappearing. Aroma malts, dried plums, hints of chocolate. Medium full body. Taste malts, bread, some liquorice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle, poured into 16oz tulip glass

Aroma: Dark malts, very malty, light caramel

Appearance: solid black, tan head

Taste: Heavy sweet, light bitter

Palate: medium to full body, creamy texture, average carbonation

Overall: Very malty, slight roasted malts. Very rich. Slight fruity or raisiny taste. Very sweet. The perfect example of a Doppelbock. A very slight chocolate taste. No hop aroma or bitterness. Very smooth and warming impression. Cant taste the alcohol.
Bottle, 330 from Pivoljub, Ljubljana. Pours reddish brown with off-white head. Malty caramel, ripe fruit, sweet, bit roasted. Complex. Good brew, but cant say Im impressed.

Pours deep copper from 12 oz bottle with full tan head. Malty, warm aroma. Tastes appropriately sweet with deep complex malty flavor to follow, hints of figs, plums, chocolate. Not much on the hops. Warm alcoholic mouthfeel with full body. Fantastic beer from a legendary brewery. Not designed for mass consumptions, though beer doesnt get much better than this.

33cl bottle at O menu café bar in Sintra, Portugal. It pours a dark-brown colour with a bubbly beige head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is very smoky, dark fruits, caramel, molasses, syrup, herbs and some oaks. Taste is sweet, caramel, smoked stuff, raisins, syrup, dark fruits, plums and a little hoppy. It has a medium to low body with average carbonation with a slight dry and hoppy finish. Definitely one of the best German beers Ive tasted. I will drink this again in the future.

Smoky, fruity aroma. Dark fruits, herbs, roasty malt and some hops. Pours dark brown translucent liquid with a white head that disappears quickly. Bitter in the taste with a very malty and definitely "dark" flavour, smoky and dry with a hint of fruit. Definitely has some wine characteristics. The alcohol is not too noticable and blends well with the flavour to create a nice balance. Full body with an oily texture and a bitter and dry finish. Definitely a good strong beer for celebrations and other events, which judging by the name it was meant for.

Dark blue-brown colour with small head. Aroma of dark fruits, bananas, hebs. Taste of hops, dark fruits, bananas, malts. Nice malty aftertaste which is very well balanced. Overall: Justifiable is this beer on the first place in this rang.

No bottling date visible but Ive had this since January. Color is opaque ruby-black, head is only some thin lacing. Smell is rich savory malt, molasses, roasted coffee, chocolate syrup, soy sauce. Drinks easily. Dry fruity cocoa flavor, smoky, rich malty savory character. Really great character and versatile too.

Bottle. Dark ruby red with a thick brown bubbly head. Aroma of nuts, caramel, dark fruits, hint of smoke. Taste of nuts, dark fruits, maple syrup, slight metallic finish, not much sign of the alcohol. Light body, medium to heavy carbonation. Very easy drinking.

0,33 l flaske kjøpt på Hos Walter i Ebeltoft. Dyp klar granatrød kropp med et fingertykt tett lysebrunt skumlag som dekker glassveggen etterhvert om det synker sammen. Kandissukker, dadler, fiken og svisker er det som slår meg når jeg drar aromaene inn i nesa. Ølet er fyldig og bløtt i munnen med god balanse mellom sødme, fruktighet og bitterhet. Den snikende alkovarmen er kledelig og hele smaksbildet varer lenge. Dette var snadder!

Doftar russin och mörk fruktkompott men också en aning felplacerad metall.
Mörk brygd med vacker rubinröd ton. Perfekt, tätt skum med lång halveringstid.
Mycket smakrik bock med bränd malt, kakao och kaffe. Mycket bra balans mellan en mjuk sötma och mild beska utan att bli mesig. Avslutningen är lätt rökig.
Aning oljig viskositet i en medelfyllig och lätt kropp. Låg kolsyrehalt och välintegrerad alkohol.

Bottle: Black center with dark, ruby-red, translucent edges. A big, creamy, light-tan head form on top with nice retention. Powerful nose, right from the get-go. Dense caramel, sweet brown sugar, raisins, plums, heavy molasses, milled & charred grains, burnt toast, a touch of wine, & a bit of soy sauce in the latter half. Alcohol is pretty noticeable on the palate with a good amount of boozy sting to it. Feels heftier than 6.7% ABV. Lots of dark fruit meshes with the alcohol gives a mild wine-like flavor up front that transitions into a very sweet mid-palate. Molasses, syrup, black licorice, anise, char, & strong, rustic dry cocoa underneath. Lots of toasted caramel & burnt toffee in the finish, too, with a little bit of an herbal character from the hops... Almost tea leafy at times. Dark fruit, molasses, & heavily sweet malts linger in the finish. Kind of earthy? Definitely lots going on here. I know this is the quintessential example of doppelbocks, & I can definitely appreciate the craft behind it, but I have never found myself to love or crave this beer. Its good. Its definitely good. But I tend to prefer slightly more timid examples of the style.... Whatever that means.
Birra scura, schiuma abbondante. Aromi complessi di lampone e cioccolato. Corpo pienissimo, sensazione avvolgente. Carbonazione abbondante classica dello stile. Bilanciamento sorprendente.
500ml bottle. Pours deep brown with a thick off white head. Aroma is treacle and molasses, taste similar with subtle hop balance. Nice but not spectacular

Pours black with an off white tiny head into stemware. Aroma is sweet with a bit of tanginess. Taste is nice and sweet without cloyingness. Some nice bitterness as the end. Light mouth and sharp carb.

Bottle; pours dark brown with a tan head; aroma is caramel, chocolate, dark fruits, and a hint of smoke; taste is caramel, chocolate, roasted malt with hints of dark fruits and smoke; dry finish with a touch of smokiness; this is nicely balanced and very good!

10.1.2014. Hyvin tumma vaaleanruskealla vaahdolla. Tuoksussa mallasta, suklaata ja salmiakkia, hieman makeutta. Maku maltainen, hieman leipäinen, pehmeä, hieman makea, hieman paahteinen, hieman suklaatakin. Suutuntuma täyteläinen ja pehmeähappoinen. Melko monimuotoinen.

Pours a very dark color with an average but dark head. Aroma is raisin, fig, rich caramel, HUGE malt, dates, toffee, smoke. Taste is rich, creamy, malt, raisins and fig with a spicy caramel taste, some slight bitter hop, toffee and caramel to smooth it out, and a dry finish with a great smoky note. Fantastic beer, thought we rated it before, definitely an prime example of what a doppelbock should be.

Pours dark brown with reddish hues and a small offwhite head.

Aromas of dark fruits, nuts, figs,dates, weak smoke.

Taste is nuts, dark fruits, malts, toffee, caramel, weak butter, some pilsner notes light smoke.

Aroma resin, raisin, dry fruit
Appearance red, brown, clear, minimal head, tan foam, 
Taste medium sweetness, 
Palate light body, thin feel, average carbonation, 
Overall not a bad beer I would suggest this beer to a friend

0,3l Flasche. Dunkler Bock mit beiger Schaumkrone. Riecht toll nach Röstaromen, nach vergorenen Früchten und Schokolade. Im Geschmack werden diese Gerucharomen auch harmonisch wiedergegeben. Weltklasse!

Bottle (shared with friends).
Dark color, small creamy head. Caramel notes, well balanced taste. Strong beer with character. Like it.

330 ml pour from room temp bottle into goblet. Medium fluffy head that dissipates at a medium pace. A slight later lingers on top of the beer. No lacing. Black and completely opaque. Nose is dark malt, roasty, chocolate, maybe dark woody. Mouthfeel is creamy and carbonated. Taste is malt, chocolate, maybe a little smoke. Well balanced, leaning on the sweet and malty side. Overall an enjoyable dark, strong beer.

Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of caramel, dark chocolate malts, sweet nutty aroma, very weak smoke, toffee, dates and figs. The taste is sweet and weak roasted. Some chocolate, nutty notes, caramel, toffee, dark sweet malts, weak butter and some weak pilsner like notes as well. Pretty nice.

33cl bottle. Pours a deep reddish, dark, clear brown with a medium sized, off white head. Aroma has lots of malts, both chocolate, roasted and caramel malts. caramel fudge, hints of smoke. Very complex malt profile. Taste is pretty sweet with subtle bitter roast and hops. Balanced and pleasant. Mild, slightly full body and medium carbonation.

pours very dark brown with very little light coming through. Nice tan head that is still holding five minutes after I have poured. Light lacing. Aroma is bready with strong notes of dried fruits and some cocoa. Flavor of fruitcake with some cocoa. Medium/full bodied. sticky. creamy mouth feel. Nice dry bitterness in the finish compliments the malty sweetness.
28 feb 2015, tap. Brown. Nose is bready malt, faint syrup, toast. Ned body and moderately fuzzy, a tad creamy. Bready malt, some sweet yeast, toasty or burnt flavors. A tad meaty or cheesy. Nice.
Отлично& пиво с богатым, насыщен& вкусом
On tap at Kaiba, Shanghai. Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of malt and raisins. Burnt toffee in the taste. Sweet finish.

Bottle, served in snifter. Pours with browny, quite thick head, but with poor retention. Color is dark ruby, very clear. Very intense and complex aroma. Lots of dried fruits, some cherry, dark chocolate, caramel and a hint of sourness. Its very encouraging. Taste is rather sweet and malty, some caramel, but then it becomes quite dry with mild bitterness. Dried plum is quite distinct. Very long finish with some herbal hoppiness. Well, its definitely the best doppelbock Ive ever had, pretty different than average DBs from Germany. Its worth its number one place in this style. Truly great beer.

Bottle at home, from Biervana, 22nd February 15. Poured clear, dark brown. Aroma is slight spice, caramel, banana, rich dried fruit. Taste is pleasant, barbecued banana, with brown sugar, caramel, spice, fruit cake. Delicious beer

33cl. Bottle. 
Pours clear brown with tan head. 
Aroma dark fruits, caramel, chocolate, raisins, roasted malts, yeast, plum, prune. 
Taste caramel fruity sweets, roasted bitter. 
Mouthfeel creamy. 
Great Beer.

Botella. Color marrón rojizo muy oscuro y límpido. Espuma marrón clarito de media formación y baja persistencia. Aromas a malta tostada, alcohol y lúpulo en un principio, q evoluciona hacia notas mas a regaliz, ciruelas pasas, arandanos, bizcocho, chocolate y azúcar moreno. En boca la primera sensación es aceitosa, y algo densa...dulce donde se hacen presentes todos los matices de nariz, para terminar con un toque algo mas seco con matices a malta tostada, lúpulo, madera y regaliz, el final es bastante largo. Carbonatacion baja. Redonda.Birrote!

Glad I can finally try this classic. Deep brown body, beige head has decent retention and leaves some lacing. Aromas of dark chocolate, raisins, caramel. Taste is complex and balanced, with bitterness, a plum-like sweetness and spicyness all having their say here. A lasting spicy aftertaste remains. Smooth and easy drinking, a great doppelbock.

Do I love malt. Why, yes I do! This stuff is almost too good. Deepest brown pour with dense tan, clingy head. Aromas of toast, bready malt, some esters and yeast. Flavors similar to smell, with a heavy malt presence dominating the show. There are only a handful of brews, with which if they were the only available in the world, I could be completely content. This is one of them.

Join tämän mämmin kanssa. Välillä oli vaikea erottaa suusta kumpi on mämmin ja kumpi Celebratorin makua. Täydellinen tyylinsä edustaja. Optimaalinen tarjoilulämpötila on mielestäni vain hieman huoneenlämpöä viileämpänä.

330ml bottle, poured into La Chouffe tulip A: Jet black, opaque, small tanned head, not much retention, minimal lacing. S: Prune, grape, oak, dark chocolate, biscuit, burnt caramel and some diacetyl. T: Tawny port was the overriding taste, molasses, dark chocolate lots of roasted barley at the finish, some bitterness. Hint of a boozy burn as it warmed. M: Smooth in, coarse out because of the booze, low carbonation,
heavy chewy texture. O: Oozed class, would love to make a loaf of bread with this. Im also intrigued to know what a year of aging would do to this.
Delicious one and very thick. Creamy and cloudy features. Awesome to drink with some nice meat and potatoes.

Pours dark brown with big beige head. Sweet smell, reminding raisins and plums, and some toasted malt. Taste is well balanced by sweetness, alcohol and toasted malts. Rich beer with good drinkability.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2017 Bottle from Buxton Brewery Tap House. Pours an opaque dark brown colour with a ruby tint and a medium beige head. Aroma of treacle, toffee, fruitcake, some dark fruits, slight liquorice and subtle spice. Taste of toffee, fruitcake, raisin, fig, other dark fruits, some red fruit, slight liquorice, a little smokiness, a hint of nuttiness and subtle spice. Full bodied and moderate carbonation. A long, rich, spicy fruit finish. A surprislingly smooth and full flavoured beer. So fruity and spicy. Delicious.
Buena cerveza alemana, con una presentación en botella muy curiosa teniendo una cabra de plástico, cerveza que en la boca tiene notas tanto dulces como amargas.

UPDATED: FEB 28, 2017 Bottles from Cornelius and Cork & Cask. Hazy ruby/brown body with a thin beige head. Faint lacing. Aroma of treacle, fig, toffee, blackcurrant and burnt caramel. Flavour of brown sugar, tea, plum, wood, berries and a hint of liquorice. Medium body with a creamy texture. Soft fizz. Luxurious and consistently brilliant - a truly world class beer. One of my all-time favourites.

Bottle, 50cL. Home. Many thanks @Jaghana ! A dark brown beer, nearly black, with a big beige creamy head ; average retention. Roasty aroma, caramel, spices (licorice), fruit (prune, grape), alcohol, coffee. Light sweet, light to medium bitter, sugary warming background. Voluptuous body, smooth texture, average to soft carbonation, dry warming spicy finish. Overall, a fantastic beer : delicous aroma, dangerously drinkable, WOW !
330ml bottle at Bierhof Athens. Dark brown almost black color with beige head. Roasted malty aroma, coffee, some chocolate, yeast. Sweet and bitter taste. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

This is a really solid doppelbock, goes down easy and smooth for being 7.2% abv. Dark brown pour with a nice tan head and lacing. Aroma of sweet malt, caramel, figs, slightly smokey, very nice. Rich flavor yet very quaffable, tends toward the sweet side but has a well balanced flavor, almost a bit dry. Nice clean mouthfeel, smooth aftertaste. They even give you a little plastic goat as a souvenir. Highly recommended.
Pour from the bottle is dark amber in color, aroma is slightly metallic, taste is malty a little sweet, finish is a watery mouth feel and a hint of a soy sauce on the back of the tongue.

Bottle. Pours a deep red colour with a nice looking one-finger tan head. Aroma of malts and hops. Taste is of malts, caramel, chocolate, spices, nuts and coffee. Sweet but with a bitter and slightly tart finish. Full body and average carbonation. Very interesting and quite good - could do without the tartness though.
Koffie, noten, kruiden, geroosterd, caramel, houterig. Super bock bier. Lekker. . .

Der Celebrator Doppelbock ist ein dunkles Bier mit einer bräunlichen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma wird dominiert durch Röstmalznoten. Der süßliche Geschmack verbindet sich perfekt mit den Aromen von Dörrobst. Außerdem besticht das Bier durch eine gewisse Cremigkeit. Ein schönes Bier für kalte Tage.

Pours dark brown with a light brown head that is short-lasting, transforming into a light brown foam ring with some foam bubbles on the top. Aroma is smoke, hop resin, nuts and caramel. Taste is raisins, caramel, accents of smokiness with a slightly bitter and long finish. Full bodied and creamy.

12oz bottle into a chalice. Pours a very dark brown with a slight tan ring of head. Nose is of roasted malts, plum, subtle hoppiness; rich and full bodied with dried fruit sweetness and caramel. Very slight sour note and a bit oaky on the finish. Complex, robust, warming. Simply gorgeous.
Pours dark brown, great sweet malty aroma and taste. Thick and smooth, absolutely one of my favorites.

Aromas are fairly subdued; a hint of sourness. Malts dominate with a touch of nuttiness. Hint of earthiness.

Color is very dark brown with a slight light tan head.

Taste is somewhat sweet, fairly light bitterness and some mild sourness.

Body is light to medium, texture slightly slick, carbonation just a bit below average. Finish shows carbonation and sourness.

Overall a decent beer but for my taste not a 4.0 beer. Its a bit different and somewhat interesting, but theres just not much that really grabs me.

Poured into a tumbler in late 2013.

S: Chocolate, slight coffee, very malty.

T: Coffee dominates. Chocolate is there too. Some bitterness also.

O: This is a coffee bomb. I loved other doppelbocks, but the bitterness in this one was too overwhelming. This was sadly a drain pour.

33cl flesje via 8 Zaligheden, Maastricht
Alcoholpercentage van 6,7%
Uitgeschonken in Grimbergen glas

Uiterlijk: donkerbruin, weinig schuim

Aroma en smaak: caramel, chocolade, donker fruit, ijzertje

Conclusie: wist niet dat deze de beste doppelbock was van ratebeer toen ik hem kocht, volle smaak inderdaad met een warm gevoel 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a dark amber with a deep dark ruby cast. Excellent head volume, World Class lacing and retention. Light nose of molasses coupled with a bit of dark fruit (plum, fig) and a slight undertone of spice. Medium bodied with a nice smooth texture that has creamy aspects. Below normal carbonation with just a touch of effervescence in the finish. The World Class flavor profile is reasonably intense, very complex and superbly balanced. It begins with a wave of sweet malt that is, at first, caramel and slightly burned dark sugar then flows into a rich molasses. In the middle as the molasses fades, dark fruit becomes evident as does an ever so slight hop bitterness. The finish is a slow sweet fade with notes of alcohol.
Bottle from Hippo Beers, Glasgow. Ruby with a cream head. The flavour is fruity, spicy with raisins, port, liquorice. Very drinkable and tasty.

Marrom, castanho claro. Bom formação e estabilidade de espuma. Aromas de toffee, tosta caramelizada, malte, leve fruta seca. Corpo médio-alto. No sabor o caramelo é mais intenso, torrado. Amargor baixo, aftertaste seco, aquecedor e doce. Melhor cerveja alemã que já degustei.

From Bottle. Pours a dark brown almost purplish hue with a light beige head. Decent lacing. Aroma of chocolate, dark bread, nuts, burnt toffee, leather. Taste is dark and rich with dark fruit, fig, clove, dark bread, smoked tobacco, and some hop bitterness tingling on my tongue. Medium mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Finishes dry, nutty, dark chocolate, and dark malt that is lasting. Not usually a fan of malty beers, but this is definitely an exception. It's almost like a German Quad. Just as wonderful as it is tasty!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark brown colour, beige head. Aroma of bread, plums, raisins, clove. Taste is light to medium sweet. Medium body, quite oily texture, soft carbonation. It has a strong flavour of clove and dried fruits. Very good, my 700 rating :)

Deep brown pour with slight burgundy hue to it. Light tan head. Aromas of dark fruits, slight coffee, caramel. Taste is sweet with a slight barleywine finish but cleans up dry. Medium body and light carb. Drinks pretty easy.

Deep brown with ruby highlights. Thick full creamy light brown head. Beautiful malty aroma. Chocolate. Molasses. Caramel. A little smokey and earthy. Some Dark fruit. Flavor follows. Medium body. Excellent balance. Creamy and smooth. Fantastic in every way.
velvety smooth, creamy, Full-bodied, yet light and smooth in some way. Sweet malt, dark fruit, great drink.

another one from poland. cam spotted it right away, said we had to get it. shoulda drunk it earlier tbh but thats life eh. split with him, rachel, garth. pours darkest brown with a tan head. big punchy aroma of fruit loaf and spicy caramel. tastes similar, dried fruit, red berries, sweet malty finish. its proper smooth and despite the abv it doesnt feel too boozy. worthy of the #1 spot, will have again whenever poss

light beige rather dense head leaves some lacing. redbrown colour. aroma is metallic, spices, quad esters. taste is honney, roasted malts aftertaste is bitter from the roasted malts. medium body and carbonation. bottle 33cl
Mahogany color with tan head; some lacing. Plum and raisin. Sweet finish.

A nice dark mahogany brew with a fine head that rises quickly but falls too fast. 

Aroma mainly reflects toasted malts, with hints of light molasses, caramel, and dark bread. I wish it were more robust like the flavor. 

T - Not strong or extreme, the flavor is predominately roasted malts, but is admirably rich. I find this otherwise excellent beer to be a little bit too sweet. 

M - full and smooth, but good carbonation leads to a somewhat lively mouthfeel. 

O - outstanding dopplebock
(from notes)
Brotig, malzig, süßlich, würzig. Malznoten dominieren, sehr süffig, brotig, karamellig, dunkle Früchte, etwas Schoko.

Dark translucent amber pour, short tan head. Nose is currants and toffee. Lightly bitter, more sweet. Middle is dark sweet bread, dark fruit (plums?). Finish shows a dry coco. Balanced, beautiful brew.
0,33l bottle courtesy of SinH4. An incredibly tasty yet complex German doppelbock, quite dry and short, but you could drink this one without stopping for hours.
Bottle to a pint. Deep Amber with foamy tan head and lacing. Dark fruit, spice and toffee. Smooth complex flavors, a beautiful beer for the holidays.
Vol dun karamel schuim, mooie cola kleur idd. Ruikt licht droppig. Licht in de mond, lekker, zoetig.
Pours a cola ish brown beer with a tan head. Smells dried fruits, flume, sweet and malts. Tastes herbs, dried fruit and malta. Average carbo, medium body and a sticky texture.
Pours a dark brown. Aroma and taste are caramel, dark fruits, and some earthiness.
@OPP. Samea kahvinruskea. Tuoksussa paahteista mallasta, kahvia, tummaa suklaata. Maussa paahteista täyteläistä mallasta, mokkaa, tummaa suklaata, siirappia.

Nice malty, sweet honey and little bit of chocolate aroma. Very well balanced, really creamy and soft. Kind of hard to believe its a doppelbock. Its like a bite of black bread, no alcohol at all in its taste. Really nice sunday afternoon beer.
Bottle from SB, chirstmas 2013. I remember that it was one of the best beer I had last christmas. Perfectly balanced and wonderfful aroma and taste. Strongly recommended!
Tap. Small brownish head, layered lace. Redish dark brown. Dark malts and cyrup on aroma. Sweet, figues and chokolate. Very pleasant, balanced and matured.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

This is the best bier Ive had all year, and I know Im probably getting overly committed. But this Deutsch Doppelbock is phenomenal. Ive been to Getmany, Holland and the Czech Republic this year snd tasted some wunderbar grogs. I can clearly smell the Bavarian specialty malts and ethanol as my glass approaches. The complex, deep, rich and satisfying flavors saturate with string binding kinetics on all available olfactory docking stations! Never would have thought Id deviate from my first love (W Coast Double IPAs) but do be it.
接近黑的深棕 6.5% 的酒精濃度不

On draft at Knife and Fork Inn (Atlantic City) for 5th Anniversary. Pours cola brown with a finger of frothy tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, caramel, earthy hops, and hints of dark fruit. Taste of dark malts, raisins, prune juice, earth, and a bit of toffee in finish.
Bottle from Brewcraft at PP. Dark brown pour. Bitter cinnamon biscuit aroma. Taste is very bitter, crisp, again gingerbread/cinnamon biscuit like. Solid. Would get again for thanksgiving!

Bottle at home courtesy of mctapps, cheers Sabinehazy peaty brown with tan lacing. Fruity prunes, sultana and milk chocolate. Lively carbonation, full bodied, sweet, dry, a little cloying and heavy, fruity, toasty notes, vegetal notes. Smells better than it tastes.
11.2 oz bottle, dark mahogany pour with beige lacing. Malt and honey nose. Figs, caramel, molasses, breads, sweet rasins, well blended and smooth. Big flavors, but easy to drink. Roasty dry finish.
Braun schwarz im Glas, malzig süßlich in der Nase, malzig nissig im Antrunk, süßliche röstnoten, netter Bock

I havent had many Dopplebocks but this is the beer that makes me want to have more. Damn its good. Oatmeal, roasted barley, burnt toffee, kibbles, leather, nuts and smokey tobacco come forth in both nose and wonderfully matching flavour. This fine specimen pours a colour akin to a watery dark roast coffee with a creamy tan head. The body, however, is quite rich and creamy with a nice smooth mouthfeel despite a light prickliness from the carbonation. A bitter bock that does it smooth as velvet.
redish brown, clear color, brown, light foam. in the nose malty, chocolate and some fruits. little carbonation, tastes malty, bitter, medium sweet finish. good body.
Pours a dark brown color, topped with a fine tan colored head. Malty aroma, some fruits and caramel also present. Sweet, malty, caramel. Not my favourite.

Bottle. Dark red/brown body with a tall head. Aroma has a warm bready roast with all kinds of red berries. Silky smooth mouthfeel. Bready taste with a nice roast and pleasant hop bitterness. Chewy finish with more roasty bread. Great balance. So fulfilling. Maybe its because the timing is just right but tonight it feels almost perfect.

Dark brown/black in appearance. Tan head, sweet malty aroma with hints of caramel and raisins. Smooth taste with roasty sweet malt, slight coffee and hints of caramel, and raisins. Medium body, low carbonation. Low hoppiness, light bitterness. My favorite doppelbock to date.

Bottle from Mogwai Mat&Bar. Aroma of malts, raisins and dates. Pours dark brown with a small beige head. Taste is very sweet and full of malts. Palate, though, is very thin and drinkable. Overall a disappointment, heard much good stuff about this beer but I guess it is not my type of beer.
Very smooth caramel flavor. Excellent beer, one of my favorites along with Optimator. Only negative is that is more expensive than Optimator.

12 oz bottle, poured into a tulip at approximately 45 degrees F.

A: Pours like a heavy molten caramel, and settles into the glass a deep, rich ruby brown, like a well-worn bit of mahogany furniture. Holding the glass to daylight reveals burnished copper-bronze highlights and the faint shadows of fingers on the opposite side of the glass, with bubbles streaming merrily by. The head is impressively thick and foamy, a beige color, which leaves rather persistent and thorough lacing down the glass.

S: Warm baked bread, sprinkled with crumbles of toffee and drizzled with sweet caramel, open the aroma. Lurking beneath the malt bouquet are some fruity notes, like currants and dates with a suggestion of plum. The nose is yeasty, malty, and warm.

T: That is, in fact, a liquid loaf of brown bread, dunked in caramel and molasses, then dipped in toffee as if breading it for frying. While the previously mentioned fruit hints are present, if deeply buried, there is a distinct note like old leather and an almost chicory sort of bite as it goes along. Towards the finish, there is a bitterness not unlike a varnished wood, which fades into a molasses sweetness during some sips, and lingers as a wooden bitterness with others. As the beer warms, the odd bitter notes fade into the background, allowing the sweet, rich, and complex malt to star unmolested, and allowing the currant-date notes to come more forward.

M: Full, rich, and sticky, this beer clings to every mouth surface. Theres a sharpness from the carbonation, which seems a wee bit heavy to me.

O: Given the wooden and slightly earthy notes this doppelbock carries, I understand why many tout it as the best of the doppelbock line. I am in no way suggesting this is undeserved, nor that this is a poor quality beer in any way, shape, or form, but it is not my favorite doppelbock as a devout malthead. The odd notes that seem like hops trying to come a little too forward for my liking cut down on my enjoyment - when I want a doppelbock, I want glorious, unrelenting malt and associated flavors, not anything trying to balance or even display hop flavors. Hence, my rating this beer below other doppelbocks, in spite of my unabashed Privatbraurei Aying fanboyism.
UPDATED: NOV 11, 2014 Aroma of rasins, cherries and oak. Thick oker brown head. Smooth vanilla, bit of rasins and malty flavours but not too sweet. A bit dry rauchbier like aftertaste. Great bock!

Bottle poured into pint glass. Looks great. I wasnt a fan of the hints of fruit in the aroma and lingering in the aftertaste. You.can tell that it is quality, I just wasnt a fan of the plum/raisin overtones.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2017 From the bottle at Bräustüberl Aying. Finally. Beautiful black appearance with small grey head that becomes a ring soon (edit: when you pour it not as carefully as the waiters there do, the foam is huge!)  Aroma is complex and balanced, malty, coffeeish, bready. Taste is amazingly smooth, with roasted malts, bitter espresso, bread, not sweet or boozy at all. Smooth creamy mouthfeel - a bit watery maybe, but not irritating - and a rather dry finish which is still a bit warming. A bit of chocolate remaining. Low carbonation. Very balanced from the beginning to the end. Super Doppelbock!

As Winterbock at Ayingers am Platzl. From the memory, I?d say it?s more fruity and more intense than Celebrator, but I?ll have to try them side by side.

Did try them side by side at the Bräustüberl - indeed, Celebrator is drier and the Winterbock is more fruit-forward. However, it seems as though they have the same recipe, just different Lagering. More investigation to come.
Tap during the Starkbierzeit in Aying. Lower carbonation, closer to the Winterbock, but still a different offering!

Pretty fun this be. Pours a dark ruby with a massive tan head. Aroma is of plums, caramel, leather, and raisins. Tastes of caramel, big raisin, brown bread, and roasted malts. Has a medium body that is creamy and very rich. It is almost like drinking raisin bread.

Pitch back, ruby highlights, beige head. Smell is powerfull, lots of coffee and nice dark chocolate with some breadiness, drop, leather. Touch of salt and spices, cinamon, pepper.
Taste is smooth and watery with a bitter finish. Refreshing. Oily finish with touch of wood.

Pours clear deep brown with deep amber around the margins, one fat finger of light beige head diminishing gradually to a thin cap, minimal lacing. (4/5) Nose is dark fruits (raisins), chocolate and roasted malts. (9/10) Taste is moderate sweet and mild bitter. (9/10) Light to medium body, slightly oily texture, low sustained carbonation, lingering bitter, slightly smokey finish. (4/5)

Excellent traditional dopplebock. The ABV is very well-integrated, and is apparent in neither the nose or the taste, but only as a gentle warming toward the end of the glass. Surprisingly light body and texture given the appearance. Definitely appropriate as a winter warmer at whatever midwinter celebration you observe. (18/20)

Bottle thanks to VanJamer @ BA, thanks! Pours a dark reddish brown with a medium beige head that settles into a thin veil but mostly a ring that leaves some lacing. Nose is of raisins and other dark fruits, chocolate and roasted malt. Taste is moderately sweet and offers more raisins along with some caramel and roast. Finish is lightly bitter and roasted. Body is medium-full and carbonation light to medium. Overall a really nice dark ale, Id drink a lot of that!
Dark brown, lacing lasting light brown foam head. Sweet caramel aroma and so also taste. Some fruit tones, but still remains quite sweet. (Rotterdam 201411)

Bottle. Mahogany color with tan head; some lacing. Plum and raisin aroma. Plum and raisin. Sweet finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Light malty smell, sweet malty taste, smooth, dark plum flavor, very light hops, medium heavy

This is a very good beer and its a reference to what is a Doppelbock. Pure and classic, no experiments - just good brewing techniques and best ingredients (and according to the Reinheitsgebot). Even if I rated other Doppelbocks higher as I liked the special tastes more, this is the beer you need to drink when you want to taste the real Doppelbock as it should be!

average fizzy light brown head. good lacing. mostly diminishing. flat thick dark orange body. aroma: moderate malty, dark chocolate, mild coffee, dried fruits, ruby port, dried banana. if: heavy sweet. ff: moderate sweet bitter; long duration. palate: light medium body, watery/oily texture, lively carbonation, chalky moderate alcoholic finish. Dulçor de frutas secas com backbone maltada. Forte aquecimento (confunde-se com o amargor). Amargor de casca de fruta não equilibra muito bem por seu gosto não ser tão agradável, sendo considerado por mim uma falha. 
100 s

Pours a dark amber color with a nice thick head. 
Sweet malty smell. Beer is first sweet tasting, hints of fruit finishing off with a strong malty taste with just a hint of bitterness. Nice and complex. 
Overall a very good doppelbock.

Bottle. Sweet figure attached! Pours a beautiful intense dark brown amber with big brown head, that settles nicely to one finger head. Aroma is tons of malty caramel. Bready and loads of dried fruits, toffee. Slight toast. Taste is medium sweet, caramel, brown sugar and pleasant toasty finish light bitter. Medium body with creamy carbonation. Kind of fresh, despite the dense malt-bombe character.

Een donkerbruine Duitse dubbelbock, geur van mout, caramel, chocola, donker fruit. Smaak van gebrand mout, caramel, donker fruit, rozijnen. Licht bitter met een lekker verrassend zoetje. Afdronk is ook licht bitter. Een lekkere dubblebock, onverwacht van genoten.

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2014 Bottle, about 1 year old.
Very dark copper body, with a medium, creamy, dark beige head.
Smooth, complex aroma of nuts, dark chocolate, wood, smoke, burnt sugar, dried fruits.
Amazing taste with about the same aromas, with an incredible balance and smoothness.
Medium to full, creamy mouthfeel, with a smooth, medium carbonation and it finishes smooth, roasty, slightly dry, with a wonderful dark chocolate, wood, some smoke, some dark fruits and with a slight, satisfying alcohol warmth.

Completely worth the ratings, this is by far the best Doppelbock in the world! The balance is just oustanding, accomplished to pure perfection! Full, but not too filling, actually surprisingly drinkable for this style, but still really complex and with the characteristic Ayinger smoothness at the same time. Amazing!
33cl @ bottle. Finalmente una birra tedesca che mi convince appieno. Una scura cremosa e corposa. Buona.

Aroma of bready malts, caramel, chocolate, dark fruits, light smoke. Flavour is malty, a bit roasty, medium sweet (relatively moderate compared to most Bocks), with a moderate bitter finish. Well-balanced and easily drinkable. One of the better Bocks Ive had.

Robe noir profond, reflets rouges.Mousse crémeuse blanche.
Arômes délicieux des malts grillés, torréfiés à lextrême.Belle amertume finale.Très équilibrée.Beau produit.Un des meilleurs double bock goûté.

Deep black beer with a small beige head.
Taste is caramel, dark fruits, cocoa, roasted malts(smoky) with some nice bitterness.
Aftertaste is also roasted and light bitter.
Nice Doppelbock and easy to drink.

Bottle. Small, tan head, almost black, clear body.
Aroma: Caramel, bread, some plum, minimal roast.
Taste: Sweet with some sourness. Flavor of caramel, compot, bread, some coins.
Medium body, low carbonation, good drinkability. Good beer, but not shocking.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2014 330ml bottle served in a mug.
A: Pours a clear deep and dark amber color. Nutty. Forms a big beige and bit creamy head when poured. Medium retention and only few lacings formed and left in the glass
S: Very toffee. Roasted malts, brown bread ans Lager yeasts. However, its quite fruity with notes of raisins and figs. Oak. Lovely 
T: Sweet upfront. Toffee, roasted malts, caramel malts, brown bread, Lager yeasts. Notes of chocolate. Light hoppy/roasted bitterness in the end
M: Medium body. Slightly molasses. Medium to low carbonation. Aftertaste is roasted and light bitter 
O: Excellent drinkability. State of art German Doppelbock
[ BA Review @ 9/28/2012 ]

Very rich and malty. It's as if they liquified a Charleston chew. Thick yet goes down smooth. Of all dark and heavy beers double bock's... This has been my favorite. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very rich and malty, almost like candy (caramel?). Thick and chewy, but remarkably easy to drink - goes down smooth. Of all dark and heavy beers, this one makes a great introduction to the style for the novice (albeit in the sink or swim mentality).
Cerveja muito boa. licorosa, frutada, bela aparência, espuma persistente, linda cor e sabor surpreendente

duft: rugbrød. ikke meget duft
smag: malt karamel. sødme fatter ikke den har fået 100 på ratebeer. den er meget klassisk og kedelig

Draught taster @ Noe Is De Bok Vet, Valkenburg. Deep dark brown, Sweet dried fruits like raisins, dades and figs, hazelnut, spicy clove and pepper, gingerbread, creamy malts. Dry finish. Medium prickling carbonation, rich body. Very nice bock.

33 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ Hogerdijk, Culemborg.
Dark brown in color with a beige head. Intense malty aroma with dark fruits and roasted malts. Creamy mouthfeel. One of the best doppelbocks I had

0.33 l bottle in tulip glass. Pour is dark brown with thin brown head. Licorice, malt and dried prune aromas. In the mouth its very sweet with lots of caramel malts. Dark fruit and licorice flavors. Pretty light taste. Very special German beer!

Bottle from Liviko Alcostore in Tallinn ( 2,00). BB Jan 2015. Pours a very dark mahogany brown that appears black in the glass; it has a tan head that retains and laces nicely. Aroma reminds me of caramel candy and burnt sugar, theres also some ashy roastiness, and a note of smoked plums or dates, and burnt raisins. Taste begins with dry, roasty and smoky notes coated in a thick, plummy and caramelly sweetness, then turns into a short and modest hop-driven bitterness, whereas in the finish its again roasty and dry with a caramelly overcoat. Medium plus body. Palate smooth with a somewhat sticky mouthfeel. Finish grainy and dry. Gently carbonated, yet has some crispness. I quite like it but it does not make me a Bock fan.
11.2 FL OZ ($2.99) pretty good dark beer. It is also 7.2% ABV so higher than listed on the site. easy drinking dark beer.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2016 Medium mokka brown head, black with a brown glow body, sweet malty sugary smell, medium carbonation and bitter coffe taste sticky creamy a bit of ice cream sweetness, gentle, full body some cacao, nice
Van de tap bij Charlies tijdens bokken en happen in 2014. Donker bruin met ren creme kraag. Geur is koffie en aards. Smaak is mooi vol met cacao en koffie, erg goede bok
Koffie kleurig bier met een crème kleurig schuimkraag. Smaak koffie zoet. Zoet van smaak. Gedronken met bokken en happen.

Old notes from summer 2014. Wow, this is really foaming! More than half of the glass is filled with foam and it seems to have decided to stay. Beer is mahogany brown, clear but not transparent as its so dark. Perfect. Aroma has some burnt sugar, caramel, lollipop candy, coca-cola. Unusually great. Sweet and full of dark plums. This is good. Taste is sweeter, more dried black plums, dates and fig fruits - but finishing dry, dry stout roastiness where you can spot dried plums that are not sweet any longer. I can understand why this beer has been praised by so many people, its really great. Aftertaste is dry and full of roast flavours. Really enjoyable, would not have expected something like this from a doppelbock - but I guess that this beer embodies everything that is great about this style.

Large beige head deep dark brown pour aromas grain caramel toffee brown sugar vanilla chocolate the flavours grain caramel toffee brown sugar nutty lots of nut lacks body though but still good the best tastes sweet notes grain bitter taste bit rough on palate and overrated
Prototypical doppelbock in every way really. Strong malt notes. Perfectly infused with caramel flavor. At the other end of the equation, just the right amount of hops. Well done.
Ambré foncer avec un grand tête beige foncer, presque marron. Larôme du malt, malt torréfié, sucré brun et mélasse. Le goût à tous ses carecteristiqies aussi.

11.2 oz. bottle. Pours a rich, deep, dark brown with a frothy tan head that lingers for days. Aroma is sweet and consists of hints of chocolate, soy sauce, caramel, and dark raisins. Taste is slightly sweet with flavors of unsweetened chocolate, toffee, and maybe some kind of dark dried fruit. Medium bodied with a creamy texture. Has a long, semi-dry finish. This is one of my favorite beers. Every time I have one I make the Homer Simson, "Ohhhhhh", sound. Seriously!

33cl bottle. BBE 01.15 Malty, slightly thin body, gentle carbonation. This one of the most readily available doppelbocks, and is a template for many others. Good when warm and cold. No alcohol background or easty aftertaste. Perfect balance of malt, gentle bitterness of hops and dark sugars. Everyone will find something enjoyable in this beer.

bottle @ De Tolly Joogipood. Pour dark brown with small brownish head. Aroma of sweet malts, caramel. Taste is lightly roasted sweet malts, caramel, bread. dried dark fruits. Medium body, soft carbonation, well balanced. Good one.

Review based on the BJCP2008 guidelines (style 5C). Bottle 33 cl - Batch L4013. AROMA: sweet and pleasant malt aromatics with some toasty, bread crust and caramelly notes. no hop aroma and very faint dried grapes aromas. APPEARANCE: dark Brown color with ruby highlights. good clarity. average moussy head with dark ivory color and good retention. TASTE: very nice flavours ranging from a plethora of melanoidins with toasty notes and bread crust. sweet malty background with a clean lager profile without any kind of diacetyl. low bitterness. finishes semi-sweet. PALATE: medium-full body with moderately-low carbonation. smooth. OVERALL: a very nice exemple of a traditional doppelbock which is delicious and a feast for the senses.
Bottle. Pours brown with deep red hues and tan head. Aroma is chocolate, fruity, caramel, roasty, sweet. Taste is very roasty, chocolate, medium bodied, good carbonation. Really good.

Dark brown beer, small beige head. Nose is yeast, chocolate notes, malt, caramel, slight metallic edge. Flavor is fruity-malty, caramel, noticeable alcohol presence, dry and bitter finish with lingering bready notes. Lacks that plentiful malt character for me.

Bottle pour. Pours super dark with a cream tan head and a roasted malt aroma. Toasty, bready malt flavor with some hints of banana and dark fruit. A touch of smokey flavor as well. New style of beer for me, and I enjoyed this a lot. Good beer.

Flasche (33 cl). - Tiefdunkles Kastanienbraun, üppige hellbraune Schaumkrone. - In der Nase dichte Malzsüße, Kaffee, Rosinensüße. - Im Antrunk starker, gut gesüßter Kaffee, Röstmalz und Karamel, dazu eine vornehme Fruchtigkeit (eine Andeutung von Pflaumenmus). Schwach rezent, dicht und schwer im Mund. Der Abgang ist leicht trocken, etwas rauchig und bringt wieder Mokka, Lakritz und ein wenig holzige Herbe - für Hopfenaromen bleibt hier verständlicherweise kaum Platz. - Perfekt ausbalancierter Doppelbock mit vornehmen Röstmalz- und Bitterschokoladearomen, den man erst so richtig schätzen lernt, wenn man etliche verbockte Böcke verkostet hat. Was natürlich fehlt, ist die reiche Fruchtigkeit obergäriger (belgischer) Starkbiere - hier muß ein untergäriger Doppelbock einfach passen.
Nice clean finish. No bitter back. Head lacing was just ok. Head retention almost non existent. Clean bock with light chocolate undertones.

330 mml bottle tasted the 13/09/2014. Dark colour with a tan creamy and medium to long head. Aroma of roasted malts, caramel, coffee, toffee and some herbs. The taste is complex and well balanced with presence of the hops, caramels, dark fruits and roasted malts. Aftertaste is nice with a good mix between dry and bitter. Next one please!

Bottle at home. The colour is very deep nut brown and with a big, creamy, light brown head. Compact aroma of chocolate, dried fruit, some smoked meat, dark chocolate and roasted malt in the background. More roast in the flavour with rye bread, ash, sweet chocolate, wood and some coffee. Has a rich and silky mouth feel, and a light bitterness. A well balanced and roasted doppelbock.
Bottle from Lazy Dog. Pours an opaque black with tan colored head. Aroma of malts and some dark fruits. Taste

33 cl in snifter. Pours a dense almost stout like dense thick beige medium head; deep dark impenetrable black/browny colour. Smells sweet and roasted malts, balck forest cake, dried fruits raisins, banana, vanillaish ; thats nice. Taste is very balanced and overall not that sweet as you would imagine from the smell; the roastiness from the malts its always there, then cherry, sort of fruity, and cocoa taste going towards a light bitter finish. Perfect carbonation, balanced, tasty, rich but very drinkable too, as the best germans. See it as a sort of mix between a dark belgian ale and a small touch of a stout.
Pours a coffee-black color with a tan, creamy head. Vinous, raisiny, Whoppers malted milk balls aroma. Perfect carbonation, perfect malt balance. Overall, a classic in the Doppelbock style.

Bottle poured into a Delirium Tremens snifter.


A - Pours dark nut brown with a nice one finger tall tan head, dissipating down to a thin film, leaving small wisps of lace down the glass.


S - Smells of rich caramel malt, toffee, chocolate, molasses, dark fruits like raisins and figs, and some light booze. Pretty sweet smelling overall.


T - Starts off with a mix of toffee and sweet caramel malt slowly giving way to hints of chocolate, molasses, dark fruit, and some dark candied sugar. A bit of booze begins to creep in toward the end of the glass.The finish is a mix of dark sweetness and light dryness, lingering for some time.


M - Medium body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Rich, sweet, feel with plenty of sweetness lingering through the finish.


O - This one is very sweet but it has plenty of flavors going on to keep you interested. I wouldnt say this is the best dopplebock I have ever had but it is up there.
Flaska från Sue Ellen. Svart med ljusbrunt skum. Söt maltig doft. Riktigt smarrig dubbelbock.

Flaska på Sue Ellen. 
Mörk mörk rödbrun vätska med brunt skum. 
Doftar kola. 
Smakar kola med en lätt fruktig ton. 
Händer inte så mycket i munnen. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a dark caramel brown with a tan head. Toffee, malt, toast, biscuit, earthy, wood and slightly sweet aroma. Toffee, malt, caramel, toast, biscuit, wood, earth, slight dark fruit, nut and ginger flavors. Full body and average carbonation with a toffee, biscuit and malty finish.
UPDATED: OCT 22, 2014 Botella de 33 cl, adquirida en una tienda gourmet de Bejar. Color negro. Sabor a malta tostada, regaliz, ligeramente a lupulo.

Pours dark brown with a tan frothy head. Malty, oatmeal aroma with some hoppy notes. Taste begins quite strong but quickly balances out. Noticeable roasted taste in the end. Smooth mouthfeel, soft carbonation, quite enjoyable feeling. Its pretty good even though Im not sure if I like the roastiness in this style.
Black pour with a slightly beige head. Aroma is really woody and sweet, at taste various notes of wood, syrup, candy, licorice, coffee. Mouthfeel is great.

Appearance- dark, dark, dark mocha/mahogany brown. Big, tan, frothy long lasting head. Very little lacing (if any). 

Smell- nutty, chocolate, ginger, caramel.
