Taste- deep dark chocolate (very much like high % cacao), fig, coffee. Sweetness up front, bitter on the back. 

Mouthfeel- smooth, silky, medium body.

Overall- outstanding! Excellent! A great Dopplebock. Would absolutely recommend. 

Cheers!

UPDATED: AUG 23, 2014 Pours black with a beautiful tan head of medium lifetime. A dark amber hue shines through when held against the light. The nose is brimming with notes of dark cane sugar, caramel, nuts, and butteriness. Surprisingly, the roastiness of this beer doesnt come off as strong until it makes its appearance on the mid-palate following the not-too-sweet maltose front. It then stays, in form of a gentle coffee note, well into the dry finish. Medium carbonation and a full body combined with a slightly astringent tannic quality make the mouthfeel pleasant. A refined brew with a big yet down-to-earth flavor.

Completely black, cant even see red hue when light is behind the glass. Small to medium sized off-white head. Roasted malts, chocolate and coffee aroma. A bit smoked. Some sweetness, some bitterness. Medium body, soft carbonation, kind of creamy. Well balanced. 
(Pivoljub 0,33l bottle)

Treacle? Great beer, and a new favourite -must get more.
Beautifully crafted, and a true original...

Bottle from Whole Foods in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is dark fruits, roasted malts. Taste is raisins, dry chocolate, something ashy yet creamy. A wonderfully rich yet completely session-able concoction. A go-to German beer.

For a lager very nice for a doppelbock 
 Dark with an awesome head sweet aroma. Very velvet perfect mouthfeel. Taste is raisin burnt candies. Not much aroma. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Deep brown color, almost black with creamy head. Aroma is sweet caramel, brown sugar, fresh danish rugbrød. Taste is medium sweet. Brown sugar, raisins, dark fruits and some spices. A bit grassy bitterness in the finish. Soft carbonation, full bodied and smooth. Would be great as a winter warmer.
Very good. Full of flavor and one of the better looking beers you will see. Always a go to.

Bottle, backlog. Pours dark brown with four fingers compact beige foam slowly dissipating, leaving some lacings. Aroma is fruit, mostly dried, banana, dark chocolate, hints of liquorice and some floral bitter hops. Above all very malty. Taste is elegantly malty and round without being thick as a porter/stout, dried fruit, unsweetened chocolate, a subtle bitterness. A slight smokey hint in the finish. Full body, soft carbo, smooth texture. This is fucking ace. Extremely well balanced throughout.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2016 Im not a huge doppelbock fan, but this one is really good. It pours dark, chocolate brown with a head that disappears quickly. The aroma is caramel, coffee, candied fruit. It all adds up to a smell that is something like Dr. Pepper. The flavor adds a really rich, chocolate malt at the finish. This beer is sweet, but not too sweet. Its just right.

Dark brown color with reddish hue, big brown creamy head. Full body, soft carbonation. Thick creamy texture. Aroma of dark fruits, roasted malt, caramel. Smooth and balanced. Medium sweet taste with some very light bitterness. Very nice.

Bottle to shaker glass. Pours black (red shines tough when held to light), two finger head, some lacing. Aroma of ripe dark fruits, coffee, smoke. Taste is malty bittersweet, not much hop bitterness. Full bodied, medium carbonation, smooth malty mouth feel. Finishes quite dry with note of dark chocolate, smoked malts and caramel. Best beer Ive tasted for this style.

Cerveza oscura con reflejos rubí intensos. Buena formación de espuma y baja estabilidad. Su aroma resulta muy maltoso con notas que nos recuerdan a frutas rojas maduras y caramelo. Las notas alcohólicas están presentes pero de una manera bien integrada y equilibrada. EL sabor está en buena correspondencia con el aroma y su cuerpo es medio y está bien carbonatada. Su retrogusto es seco y deja al final del trago cierto dulzor residual. Se trata de una cerveza que es un referente en cuanto a su estilo y se lo tiene bien merecido.
the description is apt. It is a bit bitter/mildly tart but has roasted malt flavor and aroma throughout. Very dry finish. Good body. Not a bad brew.

0,33L bottle, BB 01.15. Pours dark brown with tan head. The head stays for a moment. Aroma is caramel, malt, and yeast. Flavor is sweet, caramel, malt, dark fruits, and syrup. Finish is dry malty bitter. Overall: very nice brew.

Deep brown color, small beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, dried fruits, caramel and chocolate. Sweet taste has similar notes with hint of smoked wood in gently bitter roasty finish. Medium body and soft carbonation. Delicious beer.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours dark brown with a tan head. Taste carmel, chocolate, fruity. I thought this was pretty good. I would definitely drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours dark brown, almost black with medium tan head. Aroma of chocolate, some coffee, caramel, dark fruit, smoke, roasted malts, toffee. Creamy. Medium to full body. Really niice surprise, great beer.
11.2 oz bottle. Pours nearly black with a thick tan head. A roasty, malty aroma...coffee and milk. Sweet malts, molasses, smoky...lightly bitter. Smooth mouthfeel. Fairly thick lacing.
Thick rich taste, smooth malty caramel finish, thin tan head, very very good, worth the trip just for this beer.  At Hofbrauhaus in Helen GA.

UPDATED: NOV 7, 2014 Famous Bavarian Doppelbock, one of the references in its style.  Thick, dense and regular, light beige head leaving some lacing on the edges; colour a very dark wine red, clear with no visible fizz.  Charming, assertive malt aroma, cookies, toasted brown bread, dough, molasses, freshly grated nutmeg, butterscotch, cocoa powder, dried banana, raisins, liquorice, Irish coffee, figs, dried leaves, iron, biscuit, sweet tobacco, hint of brandy and something meaty.  In the mouth a dried fruitiness kicks off, sweetish but nowhere cloying or sugary, dried plums and dried apricots, slick and somewhat fatty mouthfeel, finely tingling carbonation, on a very pure, deep and layered maltiness of caramel, walnuts, bitter chocolate and in the end some gentle roasted, coffee-like bitterness, spreading over the tongue, accompanied by a leafy, German hop bitterness and warming, agreeable, brandy-like alcohol which in all remains quite well hidden (i.e. does not become prevalent).  I would not say this is the best German beer I ever had, but if I had to introduce any beer neophyte to the "dunkler Doppelbock" style, Id go for this (or Andechser Doppelbock, perhaps).  In any case, this remains a great classic and a beautiful illustration of the true meaning of maltiness in beer.  Elegant, warming and very rewarding.  Enjoyed this a lot, revisited after ten years or so.

Bouteille. La Cervoise 91. Robe marron profond, mousse beige crémeuse. Nez de malt noir et torréfié avec une dominante fruitée sur le pruneau. En bouche cest suave et caressant. De belles notes de sucre brun, de malt grillé, de café et toujours ce pruneau avec ses notes de fruit noir confit légèrement acide. Une doppelbock incoutournable.

Red/brown with a thin beige head.
Aroma is sweet with chocolate and caramel.
Taste has chocolate, caramel, roasted malt, smooth hop bitterness, slight alcohol.
Medium body, soft carbonation, smooth mouth feel.
After taste is chocolatey and herbal bitter.
Paired this to a thick ham, cheese and leek crepe. Great combo!

330 ml bottle with custom plastic Bock pendant bought at Gorgeous Wine & Cigar in Yuen.
Looks: Opague Cola black colour; One-quarter finger head and beige foam which fades in 30 seconds; Small sticky lacing with zero carbonation.

Aroma: Fragrant, sweet and rich dark malt which can be smelt as soon as it was popped, with strong caramel, toffee, coffee, brown sugar, light cream, roasted nuts and faint grass.

Taste: Mid to light sweet dark malt, with very strong roastyness, light nuts, shades of smoke, caramel, light toffee, veruy light dark fruits, light Cola, molasses, very light black coffee, very light lemon and very light bitter hops and faint grass.

Body: Mid to light; Slick and smooth palate. 

Mouth Feel: Stout-like dark malt in a moderate to thin body with superb roastyness - probably the most roastiest dark malt Ive tasted so far - plus light roasted nuts, matching caramel and toffee. Black coffee and cream are light. Good light molasses, Cola background. This is a Doppelbock proper, but more akin to a good Stout. Wooooo!...

Hoppiness: Faint grass nose, very light lemon and faint grassy taste. Bitterness is fairly low-fi in background, match well with roastyness and sweetness for a nice low-bitter finish.

After Taste: Fairly dry. Very easy to mouth.

Comments: This is really unique among most Doppelbocks: its aroma, taste, looks, body and palate really resembles how a nice Stout should end up and tasted. Its roastyness takes the centre stage and clicks with all other light elements. If you are expecting something like Paulaner Salvator or other sweet strong Doppelbock then you are in for a surprise. Subtle and nice!
Bottle. Pours dark dark brown with a frothy head. Nose has loads of sweetness, raisins, figs, vanilla and prunes. Taste has light yeast, loads of dried fruits, caramel and vanilla.
Rich brown sweet bread, a bit figgy, medium-thick velvety mouthfeel, practically chuggable, delicious.

Smell – A big brown bread aroma with strong roasted malt aromas. Mixed in with the breadiness there is a nice sweetness of molasses and brown sugar rounding out the roast very nicely. Taste – A thick bready base with big roasted malt flavors greets the tongue nicely. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a deep amber,thick mocha foam. Aroma is dark cocoa,figs,nuts,sweet booze. Taste is sweet,caramel,figs,slight booze,cocoa,sirupy. Very nice.

Barwa: ciemna, pod światło rubinowa, przejrzysta. Piana beżowa, drobno pęcherzykowa, średniej wielkości, ładnie oblepiająca szkło i utrzymująca się aż do końca. [5/5]

Aromat: zdecydowanie słodowy - karmel, melanoidyny, suszone śliwki, czekolada gorzka, orzechy. Alkohol prawie niewyczuwalny. [4/5]

Smak: pełny słodowy, słodki z lekką nutą kwaskową. Następnie czekolada, kawa, akcenty palone i jakby marcepanowe. Goryczka niewielka, alkohol dobrze ukryty.

This beer is the real deal German Doppelbock, "-ator" ending and all from visual appeal to taste. Packaging is beautiful with the dark brown bottle as backdrop for the light blue label punctuated by the amber-red glass of beer. The finishing touch which I love (see picture) is the small goat hung from a red thread--just a classy finishing touch to say "were really proud of our product." Very eye catching. Beautiful nearly black, amber color so inviting with the creamy tan head, washes smoothly, beautifully over the tongue very complex but well blended flavors with ever so slight chocolaty notes to me, some bitterness on finish but not overpowering. The only thing that detracted for me a bit, resulting in a slightly lower aroma score, was the aroma upon finishing the pour--it was slightly--no other word for it--"tin canny." Ever so slight but just noticeable. It did not in any way come through in the actual taste of the beer and was then indistinguishable by half way through the glass of beer (drunk from a stemmed, rounded belly goblet that allows aromas to experienced well). This was my first tasting so it may have been an aberration. Aside from that aspect, which I cant call "very minor" since, for me, the pre-first drink aroma experience is part of the overall experience, the beer is superb. I would definitely recommend it to a friend. As a matter of fact I did and he fell in love with it.

Flaske fra Kihoskh, på hytta juli-14: dette må være et av de beste kjøpene man kan gjøre på Kihoskh for noen og tyve kroner. En symfoni av aroma og smaker i et velkomponert hele. Eksepsjonet velbalansert og i tillegg farlig lettdrikkelig. Burde hatt en advarsel fra Sundhetsbestyrelsen: denne er vanedannende.
Doughy-head, aroma is slightly smoky, salty. Chocolate, cherry, vanilla, complex taste, defininite hop presence. Mouthfeel is round and silky. Lingering taste of licorice, woody.

The body has a very dark brown color in the glass and when held up to light it has nice garnet highlights. Some small bubbles of carbonation can be seen in the highlights and near the edges of the glass. On top sits a tight head of light brown foam which slowly settles down to small cap that hangs on till the last sip. Lacing is slick and slides right down the glass as I drink. In the nose I get notes of sweet caramel, fresh sweet bread, ripe fruit and a kiss of German hops. The flavor has a sweet overall character with moderate hoping that comes through in the end to finish things up without becoming too sweet or cloying. Up front are the caramel candy, brown sugar, light molasses and brown pear like fruit notes. Towards the finish bready notes become more toasted and mix with some light hop flavors to temper the overall sweetness. The finish is short and still on the sweet side but in a good way. Carbonation is lively enough to lift the palate of the solid, smooth, and full body and leave you wanting that next sip.

Another great Ayinger! Pours a dark brown with a gorgeous tan head that leaves lacing and seems to rise. The aroma is of coffee and perhaps some maple-type syrup, or is it caramel? Not really sure. Lets just say burnt caramel. The taste takes some getting used to unless youre into stouts, then youre right at home. Definitely high medium to full bodied and tasty. Not really my flavor but I still enjoyed it for breakfast.
Super delicious. Tastes sweeter and fruiter than i expected. Very rich but not too heavy. Top quality yay :)

Dark brown color with beige medium persistent head. Nuts on the aroma, with brown sugar, toasted malts and dark fruits. Medium body. Brown sugar and malts are also present on the taste, with toffee, caramel, chocolate and dark fruit hints. Although its Doppelbock is not one of my favourite styles, this one is the best on them Ive tried.

Sötét vörösesbarna, már-már fekete színe van és a duplabakokra oly jellemző illata. Rendkívül összetett és kerekded ízvilág jellemzi, melyben a komló kesernyéje szinte táncot jár az édeskés zamatokkal és mindezt annyira természetesen közvetíti, mintha e két szereplő által formált jellemvonás egy önálló alapíz lenne. Rendkívüli módon itatja magát, de nem szomjoltó értelemben, hanem az ízlelőbimbóink könyörgését kielégítendő. Íze nem halványul, vagy tompul az idő elteltével. Tökéletes sör összbenyomását kelti egyáltalán nem alaptalanul.
A solid beer and possibly my favorite Doppelbock! Very creamy head and taste at the beginning. An excellent beer to go with a great hearty meal.

Transfer from BA review on 5-4-12-
 Poured from 330 ml bottle into tulip shaped glass

Appearance  Pours a thick looking deep brown color with a large off-white head. The head had big carbonation bubbles entrapped within and faded quite fast. Upon fading it left a persistent film on the surface of the brew.

Smell  A big bready brown bread aroma with strong roasted malts aromas. Mixed in with the breadiness there is a nice sweetness of molasses and brown sugar rounding out the roast very nicely.

Taste  A thick bready base with big roasted malt flavors greets the tongue nicely. The taste begins a little on the drier side and sweetness as notes of brown sugar and molasses enter the scene. At the end, the roastiness, when mixed with the sweet creates a somewhat sweetened coffee flavor. This brew has some very nice transitions and all the flavors at all times complement each other very nicely. Fantastic.

Mouthfeel  Quite a creamy body with a lower level of carbonation. With this the flavors really have a chance to sit on the tongue and really permeate the taste buds. A very soothing and wonderful mouthfeel

Overall  Smooth in body and taste transitions with great flavors and aromas. This is one great drinking beer.

Bottle, 500 ml, as Ayinger Winter Bock. Pours cloudy dark ruby with a tiny amount of tan head. Big hit of blackcurrent and cherry on the nose, backed up by dark fruits, brown sugar and a caramel malt base, along with a small spice note and a bit of alcohol. Has a somewhat smoky character to it as well. Taste of brown sugar, bready malts, raisin, nutmeg, toffee and some grassy hoppy bitterness on the finish. Soft carbonation and a moderately full body, this one is certainly smooth. The brilliant warming effect makes me wish Id drunk this in the winter as suggested by the name, rather than the height of summer...

Pours a black, like coca-cola. Small head. Little lacing. Aroma is malt and dark fruits. Big malty flavor. Very deep and rich. Dark fruits, but the malt is prominent, light hops, but noticeable in a good way. Good carbonation too. Very well done, this. It may not be the best beer Ive ever had, but its one of the better doppelbocks Ive had. Its good quality.

Somehow the first place I finally find this beer is in Italy. Brown to black pour, thin head. Aroma is full of caramel, licorice, sugars and some roasted malts. Flavor is quite sweet, spicy, sugary caramel and with a huge body. Solid brew, but not very eccentric.
UPDATED: NOV 28, 2014 Bottle. Smells of bready malt, nutmeg, bit of alcohol. Tastes of lightly spice/pepper, malt. Body is foamy with a bit of carbonation. Quite a flavourful sweet malty doppelbock.

330ml Bottle from Good Spirits Co, Glasgow (£4.20):
Sweet with plenty of malts coming through along with some dark fruits, cloves & spice. Warming & boozy without too much alcohol coming through. Prunes along with some raisins seem to be most noticeable from the middle onward & some biscuit malts feature too.

Mahogany with a foamy, beige head about a fingers width tall, settling as a fine lacing across the surface.

Very sweet with prunes, raisins & various dark fruit. Some clove & banana, with some bread make an appearance & some caramel features. The beer is rounded off with a touch of spice & a slightly boozy taste.

Medium & creamy with an incredibly smooth sip that goes down easy and is complimented with medium carbonation & a slightly warming feel.

A fine doppelbock, it was fairly sweet & boozy with a good combination of dark fruits & spice that went down a treat. This one was a pretty fine example of the style & one of the better doppelbocks Ive had.

This was one amazing brew, pours dark ruby red with an off white head. Smells of caramel and some biscuit and other malt notes. The taste is complex, loads of malt yet so many different flavors caramel, smoakyness, biscuit and everything

The best beer around that comes with a little plastic goat. Also better than most beers that *dont* come with a plastic goat. So really, you might as well go for the goat. Dark and sweet, a little smoky.

Pours very dark brown with thick tan head. A lot of carbonation. Nose is very dark and sweet. A bit of clove, licorice, prune and a lot of caramel malt. Mouth is very sweet. A definite smokey presence with a very subtle sourness. The roasted malts and coffee come through after a few seconds.

DATE REVIEWED: May 8, 2014... GLASSWARE: Celebrator stem pokal... OCCASION: NFL draft day--and the Browns select?... APPEARANCE: "dark" indeed; a cola body that sports a settling white head--not spectacular to look at, but the bottle sports the Celebrator goat talisman, so... AROMA: chocolate, prune, malt, some cola--grapefruit and even some bourbon--in a word, impactful!... PALATE: active cola feel with a subdued effervescence--strong, staunchly full-bodied, and pronounced in its aftertaste...TASTE: ditto on the aroma--stacked malt catapults this past the normal dough/biscuit flavors and into a field reserved for beers Id break my fast for--the aged alcohol pairs well with the chocolate...OVERALLL: In some ways, a goats butt to the taste buds--nothing subtle or soft about this doppelbock...a perfect nightcap or dessertif.

Roasted malts notes and yeast additions are very strong tasting, with hops far in the background. Coffee and chocolate pop off your tastebuds with every sip, and no acidic "twang" from smokey malt flavors. Light carbonation, not too "spritzy." Palate feel is fuzzy, and every flavor going on quickly all amounts to smoky sweet chocolate/bananas/coffee. Looks like a stout, pours like a stout, tastes like a finely crafted Dopplebock.
Pours a rich, dark brown with a short, tan head. Smokey and smooth. Sweet and malty. Good to the last drop
cereal, resin, leather, raisin, black, hazy, medium sweetness, very bitter, lightly sour, full body, sticky, average carbonation, bitter

330 ml bottle. Dark brownish red colour with a large and dense tan head. Aroma is sweet with notes of malt, coffee and licorice. Flavor is roasted malt with some fruity notes, alcohol and a bitter coffee finish with a hint of smoke in the background. Best doppelbock out there.

Living in Bavaria I have tried many excellent beers but this is by far the best. 

Celebrator is like a fine wine compared to normal beer- the flavour is light but satisfying, delicious and long lasting.
Ayinger is an unpretentious but outstanding brewerey-we are proud to have come to live here and consider it our local!
A caramel circus! Lots of malt, caramel, and prunes in the aroma. Not at all boozy. More dark fruit in the taste. Creamy, medium body. Great any time of year.
Very nice beer, dark treacle type flavour.........................................

aroma: toffee, coffee, caramel, malty
appearance: dark black colour, nearly no foam
taste: coffee, sweet, malty, no clear hop aroma, very drinkable for this kind of beer
Draft at crunchys. Deep garnet with a beige head. Molasses, brown sugar and prunes. Rich dark fruits and toffee at the end.

Reviewed from notes.
The appearance was a black/brown colored body with a slim half finger white foamy head that quickly dies and barely leaves any lacing.
The smell had a roasty rich maltiness, light chocolate, and a little bit of molasses, some toffee is noted as it warms a bit.
The taste was mainly sweet - malty sweet that is, malty aftertaste, dry finish.
On the palate, it sat about a medium, and was kinda sessionable. Carbonation is felt - kinda sharp (but honestly I dont do as many doppelbocks so Im unsure how close to the style as it should be).
Overall, I say this is dessert in a bottle. I picked the right time of the day to have this and the right time of the year to make the moment perfect. Im glad I tried it and I would have this again.

Bottle 0,33L. Clear, dark mahogany brown colour with smooth, light brown head, that leaves some good lacing. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, strong coffee, caramel and brown sugar. Taste is rich and complex. It starts light bitter with coffee, caramel and cocoa. Finish is still light bitter with long lasting aftertaste. Full bodied, oily texture, lively carbonation. Best German beer, no doubt...
33cl bottle. Pours dark brown almost black with a creamy, beige head. Heavy sweet, chocolate, light roasted malt aroma. Flavor is light bitter with chocolate, cocoa notes. Sticky flavor.

Not quite getting all the hype here! Pours very dark w/ a foamy tan head that leaves spotty lacing. The aroma is quite complex - roasty, fruity, & a hint of hops. The taste doesnt quite carry the complexity however. The mouthfeel is excellent. Its rich, creamy & medium bodied. The flavor just doesnt completely shine through for me. Theres a big roasty kick at the end but it starts off, dare i say, fairly boring.

Draft. Pours muddy brown with slight tan head. Aroma is slightly floral, a bit woody (cant put my finger on it), and a litlte hoppy. Taste is rich...I get strong caramel and chocolate notes, roasted malt (excellent!) and toffee. I sense a bit of a floral hop on the finish. I could drink this all day long.
Bottle. Pours dark ruby with a thick tan head. Nose is toffee and dark fruit. Taste is sweet and brown sugar. A great doppelbock.

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein dunkel rötlichbraunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch röstmalzig, süß, fruchtig, Karamell. Geschmack röstmalzig, stark fruchtig süß, Karamell, schokoladig, leicht alkoholisch.

Bottle. Pours clear dark brown with a beige head that leaves no lacing. Vague aroma of pine and malt. Lightly bitter taste that is also quite light in the finish. Light body, thin texture, fizzy carbonation and a brief finish. Balanced but thin.
On tap it at Unos Hamilton this is a defining Doppelbock. Clear pale amber with no head and just a hint of bitter on the malts.

Deep brown pour with a thin tan head made of tight forming bubbles. Aroma is dark malts, molasses, brown sugar, and chocolate. Incredibly rich flavor. Dark roasted malt flavors, wood, hints of bitter chocolate. Delicious, rich, and refreshing all at the same time. Sets the standard for Dopplebocks.

Bottle shared by Nicola. Pours a reddish cola color with tiny khaki head. Aroma is rich roasted grain, prunes, toffee, banana, spice, cherry cobbler, fruity Ethiopian coffee. Taste is plums, ripe cherry, soft milk chocolate, coffee. A beautiful blending of doppelbock flavors with slightly more stout-like roast.
Med ölföreningen julen 2013. Smak och doft av karamell, torkad frukt, svagdricka, malt, honung med chokladtoner.

Mahagony clear colour with fine red wine traces, lightly CO2 propelled with a lasting tan head. Aromas of roasted malts with light notes of leather, tobacco and dried fruits develop and a hint of metallic off-flavour, too. Full bodied yet pleasantly lively offering a slick texture of sweet roast aroma, light liquorice and tobacco notes. Lasting finish with a malt and alcoholic sweetness.

Bottle - Dark Reddish-Brown in colour. Very malty; roasty malts, coffee, caramel, toffee, smoked malts. Very Fruity; dark fruits, raisins, plums. Hoppy; moderate hops. Warming alcohol. Sweet malty fruity throughout; some dryness in the finish. Enjoyable. Nice beer!
UPDATED: DEC 14, 2014 Donkere roodbruine kleur met een volle crème kraag. Ruikt caramel, zoetig, mout, kruiden. Smaakt chocolade, kruiden, mout, beetje alcohol, fruit.

Birra che incanta il naso con aromi di cioccolato e caffè,tracce di frutta secca e noci. Sensazioni granulose di marzapane. Note tostate che accarezzano il palato. Una birra come poche...veramente un piacere sorsata dopo sorsata! Da provare assolutamente almeno una volta nella vita! Secondo me la miglior doppelbock al mondo!

330 ml bottle from beer-shop.it, served in a goblet glass . Dark amber, looks brown in the glass, with a nice light beige head. Intense and powerful aroma, with notes of cinnamon, liquorice, smoked meat, roasted malts, cocoa powder and american coffee. Nutty and caramel forward during the taste, rich and velvety without feeling overwhelming. Mild hoppy bitterness on the palate, quite roasty and chocolaty. Slightly warming and alchoolic finish. Soft carbonation, medium body and oily texture. Not a huge fan of doppelbocks, but this one is always great!

Pours a dark brown with ruby legs and a medium brown head. Aroma is bready malt, chocolate, and coffee. Flavor is more bready, roasted malt, coffee, caramel, milk chocolate, vanilla, toffee, nuts, and dark fruit. Full body with soft carbonation. Very good.
0.33 l bottle from Alko. Dark brown colour, nice generous head. Taste has some caramel, not too sweet though. Quite pleasant taste for a strong beer.

Bottle at d.b.a, NYC. Dark; dark brown maybe. Aroma is caramel malts - big similarity with a Belgian dubbel here; nice. Taste is same as aroma, just a little thin; Belgian vibe without being satisfying. Overall, nice beer if you like your malty caramel brews.

Black-brown body, modest beige head, some smooth lacings.
Aroma; lots of malts, prune compote, vanilla, dark dough, faint hint of leather, some fruity notes as surface of yellow apples. 
Taste; caramel malts, chocolate notes, hops under there, prune compote, fruity notes, some bitter hops give reminders now and then, and even a tiny touch from butterscotch in the transition to the aftertaste. To palate nice, well bodied, fine carbonation. 
Finishes on the sweet malty side, but there is still this soft bitterness along with it. Overall; this is really a nice confectionery!

Bottle - dark brown pour with decent head. Beer looks great. Nose and taste are very malty and fairly smoky.  Soft carbonation.  Im not sure this was a good bottle and would like to give it another shot

UPDATED: MAR 13, 2014 12 oz bottle poured into a shaker. While theres still a huge fluffy head, the aromas are mostly that of chocolate malt, vanilla, and, generally, chocolate chip cookie dough. As the head recedes, so does the chocolate and dough, but the vanilla sticks around with a fresh baked crusty bread. Some dark fruits, like figs, and grapes, start to come through along with licorice and caramel. It pours a dark, clear caramel color and is topped by a dense, effervescent micro-bubble head that has a very gelatin-like look to it. A decent head remains and it leaves an abundant small-bubbled lace down the glass. The medium leveled malty sweetness is balanced nicely by a light, subtle, toasty bitterness. The medium-full, rich body has a creamy, syrupy texture to it, aided by the light, fizzy, but abundant carbonation. The mouth feel starts with a malty, fig-y, cola flavor. As it warms, caramel, dark chocolate, and raisin start to come through. The final flavor reminded me quite a bit of a bridge mix - even a bit of a roasted nut flavor came through, but I couldnt tell if it was actually there and hence I made the bridge mix connection, or I made the bridge mix connection, then imposed a roasted nut flavor. The finish is roasted nut, dark chocolate, and toasted caramel. The dark chocolate and toasted bread, in particular, along with a mellow caramel note, linger in the aftertaste.
Very dark copper, small, dense beige head. Discrete malty aroma, prunes, Brown sugar, a hint of boozy alcohol. Sweetish, creamy taste. Something sour towards the finish. Soft carb, creamy mouthfeel.
UPDATED: AUG 20, 2015 On draft. Dark brown color with two finger beige head. Sweet taste, caramel, dark fruit. I really enjoyed this beer.
sweet start, but then very pleasant undertone of coffee and nuts. Has an very long taste. An excellent bockbeer.
Bottle from Wholefoods. Chocolate, coffee, vanilla. Quite sweet, and long lasting flavour.

Bottle. Dark ruby with a thick light tan head. Aroma is toffee, dark fruit and grain. Taste is caramel, raisin, banana and bready malt. Rich silky mouthfeel. Clearly one of the great examples of the style.

UPDATED: APR 24, 2014 Bottle. Dark brown large creamy tan head. Dark dried fruit, electrical fire, caramel, brown sugar, øllebrød. Medium body, oily texture, medium carbonation. Soft and filling mouthfeel with light alcohol presence. A bit thin from mid-taste to finish but a light dry finish with notes of cocoa and dried dark fruits saves it a bit.

330 ml bottle from Jungle Jims this time. Ive had this numerous times and hadnt rated. Nice bottle and the little goat is a nice touch. Pours a hazy reddish brown color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have roasted malts, nuts, smoked wood, mild fruit character, caramel, toast, with a hint of spice. Rich malty flavors. The nose is weaker than the flavor. This is certainly one of the best doppelbocks Ive had.

A wonderful beer. Pours very dark and clear with a light head that lingers. Aroma is very malty with a hint of plums or raisins. Very clean with a nice malt hops balance, with a very slight sweetness and malty finish. Medium bodied. Tastes very clean, very little alcohol noted in the background.

12 oz. bottle. Appearance: 2 finger khaki head, deep brown amber color, clear, Aroma: nuts, caramel, light chocolate, learhery and doughy yeast. P medium to full, light oily texture, average carbonation, slight bitter finish. Taste: malty sweetness thoughout, slightest bitter finish. Overall, solid, great for the style, very nice.
Great flavor and aroma. Great authentic bock from Germany! Worth the $4 per bottle.

Bottle.

A- Chocolate, dark fruits, coffee, toast.

A- Dark color, dark liquid, tan head.

T- Subtle chocolate, dark fruits, slightly sweet, slightly malty.

P- Medium body, thin texture, average carbonation, smooth finish.

O- Didnt seem to live up to expectations. The sweetness balanced out the richeness well but it just seemed to lack a little something. Still a great beer however.

Appearance: Cola-black, thin head, opaque. 4/5

Aroma: Not much aroma to speak of. Oats, malt, hay, caramel. 5/10

Taste: Sour at first bite with a pleasantly milk-chocolate sweetness, hops lending notes of citrus to an otherwise very sweet, malty, pleasantly-sour body. 8/10

Palate: Good body, astringent and sour, modestly carbonated. Long milky mouthfeel with a long, sour finish at the back. 4/5

Overall: 16/20. A very solid, tasty beer, that manages to marry a porter body to a hefeweizen citrus hop feel and taste.

Bottle from the Brouwcafe, Scheveningen. Poured a clear dark brown with a reddish hue and a thin light tan head. The aroma is ripe red berry fruit, yeast and malt. The flavour is medium bitter with a rich dark malt, fruit, light liqourice, light molasses palate. Medum bodied with average carbonation. So many flavours! An excellent beer. Fully deserves the rating.

Pours a dark reddish mahogany with a huge head of light tan foam. Nose is full of malt and a whiff of molasses. Very creamy with a nice mouthfeel. The taste is rich and full of dark roasted malt, a hint of molasses, some bread notes with no bitterness. An excellent doppelbock- pairs well with deli sandwiches, nuts or pretzels.
Dark color, some off white head and minimal lace. Medium body, the alcohol, malt and yeast come out strong in the flavor. Some dark fruits and a sweetness I cannot name.

Bottle. Pours deep cola, close to black. Aroma is dark fruit, raisin, and sweet. Taste is sweet and bitter at first, then theres faint smoke, finish is sweet caramel/toffee. The palate is pretty light in body but, slick and slippery in feel at first but builds up to very rich. Very good. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home. 
Sweet nose, cane sugar, nobel hops. 
Clear red brown color, creamy offwhite head. 
Medium to full body, small bubbles, creamy texture, sweet, anis, suttle bitternes. Nice bock!


:)
Bolton Brew.

Lively black hue, opaque with a foamy tan head, fair retention, no lace. The nose is complex, spicy alcohol was noticeable as was sweet chocolate, licorice, and roasted malt. Rather powerful. Warm on the tongue with lovely intricate flavors that matches the aroma... plenty of licorice and roasted malts, the alcohol is noticeable as well. It is a very smooth drink, low carbonation, full-bodied. A hearty delight!
Full bodied, thick bock. Fruity, sweet, and bit dry in the back. A bit too fruity for me, I found it tough to stomach.
Got heaps of dark chocolate, a hint of spices. The hops are toned down in order to present a nice balanced maltiness. Fresh and exciting. Try this!

Bottle. Dark, root beer like pour with nice tight head. Aroma of nuts, smoke, and dark malt. Creamy mouthfeel, some dusty earthy notes in the mid palate. Flavors of nuts, dark bread, and dark fruit. Somewhat dry finish.

330ml bottle from Only Cafe. Toronto, Ontario. Pours an opaque dark brown colour. It has a complex fruity aroma. Dried fruits, plum, and raisins are pronounced. The flavour matches up with the aroma but finishes hoppy. Medium carbonation and spotty lacing.
Complex flavor profile. Lots of malt, coffee, licorice, mixed nuts, tobacco and traces of chocolate. Strange aftertaste with hints of olives. Decent feel though a bit oily.

Appearance is clear, deep brown with ruby highlights. Holds a nice thick tan foam cap. Aroma is all malt. Caramel, licorice, cherries, and plums. Taste is caramel forward with less emphasis on the dark fruit and licorice. Distinct toasted character. Mouthfeel is medium with a slight creaminess and low carbonation. Finishes with a toasted malt flavor and leaves some lingering caramel flavor on the tongue. Hop character is minimal
From bottle, pours brown with off-white head. Lovely fruity banana and spice aroma. Taste is fruit, roasted malts, yeast. Delicious.
12oz bottle. Beautiful stuff. Rich and creamy. Great balance of nutty, roasted malt, woody yeast and fruity hops. Complex -- notes of cocoa, hazelnut, molasses, plum. Warming, with a long finish.
Nice malty aroma with sweet beet syrup, roasted malt, a bit coffee. The taste is also slightly roasty, with a relatively strong bitterness in the aftertaste.
Aroma nach Karamell und dezenten Röstaromen, die im Antrunk dann richtig zur Geltung kommen. Wenig Bittere, allerdings ausgewogen.
Dark amber. Decent head on European pour. Very hop filled smell. Roasted flavor. Pretty standard tasting bock.
UPDATED: APR 7, 2016 Dark brown, tan head. Smells of toasted malt and some dark fruits. Along with the toasted notes some taste of coffee. Very light bitterness.

0,5 L, på fad, 6,7 % ABV, nydt på Berlin Bar, 31. januar 2014.
Ibenholt-farvet tysk dobbelt-Bock med 1 cm moccafarvet skumtop. 
Duft af rosin, citrus. 
Smag af syrlig- og bitterhed. Dog en lidt vandet dobbelt-Bock, i.f.t. hvad der ellers kan fås hos vore tyske naboer. 
Smagen er dog udmærket og med procenten in mente, bliver man ikke slået omkuld. 
Et middel indhold af kulsyre. 
Har smagt denne dobbelt-Bock på flaske tidligere, og heller ikke dén gang var jeg over-begejstret - ikke min favorit dobbelt-Bock. Men flaskens design er outstanding! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Clear chocolate color with a creamy head. Bananas, raisins, plums, molasses, and brown sugar. Creamy palate with a smooth, sweet finish. Excellent!

33cl in a Trappist glass. Dar brown in colour with a slightly off white (plentiful) head. Mounthfeel is a little thin for what I expected and the taste less flavourful. The dominant flavour to me is milk chocolate with suggestions of coffee. This however, a fairly complex beer and feels much more than the 6.7% would suggest.

Caramell, fudge and dark fruit in the aroma 
Very dark clear red colourm beige head 
Creamy Caramell taste nicely roundeed of with the bitterness 
Medium to full body soft carbonation and creamy texture 
Very nice bock

Poured from bottle to glass. Deep red hue with off white head that dissipated fairly quickly. Aroma of yeast esters, banana, caramel, cloves, fresh bread, sugar. Mouthfeel is fantastic with a medium body and great carbonation. Taste is sweet throughout with a nice CO2 bite in the finish. Overall, this is an absolutely fantastic Dopplebock.
Pours dark brown with a thin tan head. Aroma is sweet caramel and slightly roasty. Flavor is moderately bitter with some dark fruits roasted malts and caramel. Medium bodied. Finishes dry. Nice beer.
A dark body and a light head. It has a strong fruity aroma with a hint of a smoky smell. A taste to match the smell, almost exactly. Very nice beer.

Des arômes de caramel, de fruits confits et de baies rouges dans cette bière rouge-brune assez foncée, et surmontée dune couronne de mousse couleur crème. En bouche, raisins, prunes, encore des fruits rouges, avec un petit côté boisé, le tout dans un bel équilibre. Une doppelbock de référence, alliant les fruits et les sucres à la perfection. Elle nest cependant pas aussi passionnante que sa sulfureuse réputation le suggère.
A few bottles over the years. Always full bodied and rich with malt and other good stuff. Plenty of smoke for the fans out there.
bottle, aroma is noble hops with some nice sweet malt and dark fruits. Taste is big rich sweet malts and a nice low hop dry finish, quaffable

26/XII/13 - 50cl bottle from Biernavigatie (webshop, NL) @ home, 2nd Christmas tasting - BB: IX/2014 (2013-1183) 
Clear dark brown beer, irregular creamy beige head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: caramel, lots of dried fruits, sugary, red liquorice, mocha, red fruits, grains, hints of hay and cow fodder. MF: soft carbon, medium to full body. Taste: dark chocolate, roasted malts, mocha, sweet malts, dried fruits, toast, some banana. Aftertaste: caramel, chocolate, dried fruits, mocha, coffee even, bit sweet, some overripe banana, little hoppy, bitter ending. Lovely beer! But whats the deal with the little plastic buck? :p
Yup, this would make me consider Monkhood. Hands down the best Double Bock I have ever tasted.

pours a dark brown with a beige head. the aroma is caramel, sweet malts, and licorice. the taste was similar but i picked up lots of alcohol. in my opinion, this beer is good and worth a try but didnt live up to the hype.

Tap at Ale House. Pours deep brown with a very clingy beige head. Aroma is faint... Caramel, cereal and smoke. Taste is dark roasted malts, licorice, some coffee bitterness. Great mouthfeel, goes down easy.

500 ml bottle @ home called "Ayinger Winter Bock". 
January 06, 2014
Beer bought @ "Systembolaget Strømstad"
Beer tasted and enjoyed from a wineglass.
Dark brown in color with a thin beige head.
Aroma is malt,chocolate,dark sugar and some yeast.
A sweet and malty beer with a light bitter finish.
Easy drinkable beer and hidden ABV.

Bière brune foncée, mousse beige. Nez prononcé de malts, caramel. En bouche, le malt est également très très présent, un peu de café. Bon ncorps, belle carbonation. Une bière très bien faite, ya pas à dire, mais je préfère le houblon au malt ...

Davvero una doppelbock coi fiocchi. Carattere deciso e discretamente ricco, tra note fruttate e maltate in buon equiibrio con il grado alcolico, sempre secondo i criteri di una bassa fermentazione ovviamente.
UPDATED: MAR 22, 2015 Hyvä saksalainen. V8.moottori vie eteenpäin. Bänditreeniolut ja illan kähmy. Kyllä jo.

Jestem ignorantem w dziedzinie doppelbocków, więc obcowanie z najlepszym na świecie nie było dla mnie niczym szczególnym. W aromacie wyraźne słodowe nuty, karmel, nuta alkoholowa. W smaku podobnie, piwo pełne, słodkie, karmelowe, choć nieźle ułożone, co korzystnie wpłynęło na pijalność. Smaczne.
Bottle. Dark brown with a big lightbrown head. Malty aroma with coffee, chocolate, caramel, licorice, yeast. Sweet malty taste. Medium body, lots of carbonation. Sweet and roasted finish.
Mørk brun farge. Masse kremet skum ved påfyll, men skummet blir raskt borte og ligger med en tynn hinne. Beige skum. Aroma av sødme, karamell. En anelse bitter i ettersmak. Liker denne godt.

Black, almost no head at all. Roasty, creamy, liquorice, plums. Medium sweetness, light bitterness, even some sourness. Very full palate. Rather complex yet pleasantly soft. Very balanced and enjoyable, classic beer indeed.

Clear dark brown with ruby....
Brown minimal head
Caramelized apples, licorice, roasted malts, ginger
Sweet, slight bitter ending
Seems to drink pure licorice with sweet fruitiness, winter caramel apple, cloves
A really enjoyable warm tastefull beer

Delicious double bock in every way! This big, chewy giant is a wonderful drinking experience. Caramel and dark (bitter) chocolate combine for a great taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a very dark ruby red with very little head. Aroma is dark caramel malts and dark prune fruit notes. Flavor again is more dark fruits with very little hop character. It is both light and full-bodied without an overpowering alcohol content. Also some smoked nutty flavor in the aftertaste that makes this a very complex and enjoyable beer.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2014  a) Celebrator  Überm Glas verbreitet sich ein schöner dickflüssig-süßer Schokoladen-Trockenobstgeruch. 
Der Antrunk ist im ersten Moment etwas neutral, dann breitet sich ziemlich schnell eine süßlich-dickflüssige dunkle Malz-Trockenpflaumennote. Das Bier ist sehr mild, auch im Hauptteil, wo eine doch deutlich zu spürende alkoholische Note auftritt. Der Nachgeschmack ist Toffe-karamell, ganz leicht herb, Trockenpflaumen, dabei etwas zu penetrant süßlich-dickflüssig-herb. Auf der Zunge bleibt diese schwere dunkle Note - Karamell, Toffee, leichte Röstmalztöne, etwas Kaffee. 
--> Leckeres Bier, allerdings für mich einen Tick zu dickflüssig-süß.


Test vom 18.11.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche	Noten: 12,12,12,13,12,12 - 12,15
   b) Winter Bock   
Toller beiger cremiger Schaum. Geruch nach vergorenen dunklen Früchten. Der Antrunk ist schön mild-weich. Zum Hauptteil malzig-mild, der Alkohol ist nicht zu schmecken. Röstmalzig-herb im Nachgeschmack werdend, angenehm mild-weich. Sehr trocken, wie ein schöner Trappist. Toll malzig-dunkelfruchtig. Diese herb-malzige, dunkelfruchtig-weicheNote bleibt lang auf der Zunge erhalten. Sehr aromareich und tief. Sehr toll!  14/12/13/14

Bottle. Pours clear dark chestnut with a minimal beige head. Aroma is chocolate, nuts, caramel,ripe pear, toasted malt and prune. Taste is light+ sweet and bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. Finishes balanced and fairly short with some bitterness and light burnt malt. Nice.

Dark coffee brown color, medium brown head with fine bubbles. Rich malty nose. The taste is impressingly malty, with notes of roasted bread crust, liquorice and dark coffee. Developing a subtle bitterness, leading to a long dry and full finish. The bavarian answer to an Imperial Stout.

Dark brown head. Sweet aroma, syrup, roasted malt. Immediate taste of black olives, figs, raisins, soy sauce. A pleasantly sweet start, then fades to a roasted coffee malt and light bitterness. Light bodied, medium finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy

33cl bottled at home. Pours dark brown with a brown head. Aroma is liquorice, caramel, dark fruits, coffee and plums. Thick texture. Taste is moderate sweet. Some bitterness. Full bodied with soft carbonation. Great!

Reviewed 06/20/10
Poured from bottle to New Belgium tulip.

A: Immediate bubbling upon cracking bottle. Deep cherry brown. Excellent clarity despite yeast cake confluence.

S: lightly toasted walnuts. warm malts. cocoa.

T: Roasted, malty, nutty. Great beer! Excellent example of doppelbock, maybe one of the best at the price point. 

M: fine, creamy carbonation accentuates this med-full bodied beer. rolls over palate and down throat with ease.

D: very drinkable beer. Great dessert. If you havent, you should try.

Serving type: bottle

12-20-2010

Bottle. Black beer with a strong slightly off white head. The aroma is mildly malty and mildly roasted. The flavour is gently bitter with yeastiness and a considerable amount of bitterness. Overall a nice strongly roasted dunkel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Makean tiheän simainen tuoksu, maku yllätti positiivisesti. Himpun vetinen jälkimaku mutta kokonaisuus sangen onnistunut.
Nesten svart i fargen med brunt kremaktig skum. Lukter søtt av karamell, frukt og malt (og alkohol). Lite kullsyre, medium bitter - lang og god ettersmak.

An excellent representative of the doppelbock style. Definitely an exceptional beer fit for celebratory occasions. Appearance is very dark brown/ruby color with a generous head that looks good but doesn't last. Aroma is complex, roasty with dark fruit notes. Enjoyable almost creamy texture, medium bodied. Flavorful, prunes, raisins, some cherry, maybe some musty flavor from its aging but it actually is a pleasant complement. Far above average, although something in the finish that leaves a sour aftertaste. I'm glad I tried this, but I'm still partial to Paulaner Salvator as my go-to doppelbock. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy

Aroma: dark fruits, sweet malts, alcohol. Appearance: dark borwn, medium amber head. Taste: sweet. Palate: some bitterness, elements of smoke. Overall: great Doppelbock. Bottle at the Octoberfest Pub, London.
Aroma of sweetness and malt. Pours dark/reddish brown with a beige creamy head. Sweet taste of malt and caramel. Medium thick body.

Quite bland taste. Way to much flavor of alcohol when first entering the mouth. Some licorice in the flavor, but not much. Beautiful color though. As soon as the foam goes down, it disappears directly.

Smells a little sweet with notes of roasted malt. The flavor of dark malt but not at all becoming strong. Which is a plus in my opinion. The aftertaste puts himself back in mouth and bubbling around very nicely for a while. Tasty and easy to drink Bock. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Pours a bubbly clear dark brown, red when put to light. Smells sweet and like other bocks grassy and earthy to me. Smell caramel roasted malt flavor, with faintly smoky dryness finish to steal the description. Despite being bubbly, has smooth creamy mouth feel. Real easy drinking not very bad but the more I drink of a bock the more I feel like Im eating grass. Can certainly understand why this one of the best in the style.

Nice aroma of malt, banana, nutty, some slight dark fruit, and some yeasty (Belgian like) aroma. Very nice and complex aroma. Taste is complex as well but I get some smokey roasted malt flavors more so than I would have thought based on the aroma. Overall nice balance. Slightly sweet, but not sugary sweet. Nice flavors that follow the aroma other than the roasted malt. Dry finish. Very tasty, but couldn't drink it all the time. Need to be in the mood for it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Shared a 33cl bottle from Maruhn (Darmstadt). Pours a very dark brown colours with a small thick tan head. Aroma is malty, caramel and light bread. Average carbonation and medium to full body. Taste is a shot of bitterness with some caramel notes and a very dry finish. Overall, a very good beer that is more light than I thought when I served it.
Bottle 50 cl from Systembolaget. Dark with hints of red, beige nice head. Fudge, dark red fruit, slight vanilla?, candied sugar. Creamy fudge, . Medium/full body, low carbonation, sweetish finish.

Bottle @ home. Dark brown clear color, beige foamy head with little lacing. Sweet lightly roasted aroma of dark bread, milk chocolate, some figs. Medium to full, really smooth body.
Nicely balanced sweet caramel taste with bread, some lemon, lightly roasted notes, chocolate and red fruits. Nice quite dry finish of citrus, milk chocolate and some wood plus smoked charcuteries in the background. Very enjoyable, quite complex with awesome balance.

The aroma is weak but the little that can be felt is nice. The "bock" is a bit like the stout but I think its more smoky and less creamy. Solid but not so exciting. Nicely priced for proper beer. Around 4,5$ for 50cl in Sweden.

Solid but a bit lame aroma with malty flavors of mild salty licorice and licorice, bread and some soy. Reddish brown color with clear liquid. Light brown, semi-thick head. Taste has malts, licorice, smooth caramel and some salty licorice. Wide taste spectrum. Semi-long aftertaste has malts and a hint of alcohol. Medium palate with average carbonation.

Bottle from zupans off burnside
Pour is thick and but not opaque, a great brown fall color to the beer.
First taste is surprisingly sweet, with balanced fig/cherry finish. I get lots of dark fruit and a tobacco dry chewiness throughout. Surprisingly alcoholic taste and smell for its BAC. Wonderful beer, lots of different flavors throughout, perfect to enjoy on a evening with a book or alone in thought.

Dark brown with a light brown, thick head. Aroma of malt and milk chocolate. Malt, dark dried fruit and molasses flavor with some soft roasted grain in a long moderately sweet finish. Noticeable alcohol even at the moderate 6.7 abv. Well constructed and balanced.

Bottled, 0.33l. Courtesy of CanCrusher, thanks a lot! Pours cloudy dark brown with large frothy light brown head, poor lacing and lively carbonation. Aroma of caramel, biscuit, dandelion and dry fruits. Tastes of light sweet toasted malt with smooth and rich caramel and toffee following. Mouthfeel is pretty spicy, while finish is moderate grassy bitter. Full body, oily texture and soft carbonation in palate. Doppelbock, double pleasure...

330 mL bottle. The pour is a dark dark ruby, almost solid brown, with a little transparency and a nice thick foamy khaki head. The head fades quickly and leaves a ring around the edge. The aroma is pretty complex. An immediate light roast and caramel dominates with a soft dark fruit through the finish. The flavor is very similar. There is a nice bitterness on the finish that is very enjoyable in a good dopplebock 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma of fruits, berries, charcuteries, and mineral, with hints of chocolates. Taste of chocolate, citrus, some metal, and hints of isterband. Categorized as a doppelbock, but I consider the 6,7% alcohol quite low and prefer the label "winter bock", as stated by the brewery.

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2014 Bottle/ Pour a dark black/velvety. It is full bodied, sweet and bold. it is very fruity and maybe some molasses, figs, and small amount of burnt caramel(good burnt). The balance is good because maltyness exists too! The alcohol is masked well and there is just the right amount of hops.

Bottle shared. Pours dark brown with light brown head. Have drank this before but never rated. The aroma is deep sweet malty and hints of caramel. Hints of roasted malts as well. The flavor is immaculate lots of sweet malts blended with some roastiness and caramel. A smooth yet slick mouth feel. No bitterness at all.
Ayinger winter bock. Mørk brun, nesten sort med tynt lys brunt skum. Karamell, lakris pepperlukt. Medium bitter, noe salt. Medium kullsyre, salt ettersmak

Bottle. Sweet and fruity nose, licorice, coffee, syrup of dark fruits, caramel. roasted malts, raisin, cloves, cinnamon; dark red brown nearly black color, creamy tan head, reduces slowly, good lacing; taste medium sweet, medium bitter, roasted malts, caramel; medium to full body, creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation; dry roasted bittersweet finish, bit spicy and hints of alcohol. Well-balanced.

How: Bottle.
Where: NK Bar, Stockholm.
Appearance: Dark brown colour with a beige head.
Aroma: Sweet, caramel, malt.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Malt, chocolate, fruit, some caramel.

As Ayinger Winter Bock (2012). Pours very dark brown with a small mocha head. Aroma is caramel. roasted malts, honey, nutmeg, cloves, rye bread. Taste is roasted malts, caramel. honey, spices, rye bread, hazelnuts. Mouthfeel is very creamy and full-bodied. Stored for a year and has markedly improved with age. Really good!
UPDATED: SEP 19, 2015 Bottle from SB. ( Winter Bock ) Brown with a small tan head. Malty with caramel tones. Malt, caramel, fruit and spices. Medium body with a bitter sweet finish.
I drank this draw at Kegstand watching ISU go in to OT. Yay! Very smooth. Heavy. Its good.

500ml bottle, pours clear nearly black dark mahogany with a large slowly reducing beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel and raisins. Taste of roasted malts, caramel, raisins and plums. Light sweetness and medium bitterness. Medium body, creamy texture and moderate carbonation. A great well balanced Doppelbock, though would have liked the body somewhat fuller.

11.2 oz bottle into pilsner. Clear but nearly opaque dark brown with ruby highlights, minimal head, streaky spotty legs. Aroma is brown bread, molasses, caramel, hints of alcohol and herbal hop. Taste is super malty, with molasses, bread, and caramel. Theres a little hop bite and booziness on the finish. Full bodied, thick and creamy, low carbonation, lots of residual sugar, so not dry in the slightest.

Tap at New Bohemia. A deep, dark hue meets the eye complemented by an aromatic sweetness. Lacing clings well to the glass. A solid representation if a doppelbock and one you should seek out where available. Slight sour notes but balanced well overall. Definitely with celebratoring.
Tap. Fluted glass. Dark fruit aroma, prune, fig, etc. Slightly sour, but has other dopplebock features. Dark fruit throughout, quite good.

12 oz bottle at Mamma Zus what a great beer. The Double Bock poured a deep black with creamy tan head. There was a spicy caramel malt aroma. The flavors were of raisins, subtle chocolate and roasted malt. A very balance beverage with average carbonation and medium body. Smooth finish that has you coming back for more.

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2015 Una grande birra, pensare che in definitiva solo quattro ingredienti possano dare tanto gusto è veramente una sorpresa. Birra che scende giù che è un piacere, con lodore di cereale e di caramello che prendono il naso ed un sapore mica da poco, a farti sbilanciare e far pensare che questa, sia veramente una birra da provare.

Celebrator is one of the best all around beers in the world! This dopplebock is very dark and although its 6.7% is not overpowered at all. I love the smooth malty taste with a pleasant back end. I am a big fan of double bocks and this ranks near the top of that category for me. I would reccomend this beer to anyone as it is drinkable and easy to taste the balance of the caramel/toasty malts! Great job Ayinger!

Black with some red that shines through. Off-white/beige head.
Caramel, complex roasted barley with some smoke and ash,

50 cl Bottle as Ayinger Winter Bock from Alko. Clear darkish red brown colored with smallish white head. Malty aroma of caramel and rye bread with notes of plum and fig. Same aromas pull through in flavors and make this great brew for my taste..
bread aromas, appear dark brown with a fine head. medium bitter taste, creamy texture with a soft carbonation. a slight bitter finish

from tap. poured a dark brown colour (with a red glow) and a creamy off white head. a lot of coffee, chocolate, bread malts, caramel, toffee, red forrest fruits. nice carbonation this has the bo the beste balanced doppelbock! perfection

Color: really deep brown beer with small carbonation and small brown head. Smell: caramel and malt complexity, rye bread and sugar cane. Taste: explosion of malt on mouth, really drinkable, small alcohol taste but not so noticeable. Aftertaste: brown bread with malt complexity and caramel. Amazing beer! Perfect for Falls period !
A fantastic beer. Definitely the best Ive had of the style. It has a roasty chocolate taste to it and has some dark fruit notes.

Bottle. Dark brown, beige head. Nose of strong malt, caramel, chocolate. Flavour has molasses, malt, chocolate, coffee.. some dark fruit in the background, not as much as others in the style Ive had, even as it warmed. Didnt blow me away, but still really good.
Dark brown, some remaining laces. Chocolate and stock aroma. Chocolate also obvious in the taste. Raisins. Well balanced bitterness.

UPDATED: APR 30, 2016 Aroma is rather faint toasted bread and sweet caramel. Somewhat light bodied but big on character. Dry and only semi sweet. No smoke or booze just very malty and sweet like a good doppelbock. Hard to think of another example thats better than this one. Its quite simple but excuisite none the less. Great beer!
UPDATED: FEB 2, 2014 just perfect the kind of beer you are never tired of, caramel, bread, roasty a bit, resin, citrus
12 oz bottle. Brown muddy pour, aroma of plumbs, brown sugar and spices. Taste is big and malty, lots of sweetness, some nice spice, some raisins, very well balanced. Excellent!

UPDATED: APR 19, 2014 On tap at Vancouver Craft Beer Market. Served in a signature stemmed glass. A very dark bronze with a tan head. Wow! This is THE German doppelbock. Loads of caramel and fruit here. More later, I promise.
And again at Vancouver Craft Beer Market. Still a great dopplebock. Marvellously mellow and sweet. In general I think I prefer it to stout, though slightly, as a winter beer. Simply wonderful!
Update Apr 19, 2014: First time from the bottle, purchased at Firefly in Vancouver. Still a great dark beer. Wonderful sweet malts, with a bit of fruit in there somewhere.

Van de tap bij Jagersrust in Velden,mooi geserveerd in een origineel glas. Hele donkere kleur en een dichte, volle, plakkerige kraag. Ruikt moutig en naar stroop. Smaak is van stroop, donkere mout. Bitterzoet.

Lakrits, chocklad men lite spritig i smaken, får ligga ett par månader till.......................................

- via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice light brown head with a dark copperbrown body. 
Very malty with intense sweetness and breadiness. Not to hoppi. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl bottle

Appearance: Dark mahony coloured beer with a decent beige head.
Aroma:::very malty, licorice, dark fruits and a hint of roast. , some yeast in the background
Taste starts sweet with caramel, some yeast, it finishes more with dark fruit and roasted malts forma dryish palate.
Medium thick body, oily texture,nice medium carbonation.

Great clear, dark, rich mahogany colour that supports a frothy mocha head. Huge aroma of black licorice, dark fruits and a hint of roast. Great velvety texture that gives off a flavour of dark stone fruits, dark caramel and a touch of smokiness. Fantastic.

330ml bottle. pours a very dark brown. no head and is quite syrupy in consistency - sticks to the side of the glass. aroma is of molasses, malts, caramel, toffee, a little alcohol and perhaps some coffee. taste is good. super smooth, good amount of alcohol but sadly i dont like licorice.
Very dark colour with little to no head. Extremely malty flavour with some coffee and licorice. It was a bit too plain for me and there are better doppelbocks out there.

Bottle 330 ml at home, poured into a snifter. ABV 6.7%
Very deep dark brown colour which can easily pass as black, with two fingers of thcik and creamy beige head. Good retention for the most part, after a while is collapsing all at once and fast, leaving light lacing around the glass.
Aroma of malts, light dark fruits, caramel, light alcohol although the ABV is relatively low.
Taste begins sweet with caramel, light yeast, dark fruits more notable on the finish and on the aftertaste, where a good lasting bitterness appears, along with roasted malts. Very nice.
Medium thick body, good carbonation, notable without being annoying, very dry on the palate.
Overall really great bock, and nice presentation too (label - little white goat).

UPDATED: NOV 3, 2013 0.33 bottle. Black in color with a small, brownish head. Strong malty aroma, some dark fruits, caramel, liquorice and a touch of yeasts. Strong, bittersweet taste of dark malts, caramel, alcohol, wood, dried dark fruits, liquorice and hints of smoke. Medium body, oily texture and soft carbonation. Finish is rather dry, a bit smoky but soft and delicate. Overall the beer is splendid, worthy of all the praise it gets.
Starts off great but smoky hints become too obvious the more you have. Cool bottle. Gotta love goats
Dark brown color with a beige head. Smell of yeast and malt. Taste of roasted malt with a delicious lasting aftertaste. Very delicious bockbier.

Bottle thnx to Bytemesis, cheers man. Pours a very dark brown beer with a small beige head on top that leaves quickly. Aroma is malty, red fruits, caramel and some dusty yeasty esters. Flavour is mildly sweet and sugary, caramel and malts are very present in the flavor. Medium sweet, medium long aftertaste. Oily texture, low carbo, quite ok for sure!
Bottle 0,33ltr: Dark brown coloured brew with nice bitter taste and hints of roasted malts, chocolate, vanilla and some faintly smokey aroma. Delicious beer indeed to celebrate.
Brown beer. Has a sweet, caramel flavor and goes down smooth. Very enjoyable.

Draught at Lobbes. Clear dark amber with a full slightly off-white head. Full body with moderate carbonation. Sweet and malty with a slightly bitter finish. Caramel, coffee, dark fruits and some chocolate. A great full flavoured doppelbock!

*11.2 oz. bottle* Look: Very dark ruby red body, off-white lacey ring around my glass. Smell: Strong notes of toffee, dark red fruits, licorice, well rounded vanilla, faint hint of cocoa. Taste: Toffee, slight cherry, licorice, bitter cocoa, subtle hints of spice, toasted nuts, vanilla, well balanced dryness that finishes slight bitter. Feel: Medium-light body, poppy carbonation. Overall: Very tasty and to the point. I can see why this is called Celebrator. At nearly 7%abv, there is a lot going on. The flavors are pronounced yet are seem individual other than just being a mess in a glass. The dryness leaves you wanting more. This is recommended.

Pours nearly black, with decent head dissipating quickly. Aromas of yeast, malt and fruit. Taste is malt and fruit, light hops, finish is coffee, hops. Finely and lightly carbonated, viscosity a bit thin. As I recently prefer imperial stouts and porters, this left me wanting more, but this is very good beer.

Packaging and Serving - Poured from a 33cl bottle into a TeKu glass @ home 
Aroma - Intensity: light. Persistence: short. Smells: caramel and roasted malts.
Appearance - Color: deep ruby brown. Clarity: clear. Head color: tun. Head type: rocky. Foam persistence: very long. 
Taste - Intensity: medium to high. Persistence: medium. Flavors: The beginning is sweet than is slightly astringent due to roasted malt. The final unfortunatelly is quite metallic. Aftertaste: caramel, roasted malt. 
Mouthfeel - Carbonation: medium. Body: medium. Astringency: a little. Warming: medium. Metallic:.unfortunately, yes 
Overall impressions - Balance: balanced. Aroma-flavor harmony: harmonic. This metallic taste is very disturbing. Hopefully, Ill try another one and hope its better. 
Food - -

Preta com espuma café com leite de boa formação e persistência. Aroma torrado, frutas vermelhas e passas. Caramelo também. No sabor, o tostado se sobressai, seguido das passas e no fundo café. Licor. Médio dulçor, bem balanceado com o amargor. Amargor persistente ao final. Excelente. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @ Corso Degustatori ADB 2013. Pazzesco il profumo per essere di una bassa fermentazione. intenso e abbastanza persistente di caramello, frutta rossa sotto spirito, frutta secca (nocciole) , alcool. Colore ramato scuro, con rifelssi rubino. Schiuma begie abbastanza fine, di consistenza cremosa. Al gusto è più totsta e amarogna di quanto appaia, vellutata in bocca, di corpo debole anche se ricca di gusto. Il finale è liscio, nessuna atringenza, per nulla appiccicoso.

Celebrator is a full bodied, dark, rich, beer. Although it has a higher alcohol content. It is not noticeable. The roasted malt and hop balance give it slightly dry finish.

Subtle complex tasteful beer. 
Lots of things to taste, dried black fruits, brown sugar, caramel, hints of smoke, roasted malts and coffee, orange zest, cola.
Light acidic flavor that shifts to sweet and light bitter, finish is bitter like coffee. 
Full creamy texture with soft carbonation.
Very good!

Aroma: Caramel, roast, honey, xried red fruits Appearance: Dark brown, red glow, off white head, full lace Taste: Caramel, roasted malt, hint of coffee, nice balanced, but mild

Bottle-Aroma of bread, fruit, caramel. Pours black with red edges a good sized mocha head and good lacing. Chocolate, burnt sugar, fruit, caramel good mouthfeel. Love this stuff.
(bottle) clear honey amber colour with a medium tall brown head; aromas of stewed fruit, caramel, honey; slightly creamy palate; rich and balanced flavour; quite nice

Very dark, I guess the same ebcs of a stout. Wonderful shiny foam. 
It tastes like Christmas, thats the first thing I thought. Vanilla, banana, toffee
strong yeasty aroma. Velvety and creamy and with a toasted taste of coffee, nut and candied fruit. Satisfying and persistent aftertaste of coffee.

Bottle. Pours a deep caramelly brown, medium whitish head okay retention and lacing. Nose is toffee, dried fruit (dates & raisins), malt and toasted rye bread. Mouth is medium bodied with a semi-sweetness, full of malty toffee notes, figs, dates,pipe tobacco, brown sugar, pumpernickel and some vanilla at the finish. Kinda watery at the end though. Still, a very good dopplebock.
Dark brown color, and a thin head. Malty sweetness, but with a nutty finish that doesnt linger
33 cl bottle 6.7%. Dark ruby black with little head. Aroma with syrup and dark fruits. Taste is smooth with liquorice and chocolate notes , very balanced.
Malty aroma and flavor: Dark sugar/caramel sweet, dark fruit (dried cherry?). Moderate bitterness. Maybe a little herbal/spicy hops.

Bottle. Cola like pour with a thick creamy mocha head. Berry, licorice, chocolate, vanilla, American oak.
Medium body with nice balance of carbonation, bitterness and acidity. 
Slightly sweet, creamy and bitter finish

Bottle. Pours a clear deep amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity spicy caramel and dark fruit aroma. Fruity malty spicy caramel dark fruit flavor. Has a fruity malty caramel dark fruit finish.

UPDATED: SEP 22, 2013 Belle couleur sombre! tres bon parfum de fruits noirs et caramel. Un super arome malt, chocolat, café. Il manque juste un peu de carbonation. Longue fin de bouche, amertume moderee. 1ere doppelbock, superbe!!!

Appearance: Dark brown colour and persistent off-white head. - Aroma: Medium maltiness and light roasted. - Flavour: Complex maltiness and light toasted/coffee flavours. - Overall: full body, medium carbonation, balanced sweetness and alcohol.

This is one of the best fucking beers ever to meet my lips. I remember buying it at the dumpy local liquor store on Broadway in Denver, CO. No idea why they stocked it, but when they stopped, I had them order more. Any night with a Celebrator is a good night.

Its been a while since I had one, but its full-bodied with a complex palate and a deep, rich, malty flavor. Its strong and beautiful, my friends. Drink sparingly.

Pours a mahogany color. Dark and deep but lets just a little light come through gently. Its got terrific garnet hues to illuminate the beer. On top sit s thick creamy tan head of foam that s cloud like and loathe to fall. It finally does but leaves wet lace dripping down the glass with each sip. 

Nose is intense. First the most authentic scent of blackstrap molasses. With that earthy little sour to it like if you had put your nose int he jar of it. Dark fruits and fresh plum. Behind that a treasure of dark dried fruits like raisin and prune. bit of caramel and a dark and breaddy malt that is toasted perfectly. Toasted bread and you can almost smell the crusts. Theres a whiff of alcohol but it is not unwelcome and a light spice. Smells like a pastry made with lots of dark fruits and nuts. 

Taste is fat chewy and velvety malt. Toasty and breaddy. Glides over the tongue with all that fruit and the creamy molasses. Theres a touch of hops on this and they are bitter but not too much. Endless and smooth. creamy with dark sugars and toasted grains. Theres a touch herbal in the drink and the body is round, full and fat. Finishes with a delightfully authentic aftertaste of molasses. 

This beer is perfection in every way. its rich and delicious. Smooth and forthcoming. It drinks sticky and has a complex palate that has just the right amount of sour and bitter to offset its deep sweetness. The alcohol is warming int he drink and its easy to see why this one is the best in the world.
Draft at HopCat EL. Black pour with tan head. Aroma is fruit, chocolate, roasted malt, mild smoke. Nice body and mouthfeel. Very good.
33cL bottle. Agree with the description wholeheartedly. I still prefer Paulaner Salvator, but this is a close second to the best traditional doppelbock commercially available.
December 2009. Probably the best doppelbock available. Malty, fruity, a little sweet yet with hops and alcohol showing through. Perfect balance.
This is half a liter of Bayern awesomeness. Very tasty doppelbock. And I know it doesnt influence the taste much, but the bottle looks really cool.

33 cl. bottle, love the label. One goat = good. Two goats = twice as good!Dark brown colour with a big, creamy, light tan head. Golden hues. Sweet aroma with caramel malts, overripe fruits, light roast and smoke, brown sugar and a vinous note. Taste is sweet. Excellent palate for a bock and it´s "only" a 6,7 % abv.: Full body with a creamy texture and a soft carbonation. Long lasting dry finish with caramel malts, overripe fruits and a hint of roast and licorice. Excellent bock.

This single 330ml (11.2 ounce) bottle came with a little white Ram ornament that says "Celebrator" on the bottom. Very cool! This 'Doppelbock' style beer pours a very dark brown, almost black with a khaki creamy head that doesn't last long. Not much lacing around the glass for this one. Aroma is very pleasing with hints of molasses, raisins, caramel and butterscotch. The taste is the same with a hint of chocolate as well. One of the best that I had in a while for this type!

Nice creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly rich and sweet, caramel malts, toffee, nuts, burnt caramel, almond cake, chocolate, grass. Taste is mild and balanced, caramel malts, nuts, grass, toffee, chocolate, grass, raisins, burnt caramel. Medium bitterness. Very nice, but even though its very mild and balanced, its also has kind of a thin body.

Smell is a great malt, some biscuit. Brown. Smooth finish. The alcohol is definitely there, but not in a burning sort if way.

Bottle to celebrate my 1st anniversary of joining RB. Pours cloudy dark copper brown with airy but stable tan head. Dark aroma of malt, caramel and dried fruit with a note of nuts. Sweet flavour of malt, caramel and fruit. Delicious roasty notes. Nice sweetish aftertaste. A perfect Doppelbock!

Clear dark brown with a solid quarter inch of tan head that slowly shrinks and has good legs. Aroma is rich maltiness, toast, melanoidins, caramel, chocolate notes, and some light fruitiness(plums, grapes). Flavours of toast, rich maltiness, melanoidins, caramel, mild bitterness, light alcohol , mild fruitiness (plums and grapes), light chocolate notes, and a bit of a dry finish. Great beer, awesome example of the style and a lot of qualities I really enjoy... Well done!
bottle 33 cl @ home. Pours dark brown with a small beige head. Nutty, malty aroma. Sweet, malty, bit mämmi-like taste.nice

33cl bottle from cervezalandia. Nice dark brown color with thin brownish head. Body is quite smooth and carbonation is medium but easy. Taste is low to medium sweet and bitter. Interesting dryness. Aroma is malt, caramel, coffee and smoke. Good!

Bottle from Cotteridge wines. Very dark brown beer with small mocha head and a touch of lacing. Aroma of sweet malts. Taste is molasses, sweet malts, figs, dark fruits and some roasted malts. Full bodied and a little sticky. Great stuff.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Very good beer. Full taste, but not super heavy. Malty and full bodies taste, yet not overly filling.

Bottle shared with Pat in Feb, 2010. Poured plum brown with 2 finger off white head. Aromas and taste of figs, dark fruit, smooth malt, cocoa and wood. Very creamy, fuller body with a rich finish. Maybe the best doppel I have had to date.

Ayinger nailed this dopplebock perfectly! Pours a dark brown with decent head. A lot of stuff going on here. Roasted malts, with a hint of sweetness to it. A heavy brew, and after finishing my first 4-pack I was feeling pretty toasty, almost like the beer itself. Nicely done.

11.2oz bottle poured into glass:
Aroma is bread/toast malt forward with notes of caramel and dark fruit. No burnt or roasted aroma. 
Head retention is very good. Light brown/tan head with mixed sized bubbles. Beautiful deep red hues shine through with brilliant clarity. Without light dark brown. 
Sweetness prevalent from lack of bitterness spot on. Carbonation tingles the tongue. Strong toast followed by bread, caramel, and lingering specialty malt sweetness.
Bottle->tumbler at RFD. Dark amber with small offwhite head. A: roasted malt, molasses, smoke, caramel, nuts. T: same, in a great balance. Excellent.

16 oz pour at Beer Revolution. Rich blackbrown pour with a creamy tan head that bubbles away quickly. Aroma is roast malts, hint of chocolate and weak coffee, mild nuttiness (almond). Mild carbonation, medium-heavy alcohol warmth, little yeasty whiff as well. Palate is more malt character, nutty, chocolatey, quite bitter. Decent hoppiness - cool smokiness (almost peaty) on the finish. Good finish to a beer sesh at Beerrev.
Una dell mie birre preferite!! Malta e cremosa, ottimamente carbonata, lascia in bocca un mare di sapori e aromi!! Non se ne può fare a meno!!
Hazy deep amber coloured, thick light tanned foam. Aroma sweet malts, toffee and caramel. Taste is toasted and somewhat bready. Still sweet with caramel and malty.
Very good doppelbock, whole foods venice, nice dark pour, easy to drink, awesome.

bottled(drank from a jug)Its good to see this in the UK . With a lot of hype about this being the king of dopplebocks, i guess i was intrigued somewhat . Its aroma is fulla  dark textures ..like smoky yeast. raisin covered over toffeed malt ..shitloads of soy sauce like vibes .dark chocolate too. It presents in a glass like something i wanna drink lots of large beige head -attractive burnt brown- i look at this beer and feel like drinking .  sticky ,almost cumbersome malt character -which lead your tounge toward treacly flavours. burnt brown sugar.raisiny bitter chocolate ...an damn abundance of toffee ,i mean really there - leading toward earthy hops ,faint dryness ..: So its deffo good beer ,yeah. lots of soulful deep dark malt qualities here !!!

Bottle from Coppers, Newcastle. An extremely dark brown-black beer that pours with a quickly disappearing white head. It has rich malt, chocolate and roasted flavours, with currants, vanilla oak and slight smoke on the fruity, creamy finish. Excellent!

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2013 Finally got to taste one these. Was not all that impressed. It was malty, nutty, carmel, smooth deliciousness...but it just had something lacking that Spaten Optimator doesnt.
 Not to mention it costs about 3 times as much per bottle!

Pours dark brown with ruby highlights and a dark tan head. The head fades to a finger and hangs awhile. Aroma is slightly smoky malt with a whiff of chocolate. Taste is truly fantastic if you like bocks. Great malt flavor with a touch of hops and a great campfire smoky flavor balanced by sweetness. I love this beautiful beer. All hail the goat!

This must be the best bock Ive had. Decent aroma, great flavor of malt, smoke and some caramel. Very drinkable, too. Outstanding.

Dark brown looks with slightly brown and a head that lasts long. Scent has dark chocolate and roasted malts. Promising start. Strong roasted flavors and nice sweet chocolate, some hops at the end. Rich texture with perfect carbonation. Excellent bock. Perfect for upcoming dark autumn evenings.
Dark brown almost black with a thin creamy head that goes away. malty aroma. flavor is roasted malt, caramel, and chocolate. medium carbonation.

Bottiglia 33cl, comprata da Eataly e bevuta a casa.
marrone scura con riflessi rubino, molta schiuma fine e persistente.
