Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; dark mahogany pour with tight magnolia head, bread and smoke aroma, taste had doughy malt, toffee quite sweet, some dark fruits, very good.
Mörk brun och lite röd öl med orange brunt skum. Doft: Malt, cola, fruktkola, alkohol. Smak: Malt, lakrits, mörk choklad kola, frukt kola.

Not a style I typically choose but I can acknowledge this for the finely crafted thing that it is. Strong burnt caramel and malt aromas. Dark murky brown with a very small head. The palate had a slightly heavy weight with good carbonation as anything less would have made this syrupy. The flavors filled the mouth. Tastes of sweet malts, caramel, smoke and some wood. Not much in the way of hops here. A very rich beer.

0.33l bottle by Cristobal37. Dark ruby/brown body, beige head. Aroma of caramel, plums, reisin and a minimal roastyness. Roasted malts, chocolate, plums and caramel in the taste. The finish is a bit hoppy. Medium body, alcohol well hidden. Complex and awesome beer.

11.2 oz bottle in mug. Not much to be said about this one that isnt pretty obvious enough from past reviews and overall ratings and popularity. Phenomenal Dopplebock that is always a joy to drink. Beautiful chocolate notes without being too sweet. This one is very much a staple in my fridge. For its style, absolutely top notch.
best dopplebock,i have tasted thusfar.very nice aroma and creamy,malty taste.can be drunk with red meat dish,but i prefer to sip it by itself,as is that good.
Sempre eccellezionale! Non tradisce mai e poi mai, complessa ma di facile bevuta, va giù che è un piacere!
Bottle. Dark brown body with a medium egg white jead. Aroma is sweet malt, toffee, fruity, spices. Flavor is sweet malt, toffee, dark fruit, light hops, light coffee notes.

Ayinger Celebrator - Very dark, very rich, very malty. Sour fruit at onset fades quickly overrun with bitters and malt.

Pours a deep cola color with a finger and a half of tan head that dissipates to nothing rather quickly. Boldly sweet on the nose, with toffee, molasses, and raisins all shining through. That sweetness translates to the tongue. medium bodied, and leaves a long toffee aftertaste. Rock solid beer.

From bottle. Deep dark brown color. Aroma of brown sugar, bourbon, plum, and black cherry. Taste is dark chocolate, grape, caramel, with distinct alcohol warming notes. Viscous mouthfeel and a lingering finish.

0.33l bottle from Whole Foods Market - Tribeca. It looks like a proper double bock alright with a deep dark almost ruby brown body and a small somewhat islandy and sidesticking beige top. Sweet nice on the nose, lots of dark malty sweetness with caramel and almost raisins. Smells sticky, inviting and to be honest really good! I also get hints of coffee and kahula. Damn, this smells good! It tastes just as good as it smells! Its dark and super malty! It has a perfect thick and oily mouthfeel with a gentle prickling carbonation level. Hmm.. Been a long time since Ive had a beer as smooth as this. It feels really integrated, and even if its a double bock its definitely not to sweet or almost cloying as these sometime can be. It has burned raisins and raisins zest, more traces of coffee, a little bit of salty soy sauce and some dark thick malt cake with marmalade towards the finish. Umami? A true experience, even if it is in a plastic glass in a hotel room. Lovely! 10.06.2013

The appearance of this beer is a dark ruby color with a large tan head, and the aroma is very, very pleasing with its strong malty (caramel and toasted), figs, and alcohol. This beers taste is slightly sour, slightly sweet, and mildly umami, and this strong malty character is very well balanced and great to sip on; furthermore, the palate combines an average carbonation, a hearty, malty finish, medium body, and an oily texture.
Draft at BRU. Pours black with medium tan head and lace. Nose of dried fruit, dark fruit, chocolate, roasted malt, mild smoke. Full bodied, smooth. Easily one of the best doppelbocks Ive ever had

33ml Bottle. Pours a very dark ruby with a 3/4 finger, off white head that thins.Smell is slightly roasted with of hints of fruit, raisins, caramel, and yeast.Taste is complex with notes of coffee, raisins, alcohol, and fruit. Medium carbonation. Medium body. slightly sweet/roasty finish. Very nice! Worth keeping around!!!
Poured into stein. Deep amber. Aroma of roasted malt. Taste is of roasted nutty malt. Small white head. Wonderfully balanced. One of my favorite doppelbocks.

Bottle at Epic Beer Festival 2013. Pour is clear brown with a big tan head and great lacing. Brown sugar, caramelly, figgy, raisins, bready, pruney, dark fruits, and burnt sugar in the aroma. Taste is dark fruity, slightly smoky, caramel, figs, earthy, brown sugar, and a touch of anise. Sticky mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Pretty easy too drink and not too sweet like most Doppelbocks.

bottle from derek, thanks! pours a dark walnut brown with a thin white head that dissipates. nose is rich roasted malts; a very nice combo of clean and bitter. nose is a bit sweeter than taste- which has even more roasty malts to balance. very enjoyable and complex.

Bottle thanks to a trade! Pours a clear dark brown with a grayish brown head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a good amount dark bread and dark grains with a bit of underlying grassy hops. Flavor has same dark bread note with toffee and a bit of light grass in the finish.
I purchased at LCBO back in the winter, most likely all sold out now untill who knows when they will order more. Good beer tho.

A fine beer. I had just hoped for something more exceptional.
Dark amber colour, nice head, earthy and roasted aromas. Ver richy very delicant, Actually roasted aromas amazinglly balanced with hoppy taste amazing beer.
@ Havregatan. Flaska från Systembolaget (30:-). Exemplaret jag drack kallas för Winter Bock. Mörkbrun färg. Mycket malt i doften och i smaken, ganska söt och rejält fyllig.

UPDATED: AUG 5, 2013 bottle purchased in october 2012. Pours dark brown with a tan head with moderate retention. tons of raisin, dates, caramel, some slight roast. incredibly fruity. medium-heavy sweetness, almost no bitterness. full body, creamy feel, soft carbonation. great dessert
Seriously how have I mot rated this over the years. Terrific beer one of the best Doppelbocks ever.  Big dark roast, terrific aroma and awesome finish.
UPDATED: AUG 17, 2013 Dark reddish-brown colour with slight head and little lacing. Aromas and flavors of bread, chocolate, coffee and roasted malts. Fairly short finish. Thick and oily mouthfeel

Pours dark brown/black with ruby highlights and a thinner khaki head that settles to a ring and leaves some spotty lace. Nice complex nose of roasted malts, toast, cherries, molasses, a light smokiness, and some asparagus of all things. Fairly sweet but quite bitter, probably more on the bitter side which is cool. Perhaps a light tartness. Full bodied, round, fair carb, with a long toasty smoky savory finish. Very nice brew. Easy to drink, but best savored. Yum.

Dark brown pour with a tight, tan head. Toasted bread hits you right away with a bit of dark fruits vanilla. Taste progresses from a malty vanilla character to a bitter dark chocolate to a dry, smoky roast, finishing with some subtle hops. Full and creamy on the palate. Phenomenal.

Pours a very dark ruby, with a fluffy tan head. Aroma: prominent roasted malt notes, dark fruits, bread, vanilla. Taste: roasted malts, sticky dark fruits, molasses, liquorice, mild coffee, touch of smoke. Well balanced sweetness in the finish. Wonderfully smooth and thick on the tongue. Great doppelbock.

2013/05/31 - Pours a dark cola brown with a mahogany tint and a thin, tan head. Nose is vanilla, coffee, dark fruits, molasses and roasted malts with a feint smokiness. Taste is similar to nose with a sweet aftertaste. Mouthfeel is creamy and very smooth. Lives up to the hype.

For me, this is a quintessential beer experience.  Unmatched taste and texture like drinking milk.  A beer to savor one or two.  Too rich to drink more than that at one sitting.

Dark brown dopple with a ruby tinge and a thin tan head. Lots of malt and bock yeast on the nose, which describes the backbone of the taste, malts coming on very roasty but not burnt. Hops are delicate and hard to detect, but balance for great palatability. Woodsy tobacco notes as well, some cocoa, and a hint of dark fruit. Clean and drinkable while rich all at once. A classic exemplification of the style.
I expected a tad more power and heft. Not a bad beer, I just dont think Im a fan of the authentic style.

A good double bock. Pours a thick black with a light white head. Smells a little fruity and a little smokey. Taste is very malty with a little bit of alcohol. Very malty finish. Had at warehouse cafe.

Pours a mahogany color tan small head tight bubbles. Aroma roasted malt dark fruits belgium yeast licorice and vanilla notes. Taste follows the nose perfectly with a Extremly smooth medium mouth feel. Very great beer!
Bottle. Dark brown with a  thin tan head. Aroma is sweet roast malt. Flavour is sweet with dark fruit and a little roast. Finish is sweet on a velvet texture.
Poured from 11.2 oz. bottle. Dark brown with a thick creamy head. Smells sweet and malty. Tastes of cherry and malt with a very faint hint of bitter. Highly rated but not my favorite.

Dark Mahogany.  Big head with good retention.  Smells of raisins, walnuts and soy sauce.  Tastes of sweet roasted soy sauce with some chocolate.  Slight carb.  Slight lactic tang. Dark brown/black color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of toasted sweet malt, molasses, caramel, & toffee; Flavor of roasted malt, caramel, dark fruit, some coffee, bittersweet chocolate, and nuts; Nicely balanced and complex; Very good.
Dark Brown, sweet musky smell, taste is sweet, dark fruits, velvet. Its not what I expect, but its good.
Pours velvety and creamy. Smells sweet. Tastes of sweet roasted malts. long finish.  Not my favorite type of beer, but a good one for the style.

Pours clear and deep brown with a medium sized, excellent lacing off-white to beige head. Aroma of slightly toasted malt, caramel, chocolate, molasses and yeast notes. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry, slightly bitter and with alcohol notes. Medium bodied, oily to creamy texture and soft CO2.

A - Pours a dark brown with garnet highlights and edges. 2 finger off-white head that dissipates slowly.

S - Rich malt, chocolate, sweet molasses, creamy toffee, nuts raisins, dried dates, soft vanilla, slight metallic notes.

T - Sweet creamy malt, hints of chocolate a coffee, sugary raisins, roasted toffee. Has an underlying smokiness.

M - Soft creamy feel, adequate carbonation. Full bodied.

One of my favorite beers of all time. It never seizes to amaze me. The complexity of the malt is outstanding. A fantastic comfort beer.

01-02-2011

Dark brown/amber and clear. Has an off-white head, mostly lasting. Sweet, malty aroma, notes of syrup and soy-sauce, faint pepper, spicy perhaps. Sweet flavor, dark notes, more soy. Creamy texture and soft carbonation.
bread, soy sauce, golden, clear, off white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, oily feel, bitter, long finish,

Pours black with a thick creamy tan head appears a deep dark red when held to the light. Smells of sweet raisins and dried plums. Taste is sweet with lots dark fruits coming threw. Thick creamy mouth feel that finishes somewhat dry leaving a faint sweet date taste behind. A fantastic beverage. Very drinkable.

bottle. Pours cola black with tan pillowy head. Aroma of malts, raisins, some light chocolate/roast. Beautiful smooth mouthfeel, sweet taste of malts but not overpowering. Not my favourite style, but a pretty good beer nonetheless.
Pours cola black with a small tan head. Aroma is heavy molasses and something leathery. Very, very smooth malt flavor. Sweet throughout. Heavy malt finish.

11.2 fl oz / 330mL bottle into a pint glass. Served cool.

Aroma: Sweet milk chocolate. Caramel. Slight nuttiness. A little toffee.

Appearance: Opaque dark brown with a lingering, frothy tan head. Quite handsome.

Taste: Chocolate, toffee, malts, caramel....Lots of nice flavors playing together well.

Palate: Creamy, velvety, rich, full-bodied, and smooth. Flavors hang around a bit.

Overall: Easily one of my favorite beers of all time. Love the aroma and I love how it feels. Deeeeeeeeeelicious delicious.

Bottle. 4/22/13. Pours deep brown, opaque with a thin light brown head. Aroma is bready, dark fruit, berries, caramel, toffee, yeasty, molasses. Taste is excellent; chocolate, plums, berries, caramel, toffee, bread; finish is slightly bitter, tasting of citrus peel and berry skins. Some small lacing, not remarkable. Medium-low carbonation; gentle. Mouth feel; medium bodied, slick, smooth, velvety. Excellent doppelbock. Full flavored, highly drinkable. Wonderful.

On tap at Ayingers am Platzl in Munich! Nice creamy head. Deep flavor with hints of plums, dark chocolate, and coffee. Really balanced brew with no overpowering flavors. My favorite Doppelbock in Germany!

Velvety as it describes.  Interesting brew.
Great aroma of malts. Malt flavors are not as strong as expected. Smooth and light for a doppelbock. Good but not as good as I had hoped.

6 months of aging come across nicely. Light malt flavor along with whole hop flowers this doppelbock is flavorful and aromatic.

Pours dark with a beige head that disapates quickly. Slight sweetness to the nose. Taste the sweetness and the bitterness both in the mouth. Has a nice kick on the swallow which stays with you in a pleasant way. Nice doppelbock. Have had before and will again.

znakomite, jedno z najlepszych piw jakie pilem z niemieckich landow, a zlaszcza z Bawarii. Piekny wyglad machoniowobrazowo czarny, z mnostwem czerwonych przeswitow. Piana trwala czapowata i troche bezowa. Zapach karmelowoczekoladowy. Smak to poezja, nuty orzecha zmieszane z piernikiem i rodzynkami. Finisz orzechowo-palony, Wytrawny palony i troche czekoladowy. Bottle.  My first doppelbock, chosen to continue my quest to keep exploring new styles (this will be the 40th style and 161st beer Ive rated).  Might as well start with the best when trying a new style.  Anyway ... aroma of pepper when the cap got popped, but nowhere to be found in the glass.  Toast, smoky, woody, caramel.  Some raisin, brown sugar.  Gives the impression it will be sickeningly sweet.  Pours cola brown with foamy tan head that dissipates to a thin layer covering the surface.  No lacing.  Taste:  Big malty burst -- chocolate, caramel, a little dark fruit, a nice smokiness.  Not overly sweet and the taste lingers nicely between sips.  Minimal bitterness.  Palate:  Medium body, slick texture, average-to-lively carbonation.  Overall:  the closest Ive had to this style before is scotch ale, which was one of the first styles I really enjoyed when getting started.  This is a lot sexier, though -- the malty flavors in this really play well together, providing a nice complexity and richness that is just fantastic.
Malt and raisins, dark fruit and raw sugar in the aroma. Sweet and roasty up front. Nutty coffee and molasses in the flavor, some earthiness in the finish. Slightly doughy. A nice, rich doppel.

UPDATED: APR 19, 2013 Nice floral hoppy aroma. Appearance is transparent mahogany. Taste is like a strong belgian ale lots of malt up front though a crisp finish like a lager. Malt taste is prunes and biscuits.
Amber Coulor, almost black with a tan head with fine bubbles. Aromas of citrus, caramel and light roasted malt.

3/30/13 6.7% LOOK: reddish brown with medium frothy khaki head NOSE: earthy/mulch bed, greenhouse, tangy yeasty malt, hint of chocolate, rye bread, beef roast, dried fruits, also kind of smells like the produce section of the grocery store TASTE: rye bread, brown sugar and squash, stale coffee, some cocoa, bitter bread and coffee finish FEEL: somewhat dry/dusty, acidic OVERALL: very good complexity, nice for something different, good food beer ...Room temp ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours medium to dark brown, with lighter brown edges, where light passes through. This beer looks remarkably like a cola. The foamy head, the carbonation bubbles that accumulate on the side of the glass and the lighter brown glints around the bottom and edges of the glass are reminiscent of a glass of brown cola. The aroma is rich and quite large. Horehound candy, sorghum, prunes, and heavy brown sugar characterize the nose. The flavor is so big its nearly vulgar. I said nearly. There was still quite a bit of a tact employed in stopping just short of over the top. It is almost like drinking liquid candy. I respect this beer for how bold it is, if for no other reason at all. Ive had imperial stouts and barleywines with less personality. All of this big malty flavor at only 6.7% ABV. Probably because the beer was engineered in a fashion to retain more unfermentable sugars. I detect some chocolate liqueur, brown sugar, and prunes. Theres just the faintest bitterness at the finish to help offset the sweetness. The mouthfeel is smooth and medium-bodied with very little scrubbing on the tongue. This is not necessarily a style that Id say is in my wheelhouse, but I do appreciate this beer. I wish it wasnt $14.99 a four-pack. Otherwise, Id keep it in my fridge all the time as an alternative to port wine for an after dinner dessert drink.
Pours black with a tanned head. Caramel nose. Pleasant mild aroma of caramel, some coffee. Medium body, high in carbonation. Decent, but I expected to pick up more based on the score.

No bottling information.
Appearance: The body is a dark chestnut hue with light only visible through the edges. A thin tan head rises from the body with average retention, but settles into a thick coating.
Aroma: The aroma is very bland, just a light sweet malt presence, slightly musky.
Taste: This is malty and fruity with a thick malt sweetness in the mid-taste with cherries and a slightly medicinal grape flavor on the finish.
Palate: Full bodied with sharp carbonation.
Overall: This is hurt a lot in points for two reasons. The first is the very restrained aroma. I find it hard to coax any aroma out of here even upon swirling. Secondly there is no freshness date to allow me to know whether this is old, and it likely is. This is a good beer, but at the price I find it hard to consider this again since this is the second time Ive been left unsure if Im getting a good read for this beer.

Pour a dark clear brown with beige head that leaves a nice lacing. Aroma or roasted malt, caramel, a little nutiness and cocoa. Taste has some caramel, roasted nuts, breadyness and little dark fruits. Full body mouthfeel that leaves a sticky palate and the perfect carbonation to make it really drinkable. Very enjoyable.

Dark brown, light brown head, nice cookie malt smell. Creamy, malty, thick body. Ton of flavor, little bit sweet at the end. Liquid bread is a fair description for this one. Like a meal. The body holds the malt very well. A sipper, dessert like beer. Very rich. By far the best doppelbock I have had.
Nero, testa sottile persistente. laroma è dolce, fumo, tostato, in bocca la liquirizia, malto, miele. Corpo pieno, morbido, soddisfazione al palato lunga. ottima.

Pours a clear dark brown with ruby hues and a large creamy light brown head.  Aroma is a strong maatiness, significant melnoidins, toast, caramel, some dark dried fruits and a bit of chocolate.  Taste is a rich malt base with toasty malts, some chocolate and some dark dried fruits.  A very nice full bodied doppelbock that is somewhat easy to drink.

Pours a very deep Amber, almost black with a tan  head with very fine bubbles. Aromas of citrus, caramel and light roasted malt. Taste its similar with mostly malt. There is a very nice, thick and full Mouthfeel. Awesome duble bock

Bottle @ Home. Pours dark brown with a light brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, yeast, light alcohol. Flavor is rich malts, caramel, brown sugar, yeast, light booze. Medium body, warming alcohol in the finish. 220313
Pours brown with off white head, aroma is sweet, aged and sweet. Flavor is sweet, aged quality, some alcohol. Kind of sligth roasted caracter

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2013 Bottled. Bottle. Pours clear and deep brown with a medium sized, excellent lacing off-white to beige head. Aroma of slightly toasted malt, caramel, chocolate, molasses and yeast notes. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry, slightly bitter and with alcohol notes. Medium bodied, oily to creamy texture and soft CO2. An excellent 2xbock. ★★★★

Poured into a small wine glass from bottle during an organized tasting. Freshly dark-roasted coffee beans, toasted wheat bread with black currant jam, bitter mocha powder, and a caramel lace titillate the nostrils. Robust froth tops the amber hue with layers of color as differentiated as the Earths crust. Tastes of being invited into a confectioners kitchen with ample French toast crust, burnt brown sugar, blueberry muffin made with rye, and, in the finish, the caramel springs as a deft ram might into caramel chews. Clean, yet rich, has a protracted finish, yet leaves as quickly as it came, inviting the quaffer to visit again. This isnt merely eminent for its style, but for all beers.

Sample at the Fredericton Craft Beer Festival. Dark ruby red colour. Not much head. Dark malt, prune, raisin and chocolate in the aroma. Rich dried fruit flavour, with some herbal/earthy and chocolaty bitterness. Body is light but full. Overall, an excellent doppelbock, especially for being on the lower end of the ABV for the style.

Aroma is very sweet with raisin and plum and also a little bit of chocolate and smoke. Pours dark brown with a decent head. Taste is sweet plum and raisin with some smoke an extremely smooth finish. Complex flavors balance very well in this beer.

Good lord, what a doppelbock. Amazing toffee masterpiece with honey, clove, dry finish. Great texture, very beautiful lace left on the glass. Amazing!

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2013 Delicious. Refreshing, yet meaty. Not sweet or heavy, well balanced. Slight booziness on the finish.

Bottle shared with McTapps. Bit sweetish and light Doppelbock with some hints of raisins, caramel and vanilla aromas. Easy to drink and easy to get drunken for sure.

330ml bottle, 6.7% a/v

Pours dark brown with a nice tan head. Aroma is nutty, chocolate and biscuit malt with some dark stone fruit. The taste is smokey, nutty and chocolatey with a smooth texture on the palate. Not my cup of tea so to speak but a good beer when you are looking for something dark!

Its hard to be critical with this one.  It exemplifies the doppelbock style with thick, bready mouthfeel and a malty toffee aroma.  This beer is so smooth that the alcohol is barely noticable.  This beer is a great malt showcase and makes you appreciate the balance of malt, hops and alcohol for this style.

12 oz bottle from Belmont Station.

A: Aggressive pour yields a cola type head with the fizzle to match. head dies immediately. Very dark brown with an edge of purple. Some legs.

N: Biscuit and bread. Some caramel and toffee blend through the middle. Sweet pecan and toasted tobacco. Lots of clove. Bread in a glass. 

T: Tobacco, leather, toffee, caramel, and rye bread. Has a very deep base. Lots of the barley, and a nice sweetness. Earth and dirt balance the sugars. Clove and nutmeg. Lots of flavors for a 6.7% beer.

M: Clean and filling. I think we can all agree this is a definition of the style.

O: What can I say that hasnt been said by more experienced reviewers? The classic everyone ought to regularly appreciate.

Bottle. Light dark brown colour with steady low head and smooth body. Nose of malt. Taste of light malt, torf, licorice, soy sauce, butterscotch and torf. Surprisingly light and fresh taste, not as heavy and loaden as many other Doppelbocks. Nice one.
Found this at the store and since it is top of the list for doppelbock, I figured its worth a try.Pretty awesome beer. Very malty smell and flavour. I recommend this beer,

Pours a very deep brown with small head and minimal lace. Smell of plum, malt, maybe a little chocolate and burnt toast. Tastes mildly sweet in a dark fruit way, lightly syrupy but still dry enough, very nice balance.

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2013 Tap from St. Urhos, HKI. Creamy head, almost black beer. Aromas of malt, coffee, toffee. Soft and creamy mouthfeel, taste of malt, liquorice, coffee, maybe a hint of toffee afterwards. Overall delicious, my favourite of all darker brews and styles this far.

br />Appearance: Dark and subtle red color with a tan head. Ok lacing.Aroma: Dark malt and fruity.Palate: Medium body. Sweet and a light bitterness. Creamy carbonation.Taste: Deep caramel malt, some roasted malt, fruity and toffee.Overall impression: A pleasant beer. Personal stats: Bottle as Ayinger Winter Bock  from a trade with Grima.Blytjern 13

330 ml bottle into tulip glass, no bottle dating.  Pours crystal clear very dark reddish brown color with a nice 2 finger fluffy khaki head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers.  Nice spotty foamy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation.  Aromas of caramel, raisin, toast, toffee, molasses, apple, dark bread, cocoa, light roast, light nuttiness, and light floral.  Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of malty notes and light fruity esters.  Taste of caramel, toast, toffee, raisin, molasses, apple, dark bread, cocoa, roasted malt, light nuttiness, and light smoke.  Lingering notes of caramel, toffee, molasses, dark bread, toast, raisin, apple, roasted malt, cocoa, and light smoke on the finish for a good bit.  Excellent flavor balance and complexity of robust malty flavors and light fruity esters; with zero cloying sweetness present after the finish.  Medium carbonation and body; with a creamy and fairly slick mouthfeel that is nice.  Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warming noticed after the finish.  Overall this is a highly excellent doppelbock!  Great balance and complexity of robust malt flavors; and extremely smooth to drink.  A highly enjoyable offering as expected.

My bottle, next to my Celebrator bottle, says Winter Bock. Dark coffee color.  Tan head. Some lacing, denser head on the Celebrator. Nice roasted raisin and malt aroma. Malty flavor. Good. The actual bottle marked as Celebrator is slightly better. May be placebo.

Sold in a 500ml bottle under the name Ayinger Winter Bock. Deep brown with a thick whitebrown head. Malty with a floral hint. Caramelized sugar, dark bread, syrup, raisins and roasted coffee. Nice long rye bread ending with a growing aroma from hops. Light carbonation that blends in perfectly.

A great doppelbock, definitely one of the best out there.
The best beer I think Ive ever had. Smooth, high gravity beer. You will not be disappointed with this one.
A beautiful doppelbock. Makes one pine for Munich during Fasching. TWO rams on this label, plus another draped on the neck!

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2013 Deep dark brown colour, and brownish head, disappearing....seems Coca Cola! Very bready nose, sweet malts, licorice. The taste also licorice, definetely, sweet (but not too much) & bready, and some fruity notes, but also smoked. Medium/low carbonation, and alcohol ok, but it would fit better some more. Well-bodied beer, but I was expecting more since its so famous. But good and complex.

11.2oz bottle. Pours dark brown, almost black with a thick off-white head of tight bubbles. Aroma and taste of roasted malt with some dark fruit notes. Some mild hoppiness that adds a nice complexity and balance to the malt. Someone else said in their review that there was a creamy mouthfeel - thats a great description and right on the mark.  I must admit I was quite excited to try this one and it didnt dissapoint!

Malty, roasty aroma with a bit of coffee/cocoa as it warms. Dark black, with a thinish light brown head. Taste isnt overly complex, but good and amazingly balanced nonetheless. Roasty malty taste with a bit of a frutiness and mild hop bitterness in the middle and the finish. Bit of alcohol comes through. Medium bodied, highly carbonated. A good one.

The German doppelbock is a must try as it is quite different than American dopplebocks. It pours a very dark brown color with a decent head on it. While there is very little carbonation, there is a reasonably strong coffee/cocoa flavor making the beer extremely flavorful but yet giving it a smooth finish. Drinks fine by itself, but would pair excellent with most foods.
Nout much I can add to the already superlative reviews here. One of the worlds best.

.3 L draft. Heavy roasted malt nose along with the standard German hop scent. Creamy mouthfeel with moderate carbonation. Labor is wavy roasted malt, coffee, caramel. Very enjoyable but very heavy. Great beer.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2016 33cl bottles from brauereishop, 33cl bottle from Bierzwerg. - Dark, creamy, velvety, not overboozed but palpably strong dark Doppelbock with loads of roasted malts and dark chocolate, minimal sugar. - NOTE: It is at this point impossible on RB to distinguish Celebrator from Ayingers Winter-Bock, which I received in a 50cl bottle with a different label, along with a Celebrator and is a different beer (!), if only in details: dark doppelbock with 6,7% as well, but with more of an alcoholic burn. Anyone ordered the same Bierzwerg des Monats 12-2012 notice any difference?
RB please update... // Resampled aged 3years (bottled bb03/2016 opened 02/2016): does not age particularly well - reduces down to thin boiled-off liquorice root, the once poor mans cola.

Pours a murky brownish-black from the bottle with quickly dissipating tan head and little to no head. Aroma of toasted and sweet malts. Taste follows, well balanced and full bodied for the style. Good stuff.

Kaatuu lasiin colavärisenä ja melko runsaalla vaahdolla, joka tosin katoaa nopeasti. Haju on paahteinen, vahvan lakritsainen, limppuinen ja taustalla on hieman tuoretta hedelmää (sitrus ja banaani). Maku on paahteisen maltaisen maitoinen, lakritsinen ja taustalla on hieman puoliraakaa banaania. Suutuntuma on hyvin soljuva ja tayteläinen, hieman hapokas ja katkera. Kokonaisuutena rikkoo lopullisesti käsitykset bockeista, etteivät ne omaa makuun sopisi. Todella monimuotoinen ja hienolla suutuntumalla varustettu olut.

Bouteille 330ml. De couleur brune foncée et claire. Nez malté de caramel toffee légèrement rôti, fruité (raisins, prunes et dates), léger de chocolat noir avec des notes de café,  dalcool, de pain grillé, de mélasse brûlée, de noix et de houblon herbeux.  Moyenne-ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen-bas et une texture huileuse et aux notes liquoreuses. Goût fruité (raisins aux notes vineuses, moyen de dates et léger de prunes) avec de faibles notes fumées (fumée de bois) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute rapidement un goût malté de caramel toffee bien rôti et de mélasse légèrement sucrée avec quelques notes de chocolat noir en de pain grillé puis en finale lon retrouve quelques notes de café avec un léger goût de houblon herbeux, quelques notes de noix grillées et des traces dalcool doux et réchauffant. Post-goût long-moyen aux notes sèches, moyen-léger amer de rôti, léger de fruits (moût de raisins, pelures de prunes) avec des notes de chocolat, de café, de noix grillées et de houblon herbeux.

german greatness in a bottle,,,,, NOW THESE GUYS KNOW HOW TO BREW,,,,,,,,,,,  im looking foward to try others from this brewery ,,,,,,,,,, i love [ dopplebock ] the differnt ways they taste,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,

Easily the best beer germany has ever produced. Aroma, color, taste, and finish is completely perfect in every way

One of our favorites, if not the pinnacle of doppelbocks (IOHO).
Recently finished our own personal keg of Celebrator (firkin-size).
Truly a complex flavor profile that goes well with many food-pairings; drafts with a beautiful lacy tan head and feels like warm velvet cascading over your tongue.
UPDATED: JAN 18, 2013 Bottle at home. Pours a dark brown with two finger head.  Aroma is strong malt. Taste is sweet and full, almost cola. Lingering boozy aftertaste.  German goodness.

draft at Market District in Robinson.  I remember years ago how good this beer was, I recently just saw it on draft and had to get a glass.  Smooth, complex well balanced German style brew.  Excellent!!!

Benn enjoying this beer for years and have just now gotten around to rating.  Pours a clear dark cola color with a bountiful light tan head that sticks around.  Aroma is roasted malt and a nuts.  Taste is creamy sweet roasted malt, caramel, dark syrup and a slight well balanced bitterness to round it out.  Pretty much the standard bearer for all Bavarian doppelbocks.

330ml bottle poured into a tulip glass.
Clear dark brown with nice red hues and decent, creamy beige head.
Dense raw malt aroma, with caramel, chocolate, dark bread, honey and some peat.
Super chewy malty flavors, lo bitterness, toffee and caramel, with a touch of soy sauce. 
Full bodied, soft carbonation, thick and heavy but interesting enough to keep drinking. Alcohol is hidden nicely, finish is satisfying. One of my favorite doppelbocks.

Bottle, gift. Clear brown pour with a short, persistent beige head leaving moderate lace. Nose is medium roast malt, brown sugar and some dark fruit. Medium body with light carbonation and a round, smooth body. Dates, raisins, chocolate, almonds and toffee. Finish is medium, with more dark fruit sweetness, but with a mild charcoal dryness at the end. I appreciate dopplebocks and the Celebrator defines the style for me.

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2013 Draught beer in Pullman Helsinki. I really like this product. Very rich and full of flavours - all in balance. Very nice feeling in mouth. It was sold as Ayinger winterbock and yes, it is so far the best season beer. This is really a succesfull product and a find. +++
....year after. Yes, Winter is here again and so is Ayinger winterbock. To get it from draught is such a nice experience. You are so full of tastes, that Im getting dizzy of it. Well done again. This years Xmas bock is even better than last year....
Draught at St Michael, Oulu. Colour is dark brown with brownish white small head. Aromas and flavours are bread, smoke, sweetness, fruits and malts.
---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2013 Black with big, foamy, tan head / Nose of sweet toffee, dark fruit, smoke, and coffee / Medium to full body, sweet, soft and creamy, excellent balance with some light bitterness on the finish / Subdued flavors of cocoa, coffee, toffee, smoke, raisin, date, and bread / A standard for the style, I would assume.

UPDATED: NOV 8, 2013 dark colour, like a cup of coffee with huge, long lasting brownish head; aroma of yeast, earth, roasted malt, caramel, biscuit, and dried berries; taste of coffee, roasted sugar and malt, liqueur, hints of smoke and some sourish backgroung.

Bottle at JF tasting, IP trade from Essex Jim, labelled as winter bock - 29/12/12.
Hazed chestnut brown.
Nose carries dark malts, yeast, light vegetal tones, toffee, dark fruit.
Taste comprises dark toffee, sweet sugars, dark malts, bready notes.
Full end of medium bodied with soft carbonation and a little bitter sweetness in the finish.
Decent drop.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Custom tulip glass- one of the best beers that I have ever had period. Aroma of rich chocolate and spices taste of sweet salty smoky goodness. Have to try this one if your a beer aficionado.

This beer had a nice dark brown appearance with a 1 finger head. Aroma was prunes, nuts, and maltiness. Taste had the maltiness up front followed with a hint of nuttiness following up with the malt backbone again. Had a nice mediu.m mouthfeel. This beer did improve a lot as it warmed up in regards to these favors really starting to come out.

[4643-20120810] 330mL bottle. Metallic light mushy baked beans and green peas aroma. Slightly hazy, dark brown body with a medium-lasting creamy tan head. Roasted bread flavour ha a boozy nut flavour. Medium-full body. Not my style but not bad. (6/3/6/3/13) 3.1
(w/ jercraigs)

UPDATED: SEP 26, 2015 En smakexplosion med lite för mycket av det mesta. En för offensiv alkoholsmak vältrar sig i en hal gyttjebrottning tillsammans med något sötsliskigt och en eftersmak som är det stora utropstecknet.

Bottle from Beer Merchants, mail order. Colour is dark brown, nearly opaque, off white foam head. Nose is prune, raisin, malty, little toasty grain. Taste is dark fruits, prune, raisins, ale fruity, caramel, malty, toasty to roasted grain, mild bitterness. Nice soft on the palate and tasty.
Pours very dark with a thin head. Malty and slightly smokey on the palate. Absolutely delicious.

Di un colore marrone con sfumature mogano, malto in evidenza nella prima parte della bevuta, molto ben bilanciato con una luppolatura secca e ed finale leggermente affumicato....nonostante la gradazione alcoolica lalcool è molto ben nascosto.

330ml bottle. A deep brown-mahogany body, good retention of medium mocha head. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, licorice, raisins and a fistful of herbs. Taste dominated by roasted malt, caramel, light coffee, lots of herbs, licorice. A little bit sticky.

11.2oz bottle from nimbleprop. Nice dark brown pour with a billowy biege head that fades to a nice thin layer and in this glass at least an almost perfect eyeball...was a little spooky to be honest. Cant get over the malt on this one - what a perfect complex blend of sweet with some roast / toast, some plum and raisin, caramel, and not too sweet which is great. At first blush this seemed quite thin but after it warmed up to the proper temperature its actually full bodies with a mild carbonation and a gentle malt sweetness that pleases the palate as it becomes quite dry and even tastier with more fruit. I have to admit I was very curious as to what the fuss was for this one but I would gladly have this readily available in the cellar to pull out whenever the fancy struck me.
Pours deep brown with a tan head. Aroma is of molasses, toast, and wood. The taste is sweet toasty malt with medium body and slightly lingering bittersweet finish.

Bottle. Very dark brown with shrinking lacing tan head.  Luscious aroma like a boozy fruit cake.  rich taste starting sweet like dried dark fruits  and a hint of spiciness  becoming lightly bitter. Well carbonated balancing the sweetness perfectly   Mouthfeel is full and oily. Alcohol is well contained  An absolute gem of a beer.

Ruby brown with a beige head. Slight gusher when the bottle opened. Aroma is raisins, caramel, honey, fig, spices. Slightly creamy mouthfeel, sweet and malty on the palate with a little effervescence. Taste is caramel, toffee, raisins, dates, hint of anise and balsamic reduction. Very enjoyable, quite a big beer for only 6.7%.

This beer is very lively when opened. It pours a rusty brown color. It little head. The nose is raisin, date, mission fig and cake. The pallet is quite carbonated with flavors of fig, roasted barley, with a sweet off dry finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0,33 l bottle.  BB 09/13 
chocolate, coffee, roasty, butterscotch, earthy, woody, brown, clear, minimal head, brown foam, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, full body, oily feel, sticky, soft carbonation, long finish,
Dark pour off white head. Sweet bread malt aroma with chocolate plum and slight anise notes. Full body dry finish taste of roasted grains and dark fruit. Good full body beer for cold nights.

Pours frothy cream colored head.  Good all around beer.  Has a rich smokey flavor that balances out well with a somewhat dry after taste.  Reminds me of a tasty amber.  amount of hops.  Solid beer go to beer to drink for an entire evening, which surprising given the full bodied, somewhat heavy appearance

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
It poured a dark brown color with a small tan head.  The aroma was of caramel and some roastiness. The taste was malty, caramel, coffee notes with a long sweet aftertaste.

330ml bottle.  Pours a dark, dark brown with a large beige head of fine bubbles.  The nose is pure fruit cake.  Dates, molasses, caramel, dark sugars, dried cherries, red fruit, coffee, earthy notes, and bread crust.  Theres a lot going on.  The taste is basically a giant hit of dried and candied fruit...fruitcake bomb...more red fruit in the finish, with some bitterness.  Like a less bitter Italian Amaro in beer form.  Great stuff.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours very dark brown with a creamy dark beige head. Aroma is chocolate, caramel, dried fruit. Taste is sweet at first, dried fruit are present, some fruity esters and a mild bitterness takes over from the sweetness.

Bottle at home. Dark brown with brown head. Aroma is sweat with boiled hops. Taste is little burned and caramel but too sweat. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
330 ml bottle.  Pours a very dark brown with a decent brown head.  Aroma of malt, chocolate, dark fruits, and some coffee.  Taste is similar.  Cant imagine a better Doppelbock!  Superb.

UPDATED: APR 12, 2013 Bottle at konttori, tampere. Red-black color, small white head. Aroma of rye bread, sweetness and roasty malts. Nice taste of sweetness, rye bread, roasted malts. Hops and licorice finish.

Fairly dark with a thin white head.  Aroma and taste is Rum raisin, black licorice, dark fruit, root, dirt.  Slightly sweet, no noticable hops.  Stale german malt.  This is the first real doppelbock ive tried.  Ive heard this is the best, but I cant imagine liking this style.
Nem lehet hibát találni benne. Intenzív és összetett illat. Tökéletesen eltalált ízhullám, pont kellemesen édes és komlós, gazdag zamatokkal. Minden cseppje kulináris élvezet.
Its Ayinger Celebrator... simply the gold standard of the doppelbock style.  Read the other reviews for tasting details, Nuff said.
Alias Ayinger Winter Bock. Bottle from Systembolaget. 30 SEK. Blind tested yesterday evening at the yearly Winter/Christmas seasonal brew testing.

Bottle from LCBO, this beer pours extremely dark almost opaque, when light is shined there is a tinge of dark maroon. The light  brown head is about 1/4 an inch thick and quickly dissipates to a thin film on the surface with excellent lacing.
The aroma is just fantastic with notes of plum, liquorice, cherry, citrus, and faint yeast. The taste lives up to the aroma with distinct notes of plum, Kirschwasser (a plum liqueur that is sometimes added to Black Forest Cake), rum, Cherries, Brandy, black liquorice. 
A very faint hops bite rounds up the flavours, and the plum and rum notes leave a warm after taste in the mouth. I must admit this beer is blowing me away, no wonder it is considered a world class beer!
UPDATED: JAN 22, 2013 Bottle @ eataly. It pours black with a good head on top. Fruit, caramel and roast. Sweet, complex and strong but great balanced. A great beer.

330 mL bottle.  Pours a nearly opaque brownish black color, good beige head, if short lived.  Nice aroma profile, a little malt, yeast, prune, smoked meat and sweet vanilla.  Sweet to start, with a touch of hop bite and a souring finish. Medium bodied with medium carbonation and a long lasting mouth feel. Drinks suspiciously easy.

Jag är, för tillfället, inne i en strong ale, bock-öls period och öl av de här typerna tilltalar mig. Den här är absolut inget undantag, det här är en riktigt bra öl. De olika smakinslagen i ölen är väldigt fint balanserade och samordnade vilket ger ölen ett komplext intryck. Smaken bär inslag av torkad frukt, karamell och lite försiktiga rostade toner. Kroppen är stabil och balansen är precis så bra som man önskar den.

Deep and dark brown. I poured this beer pretty aggressive and i got a big head with big bubbles and also some lacing. Malty aroma - chocolate, anise, nuts, caramel. Taste is roasted malts, coffee, some smoke and some bitterness in the aftertaste.

330ml bottle into tulip. Aroma is rich roasted malt, bready, and mild caramel sweetness. Taste is bready, malty sweet, and a hint of plum. Finish is slightly sweet and has a medium full mouthfeel. Surprisingly clean and refreshing beer.
Bottle. Pours almost black dark brown with minimal head. Aroma is of reasted malts with hints of fruits and chocolate. Taste is malty strong but balanced and has some fruits and chocolate.

Good beer, though a bit underwhelming for an average score as high as rate beers.  

T- nice molasses flavor, but thats about it.  Some mild hoppy bite on the finish, but nothing impressive.
P - good medium body beer with clean finish
A - Nice aroma, but nothing outstanding.

In general a good beer, but worthy of a 100... No.

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2016 500ml bottle (shared by FatPhil). Dark brown, mahagony color. Tiny head, stays. Sweet, caramel, roast, faint minerals in aroma. Rich roast, massive caramel, sweetish flavor. (7/4/8/4/15=3,8).
Re-rate: Tap @Black Door, Helsinki as "Ayinger WinterBock". Dark brown color with red hue. Medium size, tan head, stays. Sweet, caramel, raisins, berries in aroma. Caramel, roast, sweet, berries in taste. Toffee and sweet malts in aftertaste. Soft carbonation. Bloody nice!

Bottle from @joneso76.  Great bottle with plastic goat tag.  Almost black - or midnight purply black according to my better half (or better third actually, as she is somewhat smaller than me).  I digress...  Taste is more in line with a fine Belgian strong ale - tangy fruit cake, orange peel, mulled wine, marzipan, brown sugar, snow leopard.  Very heavy - knife and fork required - but smooth.  Some slight fizz, strong alcohol.  Belch.  Very good beer.
Pours dark brown color with small head. I smell roasted malt, chocolate, caramel and dark bread. I taste all of the same, its sweet and better. Complex! Wow!! Great!!!!

Favorite doppelbock!!! Some other offerings have better individual traits; but this is the best overall!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a dark brown gorgeous color, hint of dark birch beer red.  Gradually fades to light ring of froth, with lace around the mug

Smells a roasty malt, tiny bit of chocolate, tiny bit of fruit in there as well...but mostly full on malt

Don't have a ton to compare in this style, but this is tasty.  Lotta malt but still goes down very smooth.  Mouthfeel is fantastic, but almost too much on the malt....BUT if I'm going to have a beer with a bit hit of malt, this is what I want it to taste like


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap @ In De Wildeman. Clear, deep dark brown color. Lasting blanket of beige head. Aromas: caramel, malt/grain, laurel, drop/licorice, somewhat roasted. Flavor is medium sweet, some drop/licorice, roasted. Medium bodied. Finishes with some roast/gebrand and lightly bitter. Pretty much how a bockbier should be imho.

Bottle to tulip.  Black on the table, ruby against a light.  Dense head that fades away quickly allowing that beautiful aroma to escape.  Bread, spice, ginger, licorice.  Mild roast and with a small touch of sweetness.  Near-room temperature worked fine.

Bottle. Dark. Brown. Dark malts, rye bread, some syrupy tones with a hint of hops. Body is medium. Full of malty dark flavours. A bit of roastedness, some smoke. A bit dry. Full of flavours, but not quite my thing.-- bb/hEarlier Rating: 9/23/2012 Total Score: 3.7Dark brown. Nose is heavily malty, sweetish with some alc. Almost barley wine like body, rich malts, caramel. Very nice dubbelbock.-- bb/h

330 ml bottle. This is a clear dark red/brown beer with an average brown head and nice lacing. It has a pleasant sweet caramel/bread aroma with notes of chocolate, roasted malt and smoke. The flavour is moderately sweet and bitter. Medium body with an oily texture and soft carbonation. It has a dry, a bit smoky, alcoholic finish.
500 ml bottle. Aroma weak, dark caramel, sugar. Taste: quite bitter. Dark sugar, burnt, good bitterness. Aftertaste dominated by the kind of bitterness you get from burnt sugars.
UPDATED: NOV 29, 2015 Flaska 500 ml från Systembolaget. Häller upp i mörk, nästan svart vätska. Markerad maltarom, lite knäck och kola. Initial sötma i smak som ersätts av skön och lite torr beska.

Brown to black coloured, small off white head, low carbonation. Aroma has chocolate, cacao, mocca, some sweetness also. Bitter tste, not sweet at all, full bodied, with again mocca and chocolate. Long long finish, smooth, bitter, a very nice doppelbock!

330ml bottle into a pint glass.

Pours a nearly opaque dark brown with a half finger tan head that fades rather quickly leaving just a tiny bit of foam on top. No lacing.

Aroma is full of malt. Lots of caramel, toffee, and burnt sugar along with an almost soy sauce like character but it is not off-putting. A touch of chocolate as well.

The flavor is very heavy on the burnt sugar/caramel but it doesnt become astringent. This leads to some milk chocolate and a touch of coffee and toast. A little hop bitterness towards the finish but it is far in the background. Malt dominates. Mouthfeel is full and sticky/sweet but stays just below being cloying.

Overall, one of the best Doppelbocks out there. This is probably one of my least favorite styles but I can appreciate it for what it is; a nice, malty, cold weather beer and this one really packs in tons of flavor.

50 cl, bottled. Pours dark with a wheat head. Aroma: Roasted malt, chocolate, coffee. Slight hints of fruits and grass. Taste: Medium sweet, some bitterness. Acidic component. Palate: Medium body, smooth. Pretty good. Satisfactory.

Clear dark reddish brown colour, beige head. Malty aroma, caramel, roasted malts, liquorice, yeast and milk chocolate. Recognisable Ayinger -is it the yeast?-. Sweet malty flavour, liquorice, roasted tones, bitter roast. Long malty, lasting bitter finish, with roasted highlights.
Absolutely lovely. Doppelbock might not be my favourite style, but this is truly a great beer.
(Draught @ Becoloth, Boxtel)
Bottle - Black with ivory head that dissipates quick.  Aroma of dark dried fruits, figs, toffee.  Flavor is good, slightly bitter with notes from aroma.  Good!

Dark, tan head, gives way in a few minutes to some lacing.  Nose is all sweet, malty, molasses.  Taste is  sweet as well, figs are clearly the dominant fruit. Strong malt. Very rich.  Love it.   A little sticky, which enhances that figgy-malt. Tiny carbonation sizzle if you let it linger.
botella. muy buena presencia corta de aroma pero sabor sorprendente dulce con final seco el alcohol perfectamente integrado. muy muy recomendable

Poured from 330 ml bottle. 

Clear, but nearly opaque, deep red brown win 2-finger khaki head and very good lacing. 

Aroma of raisins, toffee, molasses and prunes. 

Taste of roast dark malt, nuts, dark fruit, toffee, yeast, molasses and chocolate. 

Medium body and high carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On draft at list dog cafe in arlington va. Pours dark cola brown with a thin off white head. Raisins and cherries in the aroma. Flavors of toasted malts and red fruits. Slightly bitter finish. Nice.

UPDATED: NOV 8, 2016 Rerate.
.33l bottle @Harrys. More aroma:. Plums, raisin, dried fruits. Flavor mostly same with plums and raisins.

_______Orginal 647414-3.5. 2.11.2012
.5l bottlePours almost black, red. Low head. Aroma is roasted malts, dark fruits, alcohol, ash. Flavor is roasted malts, alcohol, syrup and tobacco.

Rating #1600. Bottle @ The Priory Arms, Stockwell. The pours deep brown with a medium off-white head. The nose is of rich caramel, dark fruits. Some fig and sweet syrup. Hints of cocoa and ash. The taste is more sweet autumn fruits, hints of fig and licorice. Big, nutty malts, sweet caramel and cherry. Light roasted wood, hints of bitter chocolate on the finish. Medium body, active carbonation. Overall, a pretty nice, flavorful beer.

On tap.  Pours very dark, almost opaque with a reddish hue.  Small head left little lacing.  Aroma had strong notes of licorice.  Taste similarly was of licorice with dried fruits and roasted malts.  It was smooth and creamy with a nice dry finish.

Draught:
Medium to smaller sized, vast and thicker tan colored head on top of a clear dark ruby colored beer.
Smell lot of autumnal herbs, leaves, toasted grass, caramel, toast, light butter and light toffee.
Taste is a balanced mix of barleys, toasted malts, creamy barley malts, dark fruits, nuts, bitters, straw hay an grass (light toasted), light caramel, spicy, some hops but mostly malty bitterness, creamy. Lovely!
Aftertaste lot of autumnal and toasted herbs, bitters, nuts, dried darker fruits, light spicy and some caramel.
Low carbo, creamy silky mouthfeel, medium to lightly fuller body and a creamy silky texture.
Absolutely a good beer! Balanced, smooth and tasty!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Very malty aroma and taste. Warming and bittersweet. Hint of almond in aftertaste. Creamy texture.

330 ml bottle. Pours almost opaque dark brown and little bit reddish colour with a small and steady lacing tan head. Aroma of chocolate, bready malt, mild hoppyness, berries and a hint of cherry-like tartness. Taste of chocolate and a bit roasty caramel malt. Lively carbonation, medium bodied and smooth creamy mouthfeel. Bisquits and chocolate in finish. A wonderful and complex doppelbock.

Draught @ Becoloth. Dark brown color with a deep dark red glare coming through, medium sized beige head that diminishes quickly. Smell malts, some caramel, slightly a hint of smoke. Taste malts, slightly roasty, a hint of sweetness, raisin, dark and dried fruits. Lightly bitter finish, medium body, perfect carbonation.

Ayinger is one if the best craft beers coming out from Germany. Doppelbock means double punch, and this is what you get with this high alcohol beer. Very sexy, tasty, happy trigger beer. Reminds me being in Oktoberfest with this nice fräulein, and after a couple of beers, getting laid intensely. You won't fail with this one if you want to take home that nice lady next to you !

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2014 330ml bottle. Some caramel and roasty aromas. Pours dark brown, with amber reflections. Light body, average carbonation. Taste is malty, caramel, some sweet and coffee notes, with a long sweet aftertaste. Quaffable end enjoyable.

330ml. bottle from L.C.B.O. in Ottawa. The color is a dark brown with a thin dark beige head. The taste is of smokey malt and prunes and figes,some hops The aroma also of that roasted malt and fruits. It leaves a bitter sweet taste in your mouth that last a long time.

Aroma:  Nice aroma, flavor of raisons, grapes, a little sweetness.  Appearance:  Almost perfect, a dark black color, with a two finger tan head.  Taste:  Nothing much to add, for a doppelbock its pretty much perfect, the taste is strong in every regard.  Palate:  Perfect, has a strong beginning and finish with nice lacing as it goes down, breathes easy.  Overall:  No contest, the best doppelbock out there, try it without questions.

Best doppelbock Ive ever tasted, and that includes my go-to Troegs Troegenator.  Slight bitter hoppiness that is counterbalances by an array of malts that delight the palate.  A slight booziness to it, that surprised me given its moderate ABV.  Liked the smokiness that comes through with the lingering full mouth feel.  Loved it!

Draft. (happy to have found it)
Very smooth dark brown beer with beautiful full beige head. 
Roasted malt smell, sweetness and some smoke in the flavour. Incredibly full and balanced.

Bottle; Sharp edge in Pittsburgh. Pours a dark brownish/reddish. Dark malty aroma with very little head. Smooth drinking with almost no after taste. Great bear that goes with a burger or a steak rather well.
Pours clear but dark wig brown head.  Minimal aroma off the pour.  Taste is very smooth wig fruity notes , some hop and finishes with faint smokiness.

Head: beige colored foam. Color: clear ruby brown. Aroma: roasted malt, hops. Taste: roasted malt, hops, bitter. Palate: dry, full body, bittersweet finish. Overall:very good doppelbock.
UPDATED: OCT 18, 2013 Amazing! So dark, sweet, and smooth. Much more enjoyable and complex then Paulaner Salvator.

Draft @ Vlaamsch ReusDark redbrown, light brown head. Aroma is autumn bock spices combined with roasted malts, coffee and chocolate, all nicely balanced. Taste has additional black fruits. Nice bitter/sweet balance and dry finish.
Dark brown with small head and medium carbonation. Caramel aroma an flavor. It has a perfect blend of everything. A perfection in a doppelbock.

Deep reddish brown, some foam. Rich aroma, caramel, nutty, some roast. Sweet roasted malt flavor transforms to slight bitterness. Light almond, grape jolly rancher (?!), and coffee notes bubble up. Alcohol comes through as well.

Deep brown bodied, creamy medium to big head, looks very good. Nutty, mild milk chocolate, fudge. Unfortunately served quite cold. Nice full sweetness, some roasted notes. Long ending what reveals some drier hops. Nice and sticky. Good powerful bock, if served at the right temperature. (On tap at Ledig Erf)
Color marrone scuro con una bella schiuma beige persistente. Odore di malto tostato, cioccolato, toffee, sapore di caramello, toffee, zucchero di canna, nocciola e malto tostato. Bevibilissima.

Dark but clear, rusty, colour. Head disappeared quickly. Compex smell of sweet fruits, yet still fresh. 

Coffee-like strong bitter taste, creamy below the toungue. Calm, sweet and sour finish.

Aroma: Sweet smells, dark fruits, raisins, Christmas spices.Appearance: A black beer. A warm off-white head, good lacing and good curtains.Taste: Black sweet bread, licorice, brown sugar, dried fruits, dates, sherry and spices.Palate: Little carbonation, soft and sticky, a light dry finish.Overall: Very potent, very sweet and a good dessert.Note: Bottle. Reviewed 2012-05-19.
On tap in Pintelier. Pours a watery light brown, aroma is roasted malt, chocolate and dark fruit. Flavour similar, with a fair amount of sweetness in there, dry fruity aftertaste.
Aroma licht rokerig, donker fruit en ietwat muffe kelder. Smaak zet rokerig door met pruim en lichte vanille tonen. Elegante ietwat droge afdronk, in algemeen geen hoogvlieger. Van de tap @ de Klep.
Bottle from Alko. Dark brown color, beige head. Malty taste with nuts, fruits, bread, vanilla and toffee. Somewhat roasty, sweet finish. Excellent doppelbock.
Pours brown with a thick tan head. Aroma is malty and slightly sweer. Flavor has good roasty malts, light fruit. Liked it a lot. Want to drink it again and again!

Aroma has roasted malt, bread, slightly sweet, dark fruits, alcohol. Dark mahogany, almost black, short coffee color head. Taste has coffee, bit burnt,  dark dry chocolate, bitterness here also, kinda porter-like taste. Dry and bitter,  medium body, bit oily feel. Nice palate. Long taste. Liked this, good flavors, nice looks.
UPDATED: NOV 9, 2012 190912. Bottle at home. Pours clear dark brown with a high disappearing head. Aroma malts, dark sugar. Slightly sweet full bodied malts in the taste. A nice doppelbock. Not Bad.

UPDATED: APR 23, 2016 Pours reddish dark brown with a medium-sized, dense head. The aroma has a strong presence of toasty and bready maltiness with some roastiness; also some dark fruitiness. Taste is light sweet with toasty and sweet malty flavours combining; caramel, rye pudding, rye bread and plum appear. The palate is medium to full bodied with an average carbonation, fairly smooth. Celebration of malts.

Yeasty, earthy, funky, brown sugar smell. Funky taste with some vegetable and just a little bitter. Tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from 33cl bottle into tulip glass. Bought at Bevmo. First doppelbok I've tried. I liked it.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours brown with a thick tan head.  Aroma is malty and slightly sweert...some dry leaves...roasty/fruity.  Flavor has good roasty malts...light fruit but not sweet...mild earthy bitterness makes for good balance.  Mouthfeel is medium/full and silky with a roasty/earthy finish.

Straight from 330ml bottle. Good appearance, great nose, best taste and mouth feel of any dopplebock I?ve had thus far. Definitely worth another taste and if it was cheap enough it would be extremely sessionable for it?s alcohol content.

Bottiglia 33 cl.
Marrone con riflessi ramati, schiuma beige chiaro poco persistente.....
naso intenso con note fruttate, tostate e di caramello.
morbida e abboccata, corpo medio chiude leggermente amara....
Buona.....ottima nel suo stile......
330 ml bottle. Pours a dark garnet red/brown with light head. Aromas of biscuit and malt. Smooth and rich.  Flavors of roasted malts, toast, and light chocolate. Light bitter finish

33cl bottle in Madrid. Pours very dark with a beige head. Fruity and malty aroma with dried dark fruits and hint of spices. Well balanced bock and quite nice. Alcohol is pretty well integrated. Slighly dry and bitter finish. Not my favourite style but a nice beer.

AROMA: Malt forward - sweet roasted malt, caramel and molasses notes. APPEARANCE: Pours a deep brown with a short lived tan head.  TASTE: Whoa,! My little taste buds just had an orgasm!  Rich roasted malts, nuts, caramel and hints of bitter chocolate greet the pallet. Roasted malt and caramel /molasses aftertaste. MOUTHFEEL: Medium bodied and minimal carbonation. OVRALL: This beer sets a standard for dopplebocks.

330ml bottle. Dark with an off-white head. Smells earthy and chocolatey initially, with some leather and marshmallow notes following shortly. Tastes sweet and malty with some good liquorice character. Palate is quite thick and fairly oily. I was concerned that this might be a one-dimensional affair, but it turned out to be a tasty, well-balanced beer with enough complexity to keep me interested.

Bottle. Pour dark brown with a large creamy brown head that laces well. Aroma is mildly sweet roasted malt dominated with caramel and molasses notes. Flavor is mildly sweet roasted malt, with caramel, fruits including prune, and a bit of bread. Finish has some grassy bitterness. Quite rich on the palate.
Wonderful doppelbock. Creamy and rich mouthfeel dominates. Nice blending of malts with a little bit of hop bite. Smoky and rich flavors with some coffee tones. Smooth and drinkable.
Never knew what a doppelbock was until I tried this one. It was on a list for the brew crew I belonged to, I was once again suprized by the flavors and how smooth it tasted. 15 in my overall top 20.
Poured dark brown, caramel, roasted malt, chocolate, little dark fruits, little coffee.
By far the best doppelbock Ive had.  Nice and smooth, lots of roasty malt with a pleasant sweetness.  Pretty complex, rich but not too heavy.  Great beer
Dopplebocks? Nah, I dont like em. But this should have a category all to itself. Creamy luxurious deliciousness.

Bottle at Tekethopa
Admitting its not my favorite style, I still found this is a good beer.
Very dark brown color, good sized head.
Aroma of toffee, roast, and lots of malt
Sweet and malty taste, some red berries, alcohol. The sweetness sticks all way through the swallow, with spices and bitterness to balance it off.

Very malty aroma with a touch of roastiness and even a hint of marshmallow.  Very dark with a solid and lasting head.  A great balance of sweetness with bitter/roasty flavours.  Caramel and candy sweetness.  Almost oily viscosity.

~Rich toasty bread aroma. Light caramel with melanoidins. Light grape and prune, raisin. Chocolate. Overall liquid bread.
~Pours dark brown with garnet highlights. Small persistent brown head.
~Rich sweet bready melanoidin maltiness. Toasty, chocolate, borderline roasty
~full bodied, with low CO2, lingering toasty malt
~Enjoyable Doppelbock. I wish the fruit flavors would come out more in the flavor as they did in the aroma. I enjoyed this one, but if I was going to buy a Doppelbock I would go with another.

A: Dark chestnut brown in color, with a beige head that stands in at over an inch in height, leaving considerable lacing on the glass.

S: Toasted malt, sweet caramels, smoke. Very inviting, this smells like a world class doppelbock, which it certainly is.

T: Extremely tasty, with a subtle rauchbier / smoke flavor about it. A pleasant sweetness sneaks in among the smoke and toasted malt, but only enough to make the beer delectable, not cloying in the least. Toffee and bread with a splash of dark fruit are in there as well. This beer is so delicious and still very accessible, which I find very pleasing.

M: Medium to low in both body and carbonation. The beer is smooth, velvety and creamy on the palate, with alcohol content well disguised.

D: One of the best doppelbocks on the planet. A must have for any beer connoisseur.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 12-16-2010

UPDATED: AUG 8, 2013 Bottle; dark, dark brown with brick coloured tints showing through, no head; good dark fruit aroma, perhaps slightly roasted; tastes how it smells - sweetish baked fruits with a roasty edge; silky mouthfeel; wife says it tastes like Guinness - its a million miles better than that, but theres a grain of truth there; very easy to drink, very impressive.

Had again 07/02/13 - cant believe I didnt mention soft chocolate in my first review; anyway, a second bottle has confirmed its awesomeness and then some. A third bottle is on order. Beautiful stuff.

Had again 03/08/13 - as Ayinger Winter Bock (not knowing it was the same thing), drank it more purposefully this time and its excellence shone through - wasnt totally surprised when ratebeer led me back to this page.
Superb Doppelbock, A textbook example of the style yet unique to many I have had before. I cant recommend this enough, this beer is without fault.

has the aroma of honey, nice body, creamy and moderately astringent aftertaste. resembles a brown with a nice touch of honey. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Beermerchants.com. Pours dark as Coke with a big creamy light tanned head.Aroma is rich, caramel and toffee, light roasted malts. Taste is even more wealthy, smooth and sticky mouthfeel, caramel, toffee, dark ripe fruits even some sherry notes in here, alcohol is very well integrated in this great beer.

Bottle from Cornelius. Outstanding beer. Faultless on every front and a very very pleasant surprise. Great pour of rich darkness and just-right creamy head. Liquorice finish with hardly any alcohol despite ABV. Warming, complex and classy!

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2012 Pours a dark brown color with an inch thick foamy head that lingers awhile.  Big caramel malt aroma with hints of flowers, licorice, and light fruit.  Taste is lots of caramel malt and fruitiness.  Finish is very smooth, still very malty with some smokiness that lingers a bit.  Taste a little cocoa too.  Theres a nice syrupy, chewy mouthfeel throughout which is great.  A perfect doppelbock.

UPDATED: APR 19, 2015 Brown full lasting head.  Black colour.  Aroma is malty, fruity (figs, dates and dark cherries) with dried fruits and light roasty notes. Flavor is malty too with fruity (dark cherries, raisins and dates) with light dried fruits tones, slightly wooden, ending in a moderately fruity finish.  Medium to full bodied.
Strong aroma. Very malty. Pours very smooth, and doesnt have much of an after taste. Very good brew. I enjoyed it.

You either like it or you dont, but a beer doesnt get more doppelbock than this.  Roasty and sweet - almost like licorice.  It is amazing how the malt is so complex yet so light in body.  This is a must try for style geeks.
My favorite beer. This tastes like beer cake, the maltiest beer you will ever have. Goes great with steak, chocolate, or a recent divorce.

A great smell and lovely color, Celebrator is inviting. The taste is a pleasant though the strong aftertaste is a bit sour. Overall this doppelboch is a delicious beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330 ml bottle from Whole Foods Market, Coddingtown, Santa Rosa, CA. Pours a dark brown/burgundy color and a fine long lasting tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, rye, Pumpernickel, pistachios, hazelnuts, toasted grains, prunes, licorice and dark olives. Amazing. Taste is wonderful: Roasted sweetness and dark fruits shine on over an earthy, bready taste in the back. Incredible and refined! Towards the end I even feel a fig flavor counterpoint. Roastiness prevails over the caramel sweetness making this one a fantastically balanced Doppelbock. Medium to big body, not as bold as, lets say, Andechsers, but more refined. Alcohol almost unnoticeable. Smooth and silky in the palate. World-class and the best German beer Ive tasted so far.

Pours dark hazy brown with a two finger head. Aroma is nice floral and sweet notes. Strong hoppy flavor but not too bitter. Low carbonation and light bodied. Full flavored. Leaves a little malty aftertaste. Not bad for its style. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Super sweet aroma with a nice fluffy head.  Very sweet, overly thick.  Layers of dried fruit (most on the plum side of things).  A huge amount of residual sugars.  Amazing carbonation = great head that slowly leaves nice lacing.  Not sure if this deservers all the praise it gets, but quite good.
dark brown with small head. sweet and caramel. too many flavors going on for me. just not a big fan of the style. its decent, just not my thing.
Had this on tap at American Social, perfectly smooth full doppelbock. Very subtle hops with a nice roasted malt.

Very dark brown body, small off white head. Nice aroma of burned malts, caramel, coffee and nuts. Smooth, perfectly carbonated palate. Sweet malty flavour with coffee, some chocolate, lots of burned caramel. Very nice.

UPDATED: JUL 9, 2012 Aroma is strong caramel and alcohol. Pours clear dark brown-caramel. Carbonation is fizzy and finish is abrupt and a bit bitter. Taste is caramel malt and alcohol (alcohol itself tastes not so good so I would prefer if it wasnt so distinct). Head is minimal, almost no foam at all. Overall a nice beer which matches chocolate nice too!
Soft palate of caramel and nuts. Very nice appearance and it laced well. Easy on the palate, very drinkable, but it faded out quickly. A nice beer.
Pleasent, spicey spicy aroma. Pours dark. Nice balanced with a strong roasted flavour, and a slightly nutty and slighty chocolate tone. Very bitter aftertaste however.

Great. The nose is caramel, toffee, with smaller notes of chocolate, roast, and dark fruits. The beer is the deepest of browns with a fading beige froth and no lacing. In the mouth the caramel turns to a nuttiness and the roast flavors begin to stand out. Full bodied and a touch of bitter dryness in the finish. This is an excellent beer.
Why does this initially taste like grape soda??? The flavor changes as you drink it, but I swear it starts out with a really sweetish grape taste!

Bottle 11.2 oz.:  Pours a very dark brown with medium tan/beige head. Aroma is light roasted malts, caramel, dark fruits and nutty. Flavor is light roasted malts, caramel, medium sweet, dark fruits, nutty, little chocolate and a little bitter. Great full body with a creamy texture. Outstanding Dopple! One of my favorites.

24/06/2012 330ml bottle bought @ Grillo Brillo then shared @ La Tana. Bruna, intensa, limpida, schiuma bianca non moto abbondante e poco persistente. Al naso intensi sentori di malto, caramello, lieviti, esteri, banana, frutta, off flavour, funghi, muffa di cantina. In bocca è complessa, ha un attacco dolce, maltato, con sentori di banana e un finale amarognolo molto lungo. Corpo medio, carbonazione soft. Gran bella birra.

33cl bottle. Poured a dark brown beer with a good formation of a tan head, nice lacewrk, perfect lasting. Aroma is sweet with caramelish hints. Flavour has notes of caramel, toffe, dry fruits where nuts and almonds are present. The final is slightly sweet with a good balanced. Creamy on palate. Body is medium to high. Carbonation is medium.
Smells of sweet malt, raisins, a nut of some kind that I cant put my finger on. This beer is dark, with a tan head. The taste is very complex, dark, nutty, but sweet and well-balanced.

Bottle from Total Wine in Claymont.  Pours is between deep red and black with a small head that dissipates quickly leaving a film on top.  Aroma is very malty with some nuttiness and spice present.  Taste is incredible with a bunch of bittersweet chocolate followed by a really fresh sweetness.  Its hard to describe.  The palate is perfect, absolutely perfect.  This is killer!
Bottle: pours a dark color with big head. Smell of roasted malt, coffee. Taste is smooth, roasted flavor. This is my first beer of this kind. Very good.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Botella de 330ml. Copa Stem de mahout. Saboreada en jun´12. Color marrón y tintes rubí a contraluz. Espuma de burbuja pequeña, cremosa y de color bronceado. Corona que se disipa lentamente y deja una fina capa que se mantiene hasta el final. Aromas florales, trazos de chocolate, maltas tostadas dulces, notas de corteza de pan y fragancias de levadura y lúpulo Noble. Entrada muy gentil de malteado dulce y chocolateado seguida de un maargo muy suave. Paladar aterciopelado y cremoso. Leve sabor de fruta oscura madura en el intermedio envuelta en chocolate fundido. Cuerpo intenso y carbonatación suave. Sutil lúpulo y toque de café dulce en el largo final. Muy placentera y fácil asimilación.
330ml. Mahou Stem Glass. Enjoyed on jun´12. Real brown color, ruby to the light. Tan, creamy, small bubbled froth. Slowly dissipated crown, thin layer left til the end. Floral aromas, hints of chocolate, sweet toasted malts, bready crust notes, yeast & Noble hops fragancies. Very kind chocolate & sweet malty upfront followed by soft bitterness. Creamy, velvet, palate. Slightly ripe dark fruit flavor in the middle involved in fudge chocolate. Full body, soft carbonation. Subtle hoppiness & sweet coffee touch into the long finish. Very pleasant & easy drinkability.

super sweet plum-y aroma. silken texture with layers of dark fruit. really nice, subtle hop balance. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Awesome beer.   Drank for the first time on Mike D_s 40th.  Quality all around.   Dark malt with a smooth flavor.

E una bomba. Piccola parentesi di lode va anche alla bottiglia, stilisticamente ineccepibile con la miniatura del caprone allegata. Naso potente di prugne, fichi e una punta di malto torrefatto. Al palto subito ricca e complessa. Datteri e fichi e un sapore fruttato generale la fanno da padrone. Il tutto condito dal malto tostato e una punta di luppolatura. Estremamente elegante ed equilibrata. Questa è una signora birra.

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2012 Aroma and taste of chocolate and bread. Finely carbonated, pouring  purple-brown with a lovely mouthfeel. Not much to criticize.Ayinger knows what?s up and they keep pumping this chestnut out, unchanged for years. God bless ?em.

Bottle. Very dark brown pour with a tight thin head. Not much aroma but a rich taste. Medium dark malt flavors. Semi-sweet chocolate coffee. Dried strawberries. Rather full body with some decent carbonation. Clean but heavy. Feels like a bit of a meal. Dark notes but a soft finish.

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2012 Bottle. Pours brown with ok head, smallish. Aromas of tar metallic prunes chocolate. Medium body, complex dark toffee, coffee lingering, noble hop flavors behind the big big malt, lingering complexity burnt flavour metallic acid and a light yeast.

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2013 Very roasty aroma with some milky hints.  Pours to a deep dark brown color and large head.  Taste is chocolate smoothness at first, almost brown ale-like, then some roast, burnt toast, and delicious bready malty finish.  ABV hits a little too much in the sinuses afterward for my liking, but this is a doppelbock, so that is pretty standard.  An excellent beer that all geeks should try at least once.

Bottle bought at Beer Boutique, Putney, London. A dark brown almost black coloured pour with a medium beige head on top. Roasty, sweet dark fruit aroma. Tastes similar, sweet, dark fruit, roasty, malty, hint of bitterness. A complex doppelbock.

pour is extremely dark reddish brown with a tab head and a few large bubbles. The nose has very little roasted malt, may e none at all but there is something there akin, lots of berry sweetness, light bitterness and some marker.  The taste is heavy in toffee and berry. Brown sugar and caramel and faint coffee bitterness. Mouthfeel is a touch slick, lighter than anticipated, nice carbonation, semi dry finish.  Sweet but seemingly well attenuated and the bitterness fades with time. Toffee and berry start to blend. A touch singular but tasty.

Bottle @ home. Clear, dark reddish orange appearance with a decent sized brown head. Rich toasty caramel malty, somewhat grassy, light straw, dark fruity, plum aroma with a touch of grape. A bit smoky, roasty dark caramel malty, leather, dark fruity, slightly charred, caramelized sugary flavor. Not cloying like so many doppelbocks and more complex. Slightly smoky, charred aftertaste. Truly a pleasure to drink. I have no idea what its taken me three years since I last tasted this baby. Would love to try this against Andeschers offering.

Pours a deep brown with a beige head that dissipated quickly. Faint aromas of chocolate, raisins, and some bread. Tastes very creamy with a nice balance of roasted chocolate malts and yeast. Blankets the mouth and is silky smooth. Its lightly carbonated and has a slight alcohol burn. This is a fantastic brew and the one to which all dopplebocks are measured.

This is the first one of this style I have had. Looks great, like an imperial stout. Not much of an aroma. Nice and thick. Slight taste of raisin. Mouthfeel and appearance of an imperial stout, but not as flavorful. Reminds me of Beck's Dark, but stronger with less carbonation. I would certainly buy again....

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

[ASPETTO] 			
marrone scuro, quasi impenetrabile			
[SCHIUMA]			
color beige, media presenza, piuttosto fine e media persistenza			
[OLFATTO]			
prufomo maltoso, caramello, zucchero, un tocco tostato e note di frutta matura che si mescolano con sentori alcolici evidenti.			
[GUSTO]			
inizio dolce, malto in prima linea, con note caramellate e miele; segue un tostato con sentori di caffè senza però arrivare al torrefatto-affumicato. Ancora furtta matura e alcohol che chiudono la bevuta per un finale caldo e complesso.			
[TEXTURE]			
corpo medio,  consistente la palato, media carbonazione e alcohol evidente.			
[COMMENTO FINALE]			
buona doppelbock scura,  complessa e dinamica. Meno contundente del previsto anche se lalcolicità si fa sentire. Come per altre buone doppelbock scure, mi ricorda una sorta di strong ale belga senza quella freschezza fruttale data dai tipici lieviti. buona... la migliore ? non so, cè ancora un mondo la fuori che mi aspetta. grazioso il gadget annesso.

Dark brown, small tan head.  Aroma brown sugar, dark dried fruits, roasted things.  Medium body.  Easy to drink.  Complex flavors, malty sweetness, licorice, nuts, mocha.  Some hops.  All in balance.  Great stuff.

Nice sweet and rich brew. The pour is a dark brown, mostly opaque with a thin wisp of bubbly beige head. The nose is sweet and molasses centric with big nutty and toffee notes. Syrupy and rich flavor with molasses coming through alot. The finish has medium bitterness and a lingering toasted malt and smoke finish. Overall, nice balanced doppel.
